description:
This is one of the better gems in SF.  Spent the weekend there, and found it on Yelp so gave it a try.
Service: Excellent!
Food: Excellent!
I had the ravioli, and caprese.  The bread was also great.
Will definitely go again when back in SF.
author: Asher K.

description:
Always quick lunch service, the staff is attentive. Maybe a bit expensive for lunch given that the menu is not that big. 

Having said that I probably lunch there twice a week.
author: Christian J.

description:
The bucatini carbonera I had today from Pachino was so laughably bad I actually had to toss it. The bucatini was entirely overcooked and stuck together like mush. I wondered about the sauce, given its mysterious sticky yellow texture, if it was actually cheese or some other alien substance. I don't think it would be an exaggeration to say that this was the worst pasta I've ever had. A 10 year old could have made a better plate of pasta.

Clearly this was not an isolated incidence give that another user also had a similarly poor experience. Impossible that this is a 4 star restaurant. 

Guy at the counter was unfriendly. I'm over it.
author: Isabella S.

description:
There's nothing worst than spending the time and the money and walking out of a restaurant feeling unsatisfied.  NO WAY this is a 4-Star Yelp restaurant.  Both food and service are awful!  Take a look at the pictures: watery pasta, burnt pizzas, thickly crusted ravioli...  THERE's NO WAY THIS IS A 4-star YELP Restaurant.  You've been warned.  This place is a joke.

This is s small local restaurant in SF on Kearney Street, kind of a hole in the wall and tucked in between SF Chinatown and Financial District.  The restaurant seats probably no more than 30 people inside and they also added a couple of outdoor tables stretching the seating to the max.  There are only 3 guys working and they are BUSY.  2 servers, 1 cook.  

We had a Yelp reservation at 6:15 and arrived at 6:10 and were seated right away.  As we walked in, the food DID NOT smell good... that should have been a dead give away... but we persevered, trusting the 4-Star Yelp reviews.

Our party ordered the following -- and EVERYTHING JUST PLAIN TASTED BAD.  Was the chef off tonight or something!?!? 

1.  Cod Fish with Risotto $26.  Fish had absolutely no seasoning and tasted like nothing.  A simple salt and pepper could have done wonders.  Risotto was undercooked a bit and did not have the smooth texture.  It was like pieces of rice, a bit crunchy yet overwhelmed with cheese flavor.

2.  Ravioli $19.  Ravioli skin was too thick and too tough, also a bit sought to chew through.  Tomato sauce was watery. Filling was not flavored adequately.  An underwhelming dish... eatable but very blah.

3. Pappardelle Bolognese with "5-hr meat sauce" $17.  Typically you cannot go wrong with any pasta with meat sauce but they manage to screw this one up too.  The "5-hr meat sauce" was just this watery tomato sauce with small pieces of meat.  Pasta was cooked soggy and not al dente (as opposed to al dente risotto!!)  

4.  Verdure Pizza $17.  The pizza is where our whole dining experience went WAY south than it already has.  As if all the other dishes were not already bad enough... we took one bite into the pizza and it's lukewarm in the middle.  Yuck.  Have you ever had a crusty hot pizza yet the middle is just barely warm and dough is doughy?  Speaks to the uneven oven temperature.  

We spent the next 5 minutes trying to flag down our server who is busy rearranging tables to seat other parties.  By now, it's about 7 and the rush began.  We informed our server that the pizza is cold to warm on the inside and he snapped "What do you mean its cold?  It just came out from the oven?"  I replied "it's cold in the middle".  He huffed and simply took the pizza away.  No apology, no trying to understand.  Just rolled his eyes and went.   5 minutes later, he came back with the same pizza, now BURNT.  This is unacceptable.  At the same time, imagine the waiter and how he would reply if this time, I were to tell him that the pizza is now burnt!?!?  Anyway, by now, it's around 7:20 and I'm starving ... I typically don't eat the edges anyway so too a few bites and called it a day.  

What would have been a bad experience now just took a dive and went from bad to worse.  

Bad food, bad service, rude waiter, uncomfortable cramped seating... do yourself a favor and go to North Beach or Chinatown only a few blocks away.

Take a look at the pictures:  watery pasta sauces, burnt pizzas, thickly crusted ravioli...  THERE's NO WAY THIS IS A 4-star YELP Restaurant.  You've been warned.
author: Winnie W.

description: I ordered a pizza and when it was delivered, there was no tomato sauce! Absolutely none. I don't know how you forget such a main component of a pizza, but they definitely did. Instead, I paid $30 for what was essentially a small, sauceless, dry piece of cheese flatbread and toppings that would keep falling off. So disappointing.
author: Lillian B.

description:
This place is a joke. I feel like I got scammed! I came here for MealPal and received a meager looking dish of pasta with no meat despite ordering the bucatini carbonara. Alsoooo there was no sauce. See attached pictures (expectations vs reality)

Definitely not coming back again. Avoiding this place.
author: Alicia L.

description: I ordered spaghetti w/meatballs for lunch. I am giving one star because I bit down on a hard piece of what I thought was ground bone from the meatball, but it was a piece of sharp metal, possibly from opening a can. Luckily, I did not swallow it. This could've been an expensive hospital bill!  Totally lost my appetite and will never return to this restaurant!
author: Donna N.

description:
One of the worst delivery food I've ever eaten. Pasta was overcooked and bland...

My friend's order wasn't any better. Really surprised to see them at 4 stars as of writing this review.
author: Tristan T.

description:
I hadn't been to an authentic, casual Italian place in a long while, and this place was amazing. The service was lovely, the food was amazing and not overpriced, and the ambiance takes you out of the stressful FiDi and puts you into a calm Italian state of mind.

Please check this place out. I was too hungry and didn't get a shot of my food. I had the Rigatoni Salsiccia and it was delectable, so good.
author: Mia C.

description:
The service was great, but when we ordered the carbonara, it felt like they didn't really put too much effort in the dish - a very very light cream sauce with a 4-5 chopped pieces of thin, overcooked bacon was all that was in my bowl... for $16! The thin bacon sprinkles were overcooked to the point of being extremely crunchy and burnt. The sauce itself lacked any flavor, being very bland, watered down, and having no creamy flavor often expected from this dish. So after the waiter sprinkled pepper on, all I could taste was the pepper and bland noodles. 

Overall really disappointed. Maybe the other dishes are better, but I won't be coming back to check.
author: Kevin S.

description: Dinner for two was perfect! Briefly here in San Francisco and wanted something kinda light. Pizza Margherita Extra was perfect! Burrata cheese melted over San Marzano tomatoes anointed with olive oil and fresh, fresh basil. The crust was not to thin with a good bottom char, texture and especially flavor. Good ingredients cannot make up for bad technique. This had it. Definitely some pizza skill and just like you get in Florence or Naples. It was refreshing to get such authentic Italian fare. Followed it with the Buccatini seasoned with Prosciutto, Italian Parmesan, and olive oil. This place is not rushed and Tony makes you feel like family even though it was our only time here. A very pleasant surprise. Can't wait to be back. Gracie Mille!
author: Gregory G.

description: The worst Ceasar Salad I've ever eat...  all me lettuce was old and black... terrible... I spend $21 for the trash... it was old lettuce, unflavored chicken and a very bad mayonnaise...
author: Fabiola H.

description:
Ordered through Mealpal app for lunch. Opened up the box to a dismal looking but mediocre tasting spaghetti.

Pros:
+ Walked in and didn't have to wait to pick up
+ Not awful, but not spectacular 

Cons:
- Such mediocre spaghetti

Ordered:
- Spaghetti dell Nonna

The dish lacked flavor and didn't look appetizing. I hate to use this as a comparison, but Cheesecake Factory makes a more appetizing and delicious spaghetti and meatballs. Of course, my favorite meatballs will always be those from Beretta. Oh my meatballs. I do have to point out their timeliness with having my order ready by my scheduled pickup time. Well played there!

Would I order again or try actually sitting down here to eat? Nah.
author: Fanny W.

description: Grazie! My Italian cool amigo invited me to here for eating Italian professional cuisine. We eat the same Classic Pizza(Margherita) and that's too large to eat by one time. But really really delicious, that's a real Italy. I want to come again with my newcomer, of course with him also. And actually I cannot eat full of that, so I took out after eating.
author: Shun Y.

description: A quaint little place in an alley off Kearny street. There's about 5 or 6 tables in total. We got there and ordered the margerita pizza with onions on it. It was done fairly quickly but they forgot the onions. We told the waiter (the owner I believe) and he apologized. The pizza was about 8 small to medium sized slices and was delicious. Good for 2 people to share or 1 person if you're really hungry. I think the waiter/owner felt bad about forgetting the onions and brought us some sweet biscuits. Great service, mediocre food, and a small and peaceful atmosphere. Would I return? Probably not, unless I was in the area and it was the only place open.
author: Rocky H.

description: Ok first this place was sus (suspicious)   Ok who delivers a salad that is already dressed. Maybe it was to hide the fact that the salad was old. And what a waste $$$ PEOPLE WTF!!! And don't get me started on the pizza. It was COLD!   C O L D!!!!!!!! Cold. Like wtf. WTF!!!!!!!!! Like such a waste of fricken money.  So sus   And let me just get this clear I chose the place because  they said it was faster delivery than others but the food was 20 minutes late. Oh and back to the pizza the cheese was hard and wouldn't even stay on the the pizza and the pizza was insanely small.  So overall I know I'm never going to order from there every again.
author: Sadie L.

description: Wish the rigatoni was more creamy. Nice location and vibe inside the restaurant -- seems like a good photo op!-- but otherwise doesn't seem to be worth the money. This is a 4-Star restaurant but as the reviews indicate, people find it polarizing depending on their expectations for food.
author: Zachary T.

description: Yelp delivers again, late night arrival to Ritz Carlton & this pops up, OMGoodness! Pizza & wine selection were perfect.
author: Dan P.

description: This was not Italian food. It was the mass-produced style stuff you'd eat at your cafeteria. They had shakers of parmesan cheese on the table--the sign of a lack of effort for the freshly grated stuff. No fresh pasta either. My cat is a more skilled cook.
author: Sammy R.

description:
I work in the financial district and eat at this restaurant weekly not only is the food superb maybe the best pizza that I've had in the city but also the staff is amazing and you always feel like you're in someone's home.

I highly recommend that you stop in for lunch dinner whether you are a local or have friends visiting.
author: jim a.

description: I went here on a business outing with my coworkers on a whim. Some of the best pizza I have had in the area. I got the personal pizza. Thin crust, plenty of flavor. Finished it off with dessert and espresso chaser. Great casual dining with a touch of class. Will be returning.
author: Ryan P.

description: Simple, rustic, pizza and pasta.  SF restaurant veteran Antonio Spinoso knows what he's doing, so the quality and the service are always on point.  Prices are reasonable. It's small but cozy, with indoor and outdoor seating. Perfect for business lunch, casual pizza, family gathering, or romantic dinner.
author: Mike S.

description: If there is better Italian food in the Bay, I can't imagine where it would be.  Their food tastes like love feels.  Incredible!  I had tortellini soup today ... nirvana in a bowl.  Homemade tortellini, of course.  They are always coming up with something new and creative.  It's so homey, customers feel like they've been invited into their kitchen!  Much love to Tony and Antonio for feeding me all the time!
author: Lee B.

description: I've finally found a great Neapolitan pizza that I can order for delivery! Pachino makes a quality thin crust 'za that travels well, as opposed to so many others we've tried. Had a delightful pepperoni pie that had generous cheese and high quality pepperoni. Almost had a sweet taste to it. Crust was crisp and chewy. Give this place a try!
author: Lee P.

description:
I came here at 11:30am for a work lunch and there was no one dining in yet. The waiter was super nice and answered all our questions regarding the menu.
I ordered the lasagna and regretted it so much. Please see my pictures for reference. There was basically no cheese inside. It was just pasta/ sauce/ pasta. It felt like I was eating a pasta crepe with all the empty layers. It was really disappointing. 

My coworker got the pizza and said it was amazing. I guess that's the thing to order here.

I wasn't a fan of the complimentary bread they gave either. They were in shapes of little circles and reminded me of a thick cracker. They were super hard too.
author: Annie N.

description: Came back here after a while the place is still as good as I remember. As other reviewers mention, it does get really busy at peak lunch hour. I highly recommend you time it and go when the rush is over, like a 1pm. Sit back, relax, eat pizza, have a glass of wine and have a chat with Antonio (which you can do after the lunch rush).
author: Jesper J.

description: This was small but cozy and the food was absolutely delicious! We ordered the pachino pizza which was a perfect combination of ingredients and the classic pepperoni for the kids. We also got the beet salad which was amazing. The rigatoni with sausage mushrooms and the light cream sauce was my absolute favorite pasta but the kids argues that the lasagna and the parpadelle was just as good if not better. I've never seen food disappear so quickly from the table! We topped it off with 3 desserts all mad in house which were all light, not too sweet and a perfect end to the dinner. We ordered the strawberry panacotta, Carmel cheesecake and the limone tarte which all came with homemade crem fresche! I would definitely recommend this great little gem to anyone visiting SF!
author: Yunkyung C.

description: The service is ok. People are so kind. But pizzas taste are not good.( I ordered 4 vegetarian pizzas).
author: Ali Z.

description:
I came here with a group when in town for work. We made a reservation on Yelp and got seated with no problem. 

The space is pretty small. Easy for small parties but we were a little cramped with 5. Seems like a great spot for a casual date night. Our waitress was working the entire restaurant and did a great job for the most part you could tell she was stretched thin. 

Our group shared some appetizers, wine and a few pizzas. I can't remember everything we ordered but we really all of it. Depending where you're seated, you can watch the one chef/cook working hard at this mom and pop shop. Overall a solid spot for traditional Italian food and wood-fired pizza.
author: Aaron B.

description: I've been to this place twice, on two separate work trips. It was good enough for me to come back a second time. It can be a bit tight depending on how many are in your party, but otherwise the food is great. Personally I think their pizza is wonderful.
author: Mike P.

description: Ordered online, was staying at the Hyatt the person who answered the phone gave me some crazy attitude. All I wanted to tell him is that my room # was never asked for!! Dude was ready to drill me a new one. Reason I'm giving it 2 stars? The meatballs were pretty bomb!!! Pizza was as cold as the temperature in San Francisco 60°. Next time I'll go in person... blah
author: Jose G.

description:
This was a great central place for a group of us to get together. However, this also dictated the price. I ordered the angel hair, and it was delicious. One of us ordered a spaghetti and commented that he could have made that at home. At the end, we ordered a tiramisu, and although I thought it was good, I felt like it was missing something. All in all, I wouldn't come again unless I want to pay for overpriced Italian food due to convenience. 

Random tangent: the restroom was horrid. It was out back, down a flight of stairs, stinky and flooding with sewage.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Great casual Italian dining experience. 
The food reminds me of some great meals we had in Rome and Florence. The ingredients were so tasty and fresh. Excellent menu .With all the great places to eat in SF, we came here twice in our 5 day trip.
author: Tim H.

description: Last minute booking on a Friday night. The space is small but not cramped. Like a neighborhood trattoria in Italy. The pasta and pizza ordered were very good. The pizza crust was thin and soft, but generously topped. Would definitely return.
author: Ron T.

description: This is real italian food! The pizzas are just amazing with its secret recipe of patty and fresh ingredients! Honestly the best pizza I had in the US! Charming location and friendly service! So yummy!
author: Julia Z.

description: Food was wonderful, man I spoke to on the phone was even more wonderful. Kindest service! Will definitely order again when I am back in town.
author: Jordan D.

description:
The people were very nice. And the place was very busy on a Friday night. But the food was average. 

We had:
Margherita  pizza
Spaghetti Nonna
Bucatini carbonara
Pappardelle bolognese

All were fine. None had any "wow I want more of that" factor.
author: Lewis C.

description: We made Yelp reservations at 9 pm and still had to wait 20 minutes for a table. That didn't bother me since the food was legit. But, I finally realized that I'm the epitome of basic bitch, Uggs and all. This is an authentic Italian restaurant, and out of everything they offered, I ordered the pepperoni pizza. Yes, it was delicious, but I should have branched out a bit. It's a good thing that I eat off my date's plate. He had the beet salad and ravioli. I've never met a beet that I didn't like. Back to my pizza, it was  fantastic: not too much sauce, perfect amount of mozz and pepperoni. The restaurant is small, and it fills up quickly. Nice little spot for a quiet dinner.
author: Ha D.

description:
Made a reservation for 12 PM lunch on a weekday for 12 people. They were able to accommodate us all but we pretty much took half the space.

Ambiance: Casual 

Service: a little rushed, not stellar, but not bad either

Food: we ordered a myriad of pasta dishes - 

Very plain. We had to add a LOT of salt and parmesan. Everyone that ordered ut felt the same way
- Angel hair with seafood
- Cioppino
- Pappardelle Bolognese 
- carbonara 

Uncooked pasta - but flavour ok
- Rigatoni with truffle

Garlic Bread-  not enough garlic - and seemed like pizza dough 

Pizzas - seems to be the best thing here. made from scratch


Overall - pretty average. nothing spectacular but not bad either. Wouldnt come back
author: Mily W.

description: Really wanted to like this restaurant but the food was subpar, small portions, and overpriced. Service was decent.
author: Oscar H.

description:
What are you waiting for. Extraordinary pasta dishes. First time here. Bucatini Carbonara.  Simply heavenly. 

I can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu.  

Back again. Couldn't resist having the Bucatini again. Unbelievable.
author: John P.

description: I ordered prosciutto e burrata, served with pizza crostini, and arugula sauce, Pachino tomato, and pesto. I definitely did not receive what I ordered, you can clearly see that in the picture. I was extremely hungry and excited for my food until I opened it. I wish I could give them negative stars and get my money back. It's absolutely ridiculous and I'm still starving because I couldn't stand to choke down the dry nasty pasta I ordered alongside this dish. I should have just made some spaghetti at home with some cheap caned sauce and added zero seasonings because it would have been way better than what this restaurant gave me.
author: Molly C.

description: Very good pizza. I ordered their Vendure pizza from Mealpal today and it was hot and ready when I arrived to pick it up. It tastes great and the vegetables and sauce taste fresh. Would eat here again without Mealpal if I were to come with friends.
author: Donte J.

description:
they had shitty cutlery, plastic cups, no olive oil, pizza was overdone, and I STILL paid 22 dollars for my meal?? 

there's better spots nearby whether you want a nice date spot or just quality pizza.
author: Lucas D.

description:
This is a 4.5 star restaurant for me.

Although I've never been to Italy, this place felt like I was dining there. If you're looking for a quaint and authentic Italian cuisine experience, take my word for this! Great customer service. Very humble and kind people working here.

Now, take note that some of the items on the menu are superb and others are just ok. I went with several friends and we all ordered different things. Keep an eye out for the special items on the wall.. they are special for a reason!

*DIVINE DISHES* (drools)
1. Angel Hair with seafood
2. Tortellini with rib eye

These items are pricey, but the flavors will not disappoint.

Just OK:
- Spaghetti
- Carbonara
- Tiramisu
author: Jenny H.

description:
Oh man, Pachino's is deliciouuus!! I'd imagine this is what dining in Italy must feel like. The atmosphere inside is cozy, and intimate, with high ceilings, and seems like a good place for a date, although there was a family in there with young kids so I guess it works too.

My aunt and I came on a Monday night and found the restaurant full, but the owner(?)/manager made way for us and gave us a seat despite is not having reserved a seat.

As we ordered our meal, we'd noticed we weren't given the starter of sliced bread :( but we were ok with it because we'd ordered a pizza and pasta, so we'd get our fill of carbs there!

We'd ordered:
-parma classica pizza: I was craving prosciutto on pizza, and this satisfied it! Cooked in a fire over pizza, the pizza tasted wonderful. The prosciutto and the arugula balanced each other well atop the mozzarella and tomato sauce pizza. Usually I don't eat pizza crusts (sorry to all the pizza crust aficionados!) but this pizza crust was so goood I ate the whole darn slice!
-rigatoni something (oops, forgot the name of this one) but I was expecting rigatoni pasta along with the sausage and zucchini, but instead the pasta used was cellentani. Despite that, the pasta was simple with its cream sauce, but also very tasty.

Only thing I wish I'd done differently was order wine to go with my meal! Overall a good restaurant, the owner was friendly and checked up on us, and I'd return again to try other dishes.
author: Mary F.

description:
I ordered Pizza with mushroom and paid extra $4
Didn't received any mushroom
Pizza was cold.
Also ordered burrath cheese , arrived without the toast 
I don't understand how they have 4 red start
author: Efi S.

description: Delicious food and very nice atmosphere. This is definitely a diamond in the rough. I highly recommend it
author: Robert L.

description: We had high expectations coming to this Trattoria, with the overall 4 rating on Yelp. Our party ordered 3 plates including the Black Cod over Crab Risotta and Pesto, Pappardelle, and the Spinach Ravioli, also the Verdure Pizza.  The fish dish was not good, kind of flavorless.  The pasta dishes were blah and amateur at best.  To top this the pizza was not hot and warm to cold in the middle - yuck.  I told this to the waiter and his only comment was, "It just came out of the oven."  He was not apologetic, and pretty much just threw the pizza on the kitchen counter and proceeded to take an order at another.  Avoid this place at all costs please.
author: Elmo W.

description: Very fresh ingredients and homemade pasta. The ravioli and pasta with eggplant sauce are very good. Close to Union Square and Chinatown.
author: Melanie R.

description:
Very good Italian food just a few blocks away from Union Square.

For starters, we had their Caprese Salad. Overall it was okay. Needed a little more balsamic vinegar and olive oil. 

As entree, we had their Lasagna Bolognese (which was very good) and their Diavola Pizza. We asked if they could add meat balls to the pizza and when it came, they had just placed two meatballs on the center of the pizza instead of chopping it up and spreading like a regular topping. After chopping it up ourselves and spreading it around, it tasted just like we were expecting it.
author: Amanda P.

description:
Pros:
-I ordered the Diavola pizza. Tasted good, and it was a good size. I also like that you can see the pizza oven that it is cooked in.
-Nice ambience.
-Small and quaint.
-Friendly service. Personable. 

Cons:
-My wife had the lasagna. It tasted like it was reheated. Not saying it was, but it just tasted that way.

Overall, a good spot to visit. 4 stars.
author: Matt T.

description: We discovered this gem because we needed a place that was able to accommodate 9 people last minute and he was able to do it! The place is small but very cozy. The food is fantastic! You can taste the fresh pasta and the flavorful sauce. Great home cooked meals! The pasta portions are just perfect and not over the top. The pizzas are out of this world! Reminds me of my visits to Italy. We ordered the Pappardelle alla Bolognese, ravioli and classic margarita and Parma pizzas. I only managed to get a pic of one pizza because everyone dug in before I could pull out my phone! We plan to go back before we hear back home.
author: Linh T.

description:
We had hands down the best ravioli I've ever had, the rare sort of dish that requires a moment of silence for its passing.
The service was great and the atmosphere pleasant to a fault.
author: Jamie F.

description:
My Trattoria is there. Very good Calzone and not Fougasse (see my review on Calzone's). The best Italian restaurant for me in San Francisco. It's there since 30 years and the boss is discreet and he knows how to accompaign you during your lunch. "Not too close not too far", he comes when you need. You can talk with him after lunch about everything. 
The canoli there is not the best of SF for me. Just a sweet for the end of the meal. An authentic trattoria for me. 
It's funny how I found it : I saw many people having a pizza box in their hands, I was surprised, because I didn't see any Italian restaurant around and after walking on the street in many ways I've finally understood that it was this restaurant.
author: Marie-Claire L.

description:
Came here once a long time ago with a friend since we were craving pizza. I believe we got something similar to a pepperoni pizza. It had a thin, crispy crust with delicious tomato sauce. I'm very particular about my red sauce and thought that Pachino's is super good with it.

The next time I went, we got pizza and a seafood angel hair pasta. The pasta was good, but it was kind of a small portion for the price of the dish. I also got a bruschetta appetizer. I was kind of surprised by its lack of tomato. It instead had some kind of honey and other stuff. I really enjoyed it!
author: Stephanie K.

description: The pizza was so soggy. I asked the server and he said it is supposed to be that way. The crust was so wet we ate one slice each and left. The gnocchi was under seasoned as well. Probably the worst meal I have had in San Francisco. Save yourself some time and go get a street dog.
author: Aaron L.

description: Best pizza I've had in a long time! All fresh ingredients, especially the cheese, made all the difference. The ambience felt like I was in a small cafe restaurant in Italy- large groups laughing and enjoying wine, tight eating space, kind staff. The wine was a perfect pair to my meal as well! I would suggest getting there early for dinner. Although they are quick, by the time we left there was a little wait.
author: Beth M.

description:
Excellent pizza. The grille peach salad was delicious as well. 

It is small and busy, but we were able to get in and out in decent time still. Worth it.
author: Marcella M.

description:
I stressed about finding a quiet conversation stop with great food that would keep my world traveler foodie friend and former professor of mine happy. 

It had been four years since we last dined together, and I was so overwhelmed with finding the perfect restaurant in the big sea of options! Thanks to my handy dandy Yelp app, Pachino Trattoria & Pizzeria checked every box for me...for us! It was a huge win. 

If you've been to Italy, you'll appreciate the authenticity of the service, food, and atmosphere. The owners of this place are the real deal. The menus are simple with a refined selection of classic Italian favorites...and big win for me...I didn't suffer from the too-much garlic stomach syndrome after my pasta. 

We started with a nice glass of prosecco and ordered up a beautifully-presented and deliciously fresh caprese salad. Then we ordered two past dishes to share--pasta carbonara and pappardelle alla bolognese. The winning dish, by far, was the carbonara. It was rich and lightly creamy with a generous portion of bacon. Sorry, but I didn't think the bolognese sauce was flavorful enough. I also expected it to be heartier. 

For dessert we opted for lemon cake and cappuccino. The cake was truly moist and memorable. 

Low key. Authentic Italian. Dine in or on the back outdoor patio. Great for someone looking for a quiet dinner away from the hustle and bustle. 5-star customer service.
author: Angela S.

description: The pizza was piping hot when I went to go pick it pizza. Pepperoni was plentiful and tomato sauce and cheese were fresh and not overpowering. All in all, a great pizza for those days I want a homemade, thin-style pizza (which can be every day).
author: Fiona Y.

description: Hidden gem! The pizza was traditional and delicious made in a wood burning stove. The bruschetta was superb. The wine kept flowing. They made a long travel day end with a smile.
author: Martha M.

description: Very authentic Italian style pizza. The crust of the pizza is the best part it is soft and crisp all in the same bite. The topping of fennel sage sausage is the best, I believe it is made in house. It is an intimate setting for a first date or out with friends on the town. It is best to make a reservation (via Yelp!) in the evenings as it fills up by 6:30 PM quickly. Service was good, quick, and friendly.
author: J S.

description:
Authentic Italian food that made me think, "Have I transported back to one of the restaurants that line the narrow streets of Rome?"

THE PIZZA:
As a person who typically judges a restaurant's pizza by their margherita, I can confidently say that Pachino knows how to do authentic Italian pizza. There is nothing extremely fancy about their margherita, but what made it a star on the table was how exceptionally well it was done despite its simplicity. The crust was baked to the right texture, the sauce was sweet yet tangy, and there was the perfect amount of cheese on top. I only wished there was more than one basil leaf.

THE PASTA:
I ordered the Orecchiette Pachino, and while the sauce wasn't special, the freshly-made, al dente pasta made me want to constantly shovel pasta into my mouth. If the rest of their in-house made pastas are as delicious as their orecchiette, I highly recommend ordering (at least) one pasta dish the next time you visit!
author: Lisa T.

description:
I now understand why there is no on in the restaurant when I walked in at noon, smack in the middle of the financial district where every other place is packed. What is perplexing is this certainly does not match up the 4 star reviews on Yelp. Where are all the patrons if this place is any good?

This place is a joke. Another yelper posted pictures of the bucatini carbonera for MealPal and that was exactly what I got too: just some boiled noodles with a little bit of some disgusting butter substitute, and one sad looking piece of meat that is smaller than my pinky finger nail. So dry, so bland, like they didn't even want to waste salt crystals on this. There is nothing else other than the noodles, not even a sign of any garlic pieces. How is it that they are getting away with it - it's so sad it's funny. 

I'll have to say this is the most awful, most untrying Italian food I have ever had, if we can even call it Italian food.

Most utterly disgusting. I have to wonder how does a restaurant like this survive in the financial district? MealPal is a good way to introduce new restaurants - this is an opportunity for owners to capture future patrons, not push them away with terrible food. I've tried a great many places through MealPal that I wouldn't have otherwise walked into. If Pachino's does not want to be a part of MealPal, then just don't partner. Why serve something so substandard to give themselves a really bad rep. I really do not get it.
author: Julie T.

description:
I have ordered on Eat24.  Pepperoni pizza with extra pepperoni and caprese salad.  At first, they showed me the pizza that had very few pepperoni even if you did not order extra.  The host actually asked the chef if it was extra pepperoni, and the chef said yes.  The host asked: "Seguro?" ("Are you sure?" in Spanish), and the chef confirmed again.  Then, when I complained they said that they would make me another one.

So, the final pizza was not bad.  Caprese salad though had spinach instead of basil and very little balsamic vinegar.  It has also some pesto.
author: Pasha G.

description:
Cozy little place that a friend and I came across while Yelping for a place to meet for dinner.  The restaurant is small, intimate and the decor made me feel like it was in a little cucina in Italy. It was empty when we arrived about 5pm, but by 6pm, the restaurant was filling up.
The food was amazing, flavorful and did not disappoint. For two people, we ordered a salad, a pasta dish & pizza. There was 1/2 a pizza to take home. 
The waiter was very attentive and was very helpful with recommendations. I would definitely come back.
author: Kathy L.

description: Was able to get a last minute reservation through Yelp reservations for this restaurant. The burrata appetizer was up there with some of the best burrata I've had. Got the pappardelle alla bolognese and it was well done, but somewhat bland. I expected much more flavor. I'd go back and try a different dish though.
author: Jared M.

description: This place was super small but man was I impressed! The main person waiting tables might have been the owner was so nice. Gave us great recommendations and our food was out fast. It tasted authentic and I was thoroughly satisfied. Give it a try if you're in the  neighborhood. I don't think you'll be disappointed.
author: Miranda G.

description: Amazing food. Fresh selection. Great dining experience. The pasta was perfect Al dente and the tiramisu was different than anything I have had, but it was tasty!
author: Sean S.

description:
A very quaint but authentic Italian restaurant! The restaurant is very small so I definitely wouldn't come here with more than four people.

I had the tagliatelle with bolognese sauce which was light and savory. We also ordered the gnocchi which was a special that night. It came in simple marinara sauce but it definitely tasted more doughy instead of pillowy and chewy. 

The restaurant certainly has a warming family charm to it so it's a great quiet dinner spot .
author: Amanda K.

description:
Pros:
- Nice ambiance, tasty food

Cons:
- We ordered a simple espresso/affogato for dessert and waited 20 minutes in vain, watching the very lonely looking espresso machine. Eventually we were finally told that the machine was broken. Would've been nice if they'd just called it when we ordered...
- One of the waitstaff made SEVERAL off-color jokes about my ethnicity. "Ri-ga-to-ni, that's how the Japanese say it!" (me: "I'm not Japanese, but you tried...") "Where are you really from?" "If you are from America, then I'm from Sweden! Ha ha ha!" If you're at all Asian-looking, look forward to a generous serving of offensive commentary with your meal?
author: Angela L.

description: Great find! We were lucky to get a table tonight, the food is REALLY good. Highly recommend the Lasagna. Also the Tiramisu was great, creamy and freshly made. When we left there was a lot of people waiting to get in. We hope to come back :)
author: Andrea Z.

description:
Off and on, I've strolled on Kearny for the past twenty years because like a lot of FiDi working drones, I'm usually looking for lunch or where I'm supposed to meet former colleagues for drinks. I must have passed this place a hundred times without giving it a moment's thought, but for some reason, Jamie W. and I were feeling like Italian and didn't feel like venturing up to North Beach on a rainy evening. We settled into a rather snug table for two within the extremely compact space that makes up the restaurant. The kitchen is hidden on the way to the restroom in the back. The menu is pretty standard Italian, which was in line with what we wanted.

We were pleased to get warm sourdough rolls, one for each of us, which we slathered with olive oil (photo: http://bit.ly/21RunuZ). First up was a shared appetizer, the $12 Grilled Calamari which came on a small mound of Tuscan white beans with roasted peppers and arugula leaves (photo: http://bit.ly/24L5z6S). In hindsight, it was probably the highlight of the meal since the combination was unique enough to make the flavors stand out. Unfortunately the same can't be said about the $15 Bucatini Carbonara, which I found rather bland on its own and was in dire need of the red peperoncino flakes to give it any sort of life despite the crisped pancetta visible among the noodles (photo: http://bit.ly/1QwByQL).

Jamie fared better with the $16 Pesto Chicken, Sundried Tomato and Feta Cheese Pizza, a special that evening served rustic style with plenty of basil and cheese on top (photo: http://bit.ly/1QwBBMk). It was definitely more satisfying for the price than the bucatini. We gave the place another try a couple of weeks later, and our food selections were a bit more to our liking. For our appetizer, we tried the $11 Caprese Salad, which presented fresh mozzarella slices, grape tomatoes, and lightly dressed arugula as an Italian flag (photo: http://bit.ly/21Ruab4). This was certainly not the first time a trattoria served a caprese salad this way but it was a tasty starter.

For his entree, Jamie tried the $15 Spaghetti Della Nonna, which was as back-to-basics as you could get with a trio of big meatballs nestled on top, a bit mealy in texture despite the size (photo: http://bit.ly/1Rw3TV1), while for mine, I went for the $19 Spaghetti Frutti Di Mare, which despite the plethora of seafood, disappointed with the lukewarm temperature of the pasta (photo: http://bit.ly/1TDgpbJ). Yet, despite the restaurant's shortcomings, it's hard not to like a place that remains so serviceable on a busy stretch of Kearny where the worker drones demand everything to go, go, go. Yeah, we'll probably come back when we're in the mood for no-frills, no-fuss Italian food.

FOOD - 3 stars...pretty standard Italian fare with some hints of creativity
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...cute enough spot but quite tight when it gets busy
SERVICE - 4 stars...our server was on the ball
TOTAL - 3 stars...if you want quick Italian with no frills at a decent enough price, well abbondanza to you!
author: Ed U.

description: Fresh baked sourdough biscuits to die for...thick meat  lasagna lovely crab angel hair pasta..top off with a glass of Chianti..yum
author: Donna C.

description:
Really hate to give such a terrible review but I ordered the orechiette pasta for pick up on the phone. I even confirmed with the waiter that it had salmon in it as listed on the menu online. 

Literally picked up my food and got the most basic orechiette pasta with red sauce, some cheese, and eggplant for $17 which totaled about $19. So basically, I paid almost $20 for some basic, mediocre, tiny portioned, and overpriced pasta in the financial district. Seriously such a shame- next time I might as well walk another 10 minutes to north beach.
author: Connie W.

description: Got the pizza via MealPal and it's the best meal yet! Picked up exactly on time and it was still pipin hot! The staff was nice (the guy working the counter is HOT!). Excited to try their other menu items. Chow!
author: Eddie J.

description: Solid Italian food in America made by Italians. Not bad by any means but not exceptional either. The atmosphere was nice -- much better than most of the chains in the area -- and the staff was attentive and generally friendly. The food was okay but I felt little underwhelmed by both the flavors and the portions. The pasta is made in house but the ravioli was so thick it might as well have been frozen. And the sauces were kind of bland. Overall a decent place, especially for the neighborhood, but not worth going out of your way for.
author: M M.

description: Lovely choice for a cozy dinner if you're staying (or live/work) in the financial district. My friend & I came in based on Yelp recs & loved the pizzas; they have the usual wood-fired/Neopolitan-style options & you can also start with a Margherita & add your own toppings. Had interesting special pizzas too (more on that later). They do use San Marzano tomatoes and have buffalo mozzarella (as an option). The dough/crust was really good, really well developed flavor, and I love making my own pizza so I'm kind of particular about the dough & notice when it is especially good. A neighboring table had a green salad and it looked super fresh and good. Wish we had ordered one! They also had specials like a wild boar & broccolini pizza, & a gnocchi with Gorgonzola and spinach. I'm glad we decided to split dessert because the limoncello tote was so creamy & amazing with white chocolate curls on top. After we opted for dessert a four-top came in just for dessert so the yummyness on that front must be well-known. The afogatto (espresso w gelato) and tiramisu looked especially good. I think the owner & a family member were taking care of everyone- we felt super welcome. Tips: We made a last-min reservation on Yelp & they were ready for us & we noticed they were constantly checking for new reservations coming in and preparing tables for people. (I am always suspicious making a last-minute reservation because I feel like no one's going to know we're coming LOL) There we're also a few people who came in to order takeout, and they were really great about accommodating them as well, (I.e. Not making them feel like a burden as it sometimes happens when you are grabbing takeout) so you could do that if you really didn't feel like a dinner out and wanted to just eat at the hotel. On that note, this would be a place I would feel totally comfortable dining alone, as you sometimes end up doing when you are in a city by yourself on business. It was a lovely choice for our last dinner in San Francisco after we were seafood-out, as if that's possible LOL, and just wanted some good pizza comfort food. Just a sweet little place.
author: Jen R.

description: We discovered this restaurant and were exceptionally pleased. It is small but they work very hard to keep a nice atmosphere. The food is made fresh daily and the sauces are delicate and delicious. One thing I need to tell you - Don't forget the Cannoli.
author: Lloyd D.

description:
We walked into this restaurant after being frustrated that the restaurant we researched, wanted to go to, and went too, treated us rudely and closed one hour and 5 minutes earlier than posted and stated.  

Was a great turn of events.  This cozy little restaurant was simply fantastic.  The atmosphere, the friendliness of the waitress and staff, and the food were what you expect from a small family run type place that takes great pride and pleasure in what they do. 

My wife ordered her favorite dish spaghetti carbonara, and she said it was the best she has ever had anywhere. 

I ordered one of their specials, a calzone.  Woa, it was tasty, the crust crispy on the outside and soft and gooey on the inside. The sauce was perfect too. 

Just can't say enough about how much we enjoyed our visit to this restaurant.  Go and try it out, I know you will glad that you did
author: John P.

description:
Great little place

Zero pretension. Fresh food. Tasty

Calamari and caprese  salad to start. 

Calamari was not covered in breading.  Tasty!

Salad was fresh and came with a green sauce.  Good

Had a daily special risotto that came with sausage and a meaty broth sauce. Yummy!

A keeper 

And good value for downtown SF
author: Dave H.

description: Really good. Basic Italian options -- something for everyone. Very small, ~10 tables. Quick and friendly service. I had pizza and it was great -- thin crust, Euro style. I would return.
author: jd h.

description: Terrible food, terrible service, terrible business. Save the time and stomach ache, don't go
author: Zak D.

description: Try the calamari, the best I've had in this country. We had pizza and spaghetti and everything was outstanding.
author: Ken W.

description:
I've walked by this place dozens of times and never paid any attention until recently when one of my colleagues arranged an after work celebration dinner here. 

To my surprise and delight, everything was just perfect about the place -- service, selection, ambiance, quality, authenticity. I liked it so much during that first visit, that I invited my wife to meet me there for a date night out a few weeks later. My second visit confirmed my sentiments: this is a rare gem among the more mediocre choices in this neighborhood. This is apparently saying a lot, because the famous Belden Place food alley is right here along with a bunch of good places on Kearny (eg check out Sababa across the street for superb falafel).

One of the best parts about Pachino is the staff -- they make you feel welcome and cared for. But the food is tops as well -- top quality and made with love to near perfection. I've had the burratta with honey and hazelnuts, grilled calamari, pasta carbonara (actually served on buccatini -- nice!), pasta with eggplant, pasta with seafood, lemon cake, and -- holy wowza...the amazing tiramisu. And guess what? The owner tells me his specialty is pizza! Can't wait to try one of those on my next visit or the one after that or after that...

Anyway, get some good honest home style Italian here at Pachino. You'll love it. Maybe you'll get hooked like me.
author: J S.

description: Such a hidden gem. It's the definition of "hole in the wall" with an authentic approach to food. I've recommended and brought others to this place and each time, I'm the be one that looks like the connoisseur.  Highly recommended.
author: Ricky R.

description:
I love pizza more than most things but I respect myself too much to come back here for pie.

Sad, soggy pizza with low quality ingredients. 

There's no way around it. Inside is cute, service was actually adorable BUT the food was just no bueno and the pizza had about as much elegance as a double dipped beef sandwich from the midwest. 

So disappointing and didn't come close to living up to the cuteness of the space. I think this has finally sealed the deal for dining at any business that has a door on Belden... home of cute AF businesses that sadly seem to serve sub-par bar food. 

Was hoping for a little slice of Italy but got what turned out to be an over-cheesed saucy slop pile. Majorly bummed and too pizza heartbroken to mince words.
author: Candice G.

description:
Let me start by saying that I care mostly about the food and I don't post bad reviews if the service was bad or slow. This one was so bad that I figured I should warn the others.. so beware!

The good:
-The ambiance was cozy. The service at the beginning was actually OK. 
-The food was probably 3 stars. Nothing very good or tasty, and not too bad. We were a group of five, and most people agreed that the food was a bit bland but overall OK.

The bad:
-We ordered garlic bread for appetizer. The garlic bread instead came with the food. When we asked the waiter to take the bread because we wanted it as an appetizer, instead of doing so, they started arguing that it was our fault that the bread is late. I guess the waiter (or maybe it was the owner/waiter) took it personally. After this, the service was horrible: no water refills, they kept ignoring us, and they even did not take the dirty dishes from our table when/before they brought the check. My worse dinner experience ever! 

To top it off, when we were leaving, the waiter insulted us, saying "you are free to go"! This was a nightmare for us. Will never be back, and you should probably think twice if were thinking of going there.
author: Nima Z.

description:
We were lucky we got to eat here without reservations!

This little restaurant offers amazing Italian food. We came here on New Year's Eve and we were lucky to have been seated. This place probably can only seat 30 people at once.

We ordered their Caesar salad, tortellini a la vodka, and margherita extra pizza. Everything was really good. I liked their pizza the best. The crust was on point!

Food was fast, too. So during a busy night, make sure you make a reservation!
author: Kristie A.

description: Outstanding.  Ambiance & preparation were the real deal... Authentic.  Pizza was excellent. Would recommend highly.  Service was great.
author: Craig W.

description: My bf and I had reason to celebrate one Friday evening and while spontaneously looking for a good restaurant with pleasant ambiance, we found this great little gem in the SF Fi-Di! Check out their specials board as it changes with what's fresh and good. We enjoyed our lovely, tasty caprese salad, and we devoured our pancetta and onion pizza with a glass of rose - mmm! And we capped our meal with a scrumptious lemon cheesecake! I usually go for the tiramisu, but we couldn't resist this and it was worth it! What a nice dinner treat to find this place with such friendly, welcoming service. I would totally recommend this place for your next dinner get together!
author: Maile N.

description:
I tried out this place on other reviewers promises of an authentic and tasty meal. While the food was fine, it was definitely nothing to write home about. 

Food: 3/5 stars
Spaghetti Della nonna - this was basically just spaghetti with red sauce and meatballs. There wasn't any creativity here. While I believe you don't need to do a lot to make Italian food great, this didn't even really go higher than a bowl of spaghetti you make at home. 
Burrata - this plate was very tasty, fresh and a good portion size! However they should have used higher quality bread. 

Service: 2/5 stars
The waiter was very kind and obviously working very hard. However, the whole place only has about 7 tables, and it took us 25 minutes to get our first glasses of wine. Overall we were there for 2.5 hours, and not per our choosing! 

Overall, the ambiance is cute and the waiter was so nice, I had a pleasant visit. But there were some major disappointments (quality of food and service time) that will probably discourage me from coming back. If I'm going to pay for a dish I can make at home - it better be phenomenal!
author: Paloma N.

description: Good food and really fantastic service. Simple, tasty Italian food. I came here with a group of three, and ordered the garlic bread, caesar salad, lasagna bolognese, and the diavola pizza. The garlic bread wasn't what I expected (more like pizza dough sprinkled with parmesan), but it was addicting and great to sop any extra lasagna sauce with. The lasagna was tasty, but I do wish it had some more filling. I would definitely order it again though. My favorite was the pizza: nice crust and plentiful toppings.
author: Cynthia M.

description: Feeling fresh and high quality ingredients on every bite. This place is a very solid flag carrier of the Italian cuisine. Their homemade parpadelle with ragu is superb. Prochutto pizza is amazing. The atmosphere is very cute and warm. Highly recommended.
author: Fikret D.

description: Visiting San Fran for the weekend, and couldn't have picked a better place to eat! The pizza was amazing, tasted like it was from Italy itself. The salad was served beautifully and tasted great. The service was excellent. Everything came just as we had ordered it and there were no issues. They were extremely helpful and answered any questions we had regarding the food. I definitely recommend this place.
author: Sydney A.

description: Feels like being in my hometown. Small, cozy trattoria. Great pizzas, delicious main entries and appetizers. This is the authentic Italian restaurant that I will recommend to my Italian and American friends going forward.
author: Biemme B.

description: Yummy! I had a business trip in SF and walked around town looking for a place to eat. I randomnly passed this cute place and yelped it, with good reviews I decided to try it. First, great service, and advice on what to eat. The place is tiny but super cute and the pizza was delicious as was the wine. If you want an authentic little pizzeria, this is the place. Loved it.  I got the veggie margherita extra, with burrata and I highly recommend!
author: Katie E.

description: I'm making sure to regularly come here everytime I come in to town now Alessandro was a personable businessman who can speak a little Mandarin (who would've guessed) but a man of many hats for sure. Most importantly he is running one hell of a business here and it has really great food. We met some really great people tonight as well and topping the night off with complimentary shots of brandy was just what the Doctor ordered. Keep up the great work Alex and hope to see you soon. It's a small world after all.
author: Kenneth S.

description: I was surprised to see how tiny the place was when we first walked in but the food was amazing! Very cozy atmosphere. Would definitely recommend for all.
author: Jessica F.

description:
My fiancé and I had a lovely dinner there the other night. We started with the prosciutto e barrara appetizer, which is pesto drizzled toast with mozzarella cheese and prosciutto. 

My fiancé had the Pappardelle alla Bolognese which was fresh pasta with a flavorful meat sauce. 

I had chose the Ravioli because it came with pesto sauce but ended up very impressed with the marinara sauce as well. 

The service was wonderful. The restaurant is very small so you might want to call ahead to see if there is a table. We were lucky to grab one of the last open two tops. The waiter quickly came over with water and our food and drink orders were taken shortly after. The waiter seemed to be from Italy and was very welcoming and attentive. We will definitely return next time we visit San Francisco.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Nice authentic pizza with a variety of toppings available. Service was very good and fast. Negative is that it is a very narrow and small restaurant, so depending on your Party size, you may have to wait.
author: Mike S.

description: Wonderful dinner!  The owner was working and was great in helping us celebrate our daughter's 16th birthday.  The homemade ravioli was one of the best I've every had.
author: A M.

description:
I usually don't like writing reviews if I haven't even had the restaurant's food, but I thought this was a notable experience.

I don't even know how long my friend had been sitting at the table before I arrived. But as usual, I got there late. We probably took about 5 minutes to decide on what to eat, and then another 5 to actually get the waitress' attention so we could order. But once the waitress came over, she told us that she had to make a little adjustment to the menu - basically, they weren't serving any of their pastas.

Personally, I think that's outrageous. The employees failed to mention that when they seated my friend? The reason we were there is because their pasta seemed like a wonderful option. For someone who doesn't want pizza, there's really nothing else I could order. So we left. I'm not sure if that's rude or not, but I wasn't going to force myself to order a Starter as dinner or stuff myself with a 12" pizza.

I had really hoped to try their pasta. But I guess I won't get the chance now.
author: Athena C.

description: You might miss this place by just passing by. I stumbled on it by Yelp and called to see if they had room. Toni picked up and was so welcoming. While we couldn't get a reservation, I'm so glad we stepped out to go and take a chance on it. The food was delicious. We had the pasta dishes and the lasagna and every pasta dish was awesome. And the lasagna was so good! The ambience, food and people were what made it so special. Toni was such a great host. For dessert, we had dessert wine and biscotti, which was such a treat! We were visiting, but I still recommend it to all of my friends that live in the city and it will always be a staple now.
author: Elise K.

description: Made reservation on yelp, got there and found them closed.  No advance notice.  Forced to find another pizza place.  Uncle Vitos was great.
author: Jerry C.

description:
I'm on a three star binge!

I went here post drinks with some friends and it was ok. We were lured in my the cute little alley way with outdoor dining, but ended up sneaking in the back of this restaurant, walking through the teeny kitchen and grabbing a booth. The place is small, so if deciding to dine here on a weekend, I'd suggest a reservation if they take them.

We went for grilled calamari and a pizza to share, of course with a bottle of wine.

A few pros:
- Reasonable wine list. We got a nice bottle of red for about $30ish dollars.
- They give a big ole roll to start that fills ya up.
- The grilled calamari was actually good.
- Prices weren't horrible. A pizza, an app and a bottle of wine with tip = $85. It would of been better if we enjoyed it more, but read on.

The cons:
- Service was ok. We actually ordered two pizza's and he only put one in. That ended up in our favor as we were stuffed and disappointed after the first.
- The pizza wasn't awesome. Not bursting with flavor, soggy and might I use the word, soupy? Toppings falling off, including the cheese, a ton of extra water from the vegetables. I get it, as a huge pizza fan, it's hard. But, if this is one of the pizza's you offer, you should already have an understanding of all these factors and fixed them. Just sayin'.

Overall, there's better out there. We were tipsy, hungry and needing sustenance, so this spot worked.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: This place had awesome service and very friendly. We ordered the Ravioli and Margarita Pizza and it rocked my taste buds. Let me diverse on that, the pizza was a party in my mouth with amazing tomato sauce, the pizza crust it self was light and crunchy. - Again amazing. And the Ravioli comes with a dish of 5 pieces, it may seem little, but I guarantee it will rock your world. Definitely coming back to this great Italian restaurant as I support something great! :)
author: Skai C.

description: Amazing pizza!!  The owner told me to order the special of the day, so glad he did! 5 cheese, pears and radicchio!!  Lovely flavors. I knew it would be good when I walked in, the best smell ever!
author: Michele G.

description: Came here on a Weds night and it was half full. No wait to get a table of 2 and the staff was friendly. I ordered the angel hair crab pasta and margarita extra pizza. Based on the reviews I expected the food to be quite good but unfortunately it missed the mark. The food came out (too) fast, before a few other tables which was suspicious. The pasta was cooked well but the sauce wasn't not flavourful and there wasn't much crab. The pizza didn't taste fresh - crust was kind of hard and stale; cheese looked like it was previously melted, coagulated and then remelted; and the sauce wasn't cooked down (tasted metallic from canned tomatoes). Was quite disappointed and would not come back for the food.
author: Rachel L.

description: Great service! Nice little place with GREAT pizza! We got there about 9pm and there was plenty of places to sit. We were immediatly given water and then a few minutes later the waiter came by for the order.  He was attentive and checked in frequently. Pizza was cooked in the oven that we could see from our table.  GREAT pizza. Crispy crust, great sauce, plenty of cheese. I would go back immediatly.
author: Lisa S.

description:
I want to describe this place from edible point of view. Lol. The dish is really worth trying is 
Pachino. It is phenomenally yum yum. Very unique flavor unlike any other nachos I have ever had: a little sweet and a little salty.
author: Thomas K.

description:
Worst restaurant experience I've ever experienced in SF thus far.

Service: Lacking to the extreme. Why is it so hard for us to get them to come take our money but yet again so fast to clear our plates when I wasn't even done with the food? I ended up just saying yes, I'm done since I just wanted to leave this place.

Pizzas: Extremely subpar. I would not recommend this place to anyone. My friend and I are both from NY so we know what good pizzas taste this. This doesn't even come close to decent... We came to this place because the ramen restaurant we wanted to eat at was closed and we saw in about ~300 reviews, this place has 4 stars. We are both equally confused how this is possible...

Anyways, I would save your money and go elsewhere if you want any sort of decent food or service.
author: Jade F.

description:
This place is everything you want in an Italian dining experience. I lived in Italy for a year and this place met every standard of my favorite trattoria's in Florence.

Alessandro took care of us and he was AMAZING. His service was excellent and so attentive and the gave awesome recommendations. I ended up ordering something off the menu after telling him my favorite Italian dishes and he had the kitchen whip up something special, which was everything I love and was absolutely delicious. 

The feel and ambience of the cute and quaint space made me time travel back to Italy. ALSO, the price was perfect for a sweet date night without breaking the bank AND they take reservations which is so lovely in this crowded city. I honestly will be making Pachino my newest and most beloved spot in town.

Thank you Yelp for showing me Pachino and thank you Alessandro for such a wonderful dining experience. GO GO GO people and tell em this review sent you! ;)
author: Jenna S.

description: This is a delightful, friendly European pizzeria in the middle of the Financial District. Pizza is genuinely Neapolitan, and the garlic bread, made of the same dough, is fabulous. Pasta is homemade and served in European portions, al dente. I felt like I'd been transported to Rome in the middle of a busy day. Really lovely staff and owner. We will definitely go back...
author: Suzy W.

description:
Great food and service! My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our experience at Pachino. We had some pasta and a specialty pizza. The service was fast and the food tasted great. They have a wide variety of food on their menu and a great wine selection.

The owner was amazing. He quickly provided us with a high chair for our baby when we came in and came over numerous times to talk to us. We will definitely go back next time we're in SF.
author: Joe C.

description: All around very good Italian cooking! The restaurant itself feels like something you'd find in an Italian city - narrow, few tables, all full. The menu is a mix of Southern Italian and Italian-American, all done really well. We stuck to the chalkboard specials - beet salad, lentil soup, as well as a pasta each. It's worth coming for the ragù.  The star might have been the tiramisu, though. The service is very Italian in the sense that there is no rush, you are welcome to relax. I can't wait to come back to try a pizza.
author: Ed D.

description: Great home cooked meals,  place is busy and food is great. Pizza, pasta, chicken,  bruchetta, were all excellent and ravioli is to die for, highly recommend this mom and pop restaurant.
author: T K.

description: This place was excellent! We were looking for an Italian restaurant that did not have a wait, and ended up here on a whim. The calamari and caprese salad were delicious. I ordered the carbonara, and it was great as well. Outside, it doesn't look like much, but it's nice and quiet on the inside. I'd definitely visit this place for an unpretentious Italian dinner
author: Lyndy W.

description:
Great Italian restaurant and pizzeria. My wife and I really enjoyed in food. Calzone and pizza are very reach and great made.
Love it...
author: Edin B.

description:
We came here for dinner as I needed to carb load prior to a half marathon. Luckily we arrived before 6p because after 630p this place was packed. And when we left around 730p, there was a long line outside with large parties.

I'm not sure if they were short staffed or if the customer service needs help. As soon as we arrived (there was another party ahead of us), the employees who were there didn't acknowledge us. We all just stood there. It wasn't as if they didn't see us either since we were cluttered at the entrance and they were going back and forth inside and out for the patio tables. 

After about 10 mins of standing around, both our parties were finally acknowledged and we both were led to our respective tables.

We ordered the following:
-Comp bread (not warm) with olive oil. 
-Spaghetti Pachino ($14): Grape tomato, garlic, basil and olive oil
-Pappardelle Alla Bolongnese ($16): 3 meat sauce

My pachino pasta was very simple and bland. I had to add some salt to taste as well as some of the meat sauce from the other dish to my pasta so I had a little more substance. 

Love the cute ambiance with limited indoor and outdoor seating. Make reservations and, if it's busy, be prepared not to receive stellar service.
author: Maria C.

description:
If I can give negative stars I would. This place promised to do catering for 45 people at a proper time. The food was came extremely late, mind you this is a corporate company that ordered the catering, so time is valuable. The food came 1 hour late, everything was sloppily thrown together, even some of the pasta tasted like vomit. In addition, none the trays that were served were only 1/4 full. When called to complain, the owner laughed in our face, was extremely rude and unprofessional, and even asked if he can wash our car instead of refunding the money. 

First of all- you're an hour late and then you serve food that tastes like vomit?! Seriously? 

NEVER EAT or ORDER from here, you will regret it!!!!! 

Canned pasta sauce from Safeway tastes better than this.
author: Marigold V.

description:
Fantastic pizza in a small, cozy location. The server was extremely friendly and none of the service was rushed. This place had a really nice, neighborly feel to it which was a pleasant surprise given the area. 

For starters, we had the grilled calamari. This has to be one of the best calamari appetizers I've had in a long time. If you come here and you like calamari, this is a definite must have. The smokey char on tender calamari is balanced by the fruity flavors of roasted bell peppers and olive oil. The hearty white beans went really well with the squid. You could really taste all of the flavors of this dish in the beans. 

We got two pizzas for two people because 12" somehow sounded small at the time. Total overkill but at least we got to try more food and take home leftovers. Can't complain about that right? 

We had the special: smoked mozzarella, anchovies, roasted bell peppers and cherry tomatos, and the diavola: tomato sauce, arugula, fennel sausage, and a Serrano pepper in the middle. They were very different but both were very tasty - you couldn't pick a favorite between the two. The special was more smokey and savory whereas the diavola was bitter and sweet. The crust on both was well done if you like the crust on Italian pizzas. 

The price was pretty reasonable as well - 50 some dollars for two pizzas and a generously portioned  appetizer. I will be back for more!
author: Kailin L.

description: Came here on a Friday for dinner with a very large group. The restaurant is really small so we basically took up the whole place. We ordered a bunch of pizzas that I don't remember the names of...but they were all really good! They were having a special pumpkin one and that one was sooo good. We also got a classic margherita pizza that so super yummy as well. All the pizzas tasted so fresh and authentic! The service was so nice and accommodating to our large party. Definitely would come back!
author: Alyssa W.

description: The restaurant is small but nice. It is a sit down restaurant with nice service, but I found the food to be very boring. For the quality or the taste of the food it was overpriced. The water was good though.
author: Shahid Z.

description: Delicious dinner. Wonderful ingredients. A lot of organic ingredients and tasted like it was right out of Venice. You could tell the owner took pride in his history and heritage being Venetian. He was very friendly and had excellent customer service. The risotto and bolognese was delicious.
author: Jameson H.

description: A small but very good Italian restaurant. The pizzas are very good. The service was excellent. The grilled calamari appetizer is a must. You can't go wrong with any of the pizzas. We did not get any pasta, but the salmon and risotto was pretty good. I highly recommend this place. I suggest making a reservation. They only have 30 seats.
author: Edwin E.

description:
2.5 Star

Special Homemade Tortellini filled with short ribs in a parmesan sauce was underwhelming. The filling was stuffed with bland stringy meat that didn't taste that appealing. However, I did like the texture of the pasta and the nice al dente bite that it gave. Sauce was also good, a great punch of parmesan flavor but didn't really compliment the short rib filling. 

Overall Thoughts

Perhaps I would come back for one more try but for now with so many options near by I won't be back anytime soon
author: Eddie W.

description:
It's too easy to walk by this place - but don't miss it! I only happened to notice it after work one night when a colleague and I were running around Kearny St. trying to find an open nail salon. We saw a beautiful Margherita pizza beaming at us from an inside table and I made a mental note to return.

The pizzas here are super delish and super Italian! They use a lovely buffalo mozzarella for most of their pizzas resulting in that typical low-on-cheese but high-on-flavor Neopolitan feel. They are known for their Margherita but I find it a bit too simplistic. I usually prefer to go with one of their daily specials and always add on extra arugula without fail! Pizza is on the pricier side but well worth it considering the size of the pie and the high quality ingredients.
author: Arushi S.

description: Cozy little place with a staff that makes you feel like you're at home. I had the farfalle bolognese, which was excellent. They cook their three meat sauce for five hours. Yum!! Glass of Montepulciano, tiramisu and espresso topped off a very pleasant evening. It only has 26 seats, which makes it even better.
author: Mark R.

description: Really good food! I would definitely visit again. It was late and most of the restaurants were closed and the waitress which i think was one of the owners welcomed us and made us feel appreciated it. Food was really good, i ordered spaghetti carbonara and my husband a calzonni. Was delicious! Place is small but very cozy and charming. Definitely a place to visit!
author: Lilliam B.

description:
Why do I keep forgetting about this place? Every time. Every. Single. Time I'm in the neighborhood and whip out my Yelp app, I go, "oooh, an Italian joint that's 0.1 miles from here." When I walk-up to it, I realize I've already been here. 

Twice. This has happened two times already. Damn you, aging brain! It's like Dory from Finding Nemo.

The first time, I had a fantastic margerita extra pizza, with extra mozzarella:  http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=FPt7inkv60o-fQ8095Ozug&userid=cqf8dqO5_QUxjfo6WiM7yg

The second time, I went for the pappardelle with meat sauce: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pachino-trattoria-and-pizzeria-san-francisco?select=mfo3BlV6md540z_5n7Y9Vg#mfo3BlV6md540z_5n7Y9Vg

Both meals tasty, but nothing to write home about. One of these days, I should "forget" I've been here and test out that tiramisu.
author: Adena B.

description: I loved this place so much mostly because being full blooded Italian I rarely eat REAL Italian food out. What a treat to have authentic! I highly recommend the ravioli, gnocchi, bruschetta, and calamari. Your not going to find this at buca's people. One tip- the place is small so call ahead and make reservations- I am so glad we did, they were ready to seat our big family and sang happy birthday to my daughter! It was awesome!! Oh and they have Ginger beer! Seriously, how could a girl be any happier :)
author: Gina h.

description:
The homemade pasta is great however I regret what I ordered - the spaghetti carbonara. Carbonara was terribly bland, the pasta didn't have bite and there seemed to be a slight fishy undertaste even though the only meat was the pancetta. Disappointing. However husband's 3 meat pappardelle was perfect. Hearty meaty sauce and a nice, paper thin pappardelle pasta. 

Service could be better. I believe it is because there is one person going around taking orders/serving and he gets distracted and then people are kept waiting like we were. But not as long as the couple next to us. They were still waiting for the food when we had already finished and was heading our way towards the exit. The thing is they only ordered 5 minutes after we placed our order. 

Although not terrible I most likely won't be hurrying back anytime soon. But who knows?
author: Esther A.

description: Excellent and fresh food, soup of the day was amazing and margherita pizza, organic ingredients, delicious. Excellent and personal service. Nor expensive
author: Manny F.

description:
Cute little Italian place in SF. It actually makes you feel like you're somewhere in Italy. They had a good selection of food and service was decent too--being the girls we are, we asked to take a picture for us and she was so cheerful and friendly about it! 

The food was good but nothing out of the ordinary
-margherita extra (with burrata instead of mozzarella): tomato sauce was good but the crust was soggy 
-carbonara: a bit too dry
-**pappardelle: probably the best dish we got tonight. Hearty and moist! Loved it! 

This doesn't mean I won't ever come back. I probably will, but it probably won't be the first on the list of good Italian restaurants.
author: Becky M.

description: Stick with the pizza, it's fresh and tasty.  While we love the ambiance and real Italian menu our beet appetizer was from lunch (sort of OK at 5:30) and lasagna was ancient (5 days old maybe?). I was starving so I ate it and it wasn't so terrible since I wasn't ill but I was disappointed.  My suggestion is order plates that have to be prepared immediately; and stick to the pizza as it really is quite tasty.  Sorry to give a place I like so much a mediocre review but you have to call it like you see it.
author: Gage H.

description: Exceptional pizza. Reminiscent of Italy or Brazil in its simplicity of excision with wonderful flavors.
author: Lyle F.

description: Great little slice of Italy in downtown San Francisco. Great homemade pizzas and pasta authentic Italian recipes. Delightful owner. Small and quaint but a great place to visit with friends or romantic partner over a bottle of vino
author: Travis-Regenea W.

description:
This is our first visited and learned it was cozy and warm.  I noticed one of their chef who stared at us.  I understood because we used sign language for our communicated. It's okay to look at us shortly, not that way too long.  

Secondly, There was not that busy but why it took so long. We waited little a while.  Slow service.

Third, I always give a nice tips however, I noticed on our check.  It indicated below "SF EMPLOYER MANDATE". I was not sure if this is normal to all San Francisco restaurants. I checked with waitress and needed to understand about this. She is unsure and checked with Host.  She took her head and rolled eyes. 

Last, This is Pachino Trattoria & Pizzeria, NOT Belden Taverna #1. How come, my check indicated with a different restaurant's name and address. 

I told her not to worry and we needed to go.  I paid with nice tips plus their Employer Mandate.

Please watch out their hidden cost as SF EMPLOYER MANDATE. 

I put two stars and will not come back again. Check my photo.
author: Dion B.

description: This place is incredible...fresh pasta and pizza crust is delicious. If you want a true taste of Italy make sure to check this place out. Thanks Tony!!
author: Eddie P.

description:
Came here really craving a good Italian pizza, but this didn't meet my expectations. Although I do have high expectations for a restaurant rated 4.5 stars on Yelp, which is how I heard about them in the first place.

I was starving when I sat down, so I was glad they started off with some warm bread buns! Those were so good I was almost stuffed completely by the time the pizza came out.

I ordered the Diavolo - spicy house made fennel sausage, arugula, tomato, and serrano pepper. The pizza was pretty thin and the crust was well textured (crispy + a bit chewy), but the center was completely soggy. I'll give them the benefit of the doubt and assume it was from the very fresh tomatoes they used on the pizza. All the ingredients they used were very fresh, and the sausage was great. It came with two peppers, one on either side of the pizza. However, I still feel that a top notch pizzeria should know how to prep the tomatoes so it doesn't make the center dough all soggy. That was basically the biggest downside. 

I also sat on the outside, and it was slightly difficult to get the attention of the wait staff, since they were mostly rushing around on the inside during evening dinner crowd. 

I couldn't finish the whole pizza by myself and took some of it to go. It was not bad the next day after a quick pop in the toaster oven. Still salvageable. 

Just don't know what all the hype is about. I've had better pizza at Delfina. But if you're a tourist wandering around Union Square, then this pizza is probably better than the Pizza by the Slice that you find closer to the Square. If you can venture farther out than city center though, then much much better pizza awaits you!
