author: Audrey L.

description: Ordered margarita pizza and pasta carbonara to go here for lunch one day. Wait time wasn't too bad but for the price I'm paying, the food could have been better. Pasta was pretty cold by the time I started to eat it and it was an extremely small portion. Pizzas are really thin and the toppings were sliding off. I may come back and dine in to give them another try.
author: Ava F.

description: Ordered the pappardelle alla bolognese for pickup and it is extremely disappointing. Portion is tiny, sauce is watery, and the meat is unseasoned- as if broken up and boiled directly from the ground meat packaging into the tomato water. Seeing how many stars this restaurant has on Yelp and comparing it to the saddest $18 pasta I've ever had makes me feel as if the pleasant man who took my order holds a personal gripe against me.
author: Kristin H.

description:
This place is small but has a high ceiling. We went on Sat. evening, made reservation prior so it's only 10 minute wait till the table was cleared for us. But there are at least 10 people waiting outside around 7:30-8:00pm.
We share a prosciutto and burrata pizza (with arugala) on thin crust. It was very yummy, though the prosciutto is thicker than I expected. 
Overall, it's very loud with large groups in a small space, and it's also kids friendly.
author: Mary L.

description:
Pizza, unfortunately, is one of those things that almost any idiot can make. You just need a flat piece of dough, some cheese, and some red sauce. But God really is in the details.

I travel to Italy quite a bit, so I eat a lot of pizza. In Italy, pizzerias are more common than Starbucks. Well, that's an unfair comparison, since there are actually no Starbucks in Italy. But you get the idea. 

I really wanted to like the pizza here, because I like the people. And they use really good, authentic ingredients. But sadly, it all comes together in a wet soggy mess that you cannot even pick up.

So, although I like the flavor, the structure is a complete fail.

I did not have a chance to try the pasta, but you should try. You may have way better luck.

The cannolis on the other hand, are pretty interesting. They're not perfect (the filling could really benefit from a touch of Strega) but they are one of the best cannolis I've had in the US, including those from Boston's famed North End (which really are abysmal). The shells are as crisp as light as parchment paper, filled with a pretty decent ricotta and pistachio cream.
author: Rick S.

description: Absolutely fantastic!  Beet salad was delish and the 4 cheese mushroom and proscuito pizza was delish, perfect flavor, cooked perfectly, it's like we were in Italy!  Will def come back!!!
author: Mike S.

description: Excellent vibe, fresh ingredients, and top class service. It's a place you can come time and time again
author: Shrey G.

description: Don't judge a book by its cover. We almost ate here for lunch a couple of days ago and decided not to because it looked a little underwhelming. A couple of days later, we came for dinner and loved it! It's small, yet cozy. Perfect for my family of four. The service was attentive, gracious, and friendly. We are pizza snobs and this pizza was some of the best we've ever had. Mine had sherry poached pears, radicchio, and 5 Italian cheeses all in a crusty homemade crust with a bit of cornmeal. This place was definitely a highlight of our eating experience while in the area.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Handmade pizza was top notch.  I had the sherry poached pear with 5 Italian cheeses which was one of the specials of the day.  Very good.  Tiramisu was excellent- very creamy.  Service was also very good. Would come back again!
author: Les J.

description: The carbonara pasta was more like scrambled eggs and uncooked bacon with pasta. Would not recommend.
author: Mary K.

description:
Oh my goodness.  I mean really.  This is one of the main reasons I love San Francisco.  If my home town had just one restaurant as good as this place, no one would eat anywhere else - at least for Italian.  

It's small, but adorable.  The waiter (and I think maybe owner as well?) had such a thick Italian accent I almost burst into happy/happy joy/joy.  It looks to be family owned with the small kitchen/front of the house crew all speaking Italian to each other.  

My husband and I both took advantage of the day's specials: I had the spring vegetable pizza; he had the pork cheeks and polenta.  5 stars, hands down.  If I get to eat here again, it will be hard for me not to order the pizza again, it was that good.  I don't even have words for how perfect the crust was.  And I know peas and fava beans on pizza might not be everyone's cup of tea, but man, combined with the asparagus, fresh tomatoes, goat cheese, spinach, and everything else on that pizza, it made for a party in my mouth.

You must try this place!
author: Cindi R.

description: We enjoyed a nice lunch today and would highly recommend this place for those in the Chinatown/Financial District/Union Square area. We only tried the pepperoni pizza, but it was delicious, priced well, the service was quick & friendly.
author: Shannon J.

description: Food and service was good but portions on the pastas were smaller than expected for the price.  Pizzas looked to be the better options on the menu.
author: Jada G.

description: Restaurants like these having 4 stars on Yelp makes me question Yelp. Food here was terrible. We got some salads, meatballs and the prosciutto with burrata. The salads were AWFUL. I couldn't finish mine and I never leave over salad. Vegetables were limp and old, dressing was tasteless. Salad was also a weird temperature. I was worried I would get food poisoning from it. Meatballs were tiny, dry and unappetizing. They looked like the meatballs I would get in Middle School, sitting around for awhile. I'd definitely skip this place.
author: Farrah L.

description: I really want to give this place a 4, but it just felt slightly lacking in some areas.  Came here on a weekend for dinner, the place was not too busy if you have a small party.  The restaurant itself is really tiny so it can't seat much, but it was really quaint and I loved it.  Started off with some bread and bruschetta.  I really enjoyed how their bread was these small buns with some olive oil and balsamic vinegar.  The bruschetta was also pretty good with the bread being topped with cheese, pesto, honey, and hazelnuts.  For my main course, I had the bolognese which was ok, but nothing exceptional.  It didn't have as much flavor as I expected it to have considering how long it supposedly cooked.  It was nice to know that a lot of their things are made in house though which I thought was very cool.  Really wish I had had room for dessert, they had a lot to offer as well in that area.  A cool spot in SF, I could see this as being a great date spot.
author: Bryson L.

description:
Worst restaurant experience I've ever had. I legitimately don't know where to start with this place because the whole experience grated me down to the core.

I came here with a group of five at 5pm. Immediately after entering the restaurant, the hostess let us know that it was a reservation only place and then abruptly began ignoring us. I looked around the restaurant - they only had two groups in the entire place. I just brushed it off.

We walked out and she ran after us ten seconds later attempting to excuse her strange behavior with the excuse that she had to check for other reservations before seating us.

We were seated, and it took ages to get menus in front of us even though it was extremely slow in the restaurant.

--

We ordered:
Complimentary bread - bland, mostly crust, and resembled hockey pucks more than bread.

Diavolo and Pistacchi e Salsiccia pizzas - slightly burnt. Both crusts were charred and not pleasant at all. The pizza was soggy in the middle - I couldn't pick up a piece without everything sliding off the end of the limp slice. You would think that this place would have at least decent pizza after declaring themselves mainly as a pizzeria.

Grilled calamari - good flavor, but contained mostly beans. I paid $12 for beans.

Fish brodetto - the pasta was overcooked and soggy. The broth and/or seafood components were probably prepared wrong, so it made the whole dish smell absolutely rancid.

--

It took twenty minutes for my party to receive our food, and most of it wasn't even hot.

Near the end of our meal, there were two plates of pizza left on the table with two slices on each. A waitress came and told us to get the pizza slices so she could grab our plates. She. TOLD. Us. This was the hugest issue, in my opinion.

It's unacceptably rude to even ask somebody if they're done with a plate when there's clearly still food on it. This girl didn't even ask - she TOLD us to get the multiple slices off the plates.

When I didn't grab the slices quickly enough because I already had food in my hands, she took the pizza plate and dumped the slices onto my plate and then walked away. I was in shock. Who the hell does that?

We were in the restaurant for a total of about 45 minutes. We were rushed at the end of our dining period, but I still had to ask for the check 5 minutes after finishing my food and twiddling my thumbs because nobody brought it.

Conclusion:
The food here was terrible and not worth any amount of money. I could heat up a better frozen pizza for a quarter of the price.
The service was the most heinous feature of all. I'm shocked that people like this exist.
I'm not sure why their Yelp ratings are so high; I was definitely misled by them.
Don't waste your money, time, or patience here.
author: Michelle N.

description: Lovely quaint space. Pizza was good and service was EXCELLENT. Monica, our Italian server, handled the crazy high maintenance table next to us like a rock star!  She took such good care of us, too. Thank you, Monica! We will come here again just for you.
author: Kelly D.

description: One of the best Italian restaurant I have been to in San Francisco. The menu is absolutely authentic and the owner, Alessandro, is an absolute charmer. The bruschetta with burrata, honey and nuts was really good and the pizza (Roman style) was well prepared with a light in the dough. Highly recommend!
author: Alessandro M.

description: Absolutely incredible place this is a must try, I had the Angel Hair pasta with shrimp and lobster bisque felt like I couldn't eat it fast enough so good!!!
author: Garrett K.

description: Amazing service and atmosphere! The staff accommodated a family with a dog who wanted to physically sit at the table which I thought was very unordinary but nice nonetheless! Grazie!
author: Sera L.

description:
Second visit, not disappointed.

I had the pasta bolagnese.  This delish version had no tomato sauce as is common.  It was the best I have ever had including that I had in Bologna.  The wine used in the recipe was indescribable.

I complimented the manager and he shined.  After the meal he brought us a complimentary hugh tarimasu.  What perfection!

Small place seating about 25 people, but worth a wait.
author: Bradley C.

description: Finally, some authentic Italian food!  This place was out of this world delicious, and I am a very picky eater when it comes to Italian food.  I had the rigatoni with sausage, which is a creamy delight.  The place is small and nicely decorated.  I suspect it would be a good date restaurant, but I was here for lunch.  We told them that we needed to rush and we were done in 30 mins.  So great and much appreciated.  I can't recommend this place highly enough!!
author: Mark B.

description: Divine food. The ravioli was phenomenal as were the pizza and beetroot salad. Real, authentic Italian food at such reasonable prices. Highly recommend!
author: Sarah D.

description:
Happened to stumble on to this delicious little eatery on the way back to my hotel. Small dinning area with absolutely wonderful food. 
I had the pappardelle bolognese that Monica recommended and could have licked  the plate clean.  There was only a few people dining but before I got my entree 4 or 5 more tables filled up and Monica handled them all with a great personality and energy. 
Will have to stop by in a week in my next visit to sf
author: Kevin K.

description: Small hole-in-the-wall near the financial district, in an area otherwise devoid of good casual restaurants as far as I could tell.  Seems to be owner operated, with the sole matron also acting as waitress.  The food was fresh and delicious and the service was with a smile, like the family restaurant it was.  A disproportion number of tables seemed to be occupied by single business travelers.  Maybe the hotels send them this way.   I would definitely return either alone or with company.
author: Dave L.

description:
How does one mess up spaghetti?

I mean even Chef Boyardee could have done a better job.

See my picture? I think it's pretty clear that it's just soggy pasta drenched in pureed tomatoes.

As for the homemade meatballs...if by meatballs you mean balls of untasty meat than yes. They tasted dry, chewy, and bland. Kind of like eating a furball I would imagine, if I were a cat. Though the meatballs to their credit weren't fuzzy. 

And the service was laughable. How many times do I have to ask for the check?

5 times you say? Wow.

And how about thanking me for my business or asking me how my food was?

Nope.

I'm not sure which bunch of naive tourists gave this place 4 stars...but you are all as crazy as a strung out group of Muppets.
author: Jack R.

description: Three and a half years later, this place still has the best pastas and sauces! And, the flourless chocolate cake is delicious!!
author: C J.

description: First, the food was reasonably good and reasonably priced. Have to acknowledge that. However, the service was terrible. I walk in and it's pouring down rain - I'm drenched after walking from work. There are no customers waiting and about a third of the tables are occupied. I tell the employee (owner?) that I have an order for pickup but since it's raining so hard, can I just eat here? He says no, that he would have to charge me for eating there. So what was my 20% tip for??? He didn't even give me a fork to eat with. Very disappointed - don't come here for takeout.
author: C N.

description: This small italian joint is pretty small and cramped but serves great pastas! We walked in without a reservation and got their pasta special. I would definitely come back again! great find :)
author: Annie Z.

description: Pizza was alright. Ordered well done and received barely cooked enough. LASAGNA BOLOGNESE WAS AWEFUL!! Could have found better in the frozen section at the grocery store. When asked how everything was... I mentioned that the lasagna was not good. No questions of why not. Just, "oh the lasagna was not good". Then they dropped the check without asking if we'd like anything else, which we did. An espresso... maybe a dessert? Singed the check and left. Too many great Italian places to ever return.
author: Gary G.

description: Our company ordered lunch here today and 2 out of 6 lunches were thrown away including mine after. The seafood here is not fresh or frozen and it smelled really bad. Three of the other six dishes were edible and one person enjoyed their spaghetti. If they don't have fresh food, they shouldn't serve it all and it smelled pretty awful so there's no way they couldn't have known.
author: Mike H.

description: warning.  don't order mealpal from them for a slot before ~12:15pm.  they will accept your mealpal order for a slot before 12pm but won't open the doors until a bit after 12.  highly inconvenient when you place an order thinking you will be able to pick it up when promised and end up losing your mealpal for the day when you are unable to pickup after 12pm.
author: Ben B.

description: Who puts a salad in a bag with steaming hot meatballs?  Terrible food and complete chaos considering there was no one else in the restaurant. Don't waste your time or money!!!
author: Kyle F.

description: First meal here. Beautiful room. Great food. So fresh! Good wine prices. When they put port on their menu, it'll be 5 stars. We'll return.
author: Robin A.

description:
It's hard to return to a restaurant in SF since there are so many damn choices. But I've been to Pachino at least a handful of times for dinner with friends and family, once for take-out when I wasn't feeling well (and the only cure was more pizza), and once for a 20-person work lunch. I was happy with the food every time. They let the dough for the complimentary bread rise for two days. Their Neapolitan pizza crust is quite delectable. The desserts are made in-house. The gnocchi is excellent. I could go on and on. You might see me there enjoying a few of their chalkboard specials again soon.

Side note: they don't have iced tea, but they'll offer you San Pellegrino in its various flavors instead.
author: Tiff T.

description:
The good:

Cappellini with pork cheek: Home made pasta, decent chunks of meat, a tad bit on the saltier side

Pappardelle with Bolognese: Homemade noodles, meat sauce wasn't too flavorful and seemed like something I could cook up at home.

The bad:

Service:
1) As I was waiting to get seated for a table of 2, one guy (seemingly the manager) told me that they needed to clean the table but I could go ahead and get seated. The waitress came by before I was about to sit down, saying that this is a table for 3 people since there are 3 chairs and that I should sit at the other table for two. Ok. She then proceeds to move the people from the table of two...to the table of three...with the exact same number of people. 2. irked.

2) It was busy, but waiting 30 minutes after getting seated to get the attention of the waitstaff (raising my hand did not work) to be able to order -- and then another 15 minutes to get the check was not so great.

Decent food. Terrible service experience.
author: Andrew C.

description:
Balls to the wall, this place rules! The food is seriously good, especially the pizza. They have a bruschetta (sp?) that is awesome with a type of cheese i've never had before. It was similar to a fresh mozzarella but maybe more creamy. 
I am eager to go back and try some of the pastas, many of them sounded really good and based on the attention to the quality - I'm sure they must be as good as they sound. 
The wine servings are a touch on the skimpy side, but the prices are reasonable for basic Italian table wines. 
Next time I'm in the city, I'll be making an effort to return to this cozy little place. Got there early on a Sat night and had no issues getting a table, but they filled up by the time we left.
author: Chris H.

description: Stumbled upon this place on yelp and have to say it was amazing! My boyfriend and I have been to Italy and found that the food had an authentic taste and the place felt as if we were back in Italy. The service was great and we could not have loved it more, definetely an amazing place to eat at!
author: Mariana B.

description: Very good! Only disappoint was they were out of several items other then that the food was delicious along with the service.
author: Ashley D.

description:
I'll admit it- I typically don't have high expectations when I wander into hole-in-the-wall restaurants (to hundreds of foodie's dismay, I'm sure). So I wasn't thinking much when I walked to Pachino to meet some co-workers for dinner.

WELL, fellow Yelpers, I'm happy to report that Pachino exceeded my expectations! The first highlight was the service. We were immediately greeted by an incredibly cheerful guy who rattled off a list of recommendations that, well, all sounded wonderfully delicious. He also mentioned that they make all of their pasta from scratch (um, YES). The second highlight was the atmosphere of the place. I like the cozy feel of small restaurants, just as well as anyone, but I also really appreciated the high ceilings and off-beat decor, without being too cutely "San Franciscan".

I ended up ordering the Parpadelle while my friends ordered the Carbonara and Funghi Pizza, respectively. Honestly, all of the food was really good and the freshly made pasta really did make a huge difference!

Overall, I give this a 4 stars for really solid Italian food at a (relative to SF) pretty fair price.
author: Lucy C.

description:
Went here on a whim-the small side street the back entrance is on boasts many options. The place is very old school and casual and I wasn't expecting all that much. 
I believe it was an owner or a manager who took our order, and he sounded to be straight from Italy. He did a reasonably good job of serving us and managing other operations throughout the restaurant. 
The food was surprisingly delicious. Unfortunately they ran out of Tiramisu, because if it was on par with our entrees, it would have been amazing. Appetizer was Burrata with Prosciutto, entree was a tortellini dish that melted in the mouth. 
The only reason why it isn't 5 stars in my eyes is because the seating arrangements aren't very comfortable...the booths are a hard bench and the tables have large metal bases that you have to uncomfortably rest your feet on. Didn't mind that it was extremely casual, but they could definitely use some new tables.
author: Daniel G.

description:
Traveling from Seattle, WA. After 2 days of terrible service and restaurant experiences all around town when we were craving authentic pizza I was really nervous. But using only Yelp, we came across this place and took the chance. And thankfully, because this little Italian joint was the greatest!!!! First you notice how cool the atmosphere is, then you start to notice the little things like how one lady, (Monica) is single-handedly running the front of house, without a single fault. Like a seasoned pro she waited on customers and served food of an entire restaurant  without looking like she was even working hard.

Then the food came. Just outstanding!!!! Pizza was delicious, both kinds we had were impeccable with layers of flavor. I'd come here again and again.
author: Momma M.

description: Fabulous authentic italian food and friendly service from true Italians!  Tony, the manager, stopped us on the way out to ask how our meals were, and he seemed genuinely interested - talking with us for a good ten minutes. Also, the food is a very good value - especially when you consider the location.
author: Scott P.

description: My colleague and I ordered for pick up via Yelp Eat24. The food wasn't ready when we got there. They hadn't check the machine for incoming orders until we showed up. The pasta was edible but bland. Not worth the $15 price tag. AT ALL.
author: Miwa W.

description:
I can usually tell when I will like a pizza purely based on pictures, and I wasn't too far off - these pizzas are made thin with a chewy crust and are pretty delicious, although the toppings are nothing really too unique or innovative.

Everything else from the appetizers to the entrees was downhill, and at best, ordinary. The arugula proscuitto mozzarella salad was overdressed and underwhelming; when you make a dish that is so simple, it is critical that every components is top notch and I felt the burrata was tough like mozzarella. The beef carpaccio had pretty good flavor but was not sliced thinly. The shrimp capellini was WAYYY waywayway underseasoned, and the pasta was not al dente.

Tiramisu was pretty good, it had a little too much rum and/or coffee for my taste. The chocolate amaretto mousse was even better - though it has a dense texture and tastes nothing like amaretto.

I probably wouldn't come back for any of the dishes except the amaretto chocolate mousse, and only if I was nearby. Overall it wasn't a bad meal and quite affordable, but the service was unfriendly and unaccommodating (male server) and the food was mostly mediocre. Better alternatives include Mozzeria, Zero Zero, Cupola, and Flour and Water.
author: Jess C.

description:
I was in San Francisco for business and really craved some noodles. To be honest, I wanted Pho noodles, but as I was walking past this place, a cute little woman pulled me in and charmed me into a seat for some Italian (my second favorite genre of food).

I ordered the angel hair pasta with salmon and a glass of their cabernet. The wine was about $13/glass and the pasta was about $16. I was brought a basket of bread; crispy on the outside and warm and fluffy on the inside. They also provide a bottle of vinegar to dip your bread into. I jazzed this up a bit by peppering the vinegar on my plate and adding some parmesan -- which is conveniently located in some small bowls on the table. I'd give the bread a 6/10 and the vinegar was...well....vinegar -- nothing special (balsamic) about it.

The pasta was a la dente and pretty tasty. The salmon, however, was ironically dry and tasted like it was frozen and re-heated. Disappointing for being so close to the ocean where people like Wacky Jacky can catch salmon all day long.

The place was quaint and had a 'little Italy' vibe, but for the prices and the fact that the chef/servers were Italian, themselves, I expected way better.
author: Elaina B.

description: This place was delicious and the service was fantastic! It's a small restaurant, but they were super accommodating and inviting, and the food was some of the best Italian food I've ever had!
author: M C.

description: Walk inn to soft Italian music and warm bread rolls. Surprisingly not too busy at lunch time. Service was prompt. The manager/owner was polite and welcoming. We got a half and half pizza, pepperoni and marinara. The crust was thin and just cooked right. Base sauce was really tasty. A good place to come by when looking for quite place to eat in downtown SF. The ambiance is quite and clean.
author: Kamesh K.

description: No on the nonna spaghetti. Good meat balls but no on pasta. Mine was pad thai with tomato sauce (at least thats what it tasted like.) I ate the meat balls and left the pasta. I was excited to taste the "fresh" pasta but was disappointed by the texture and taste. Sauce was overly sour. Over priced for this meal. See pics. Its the spaghetti with the comments pad thai meets italian.
author: mary v.

description:
It's a 3.5 star rating.
It's a small place but was pretty busy and pricey as you would expect for any place in SF.
We ordered a bean soup which was not good. We had vegetable lasagna and veggie pizza which were good. Pizza was the best of all.
author: Vatsa S.

description:
There is only one thing I can say about this place: SLOWEST SERVICE EVER! 

On a weekday after business hours (and I mean normal business hours like after 6 pm not investment banking or management consulting hours) when just SOME of the tables are full, THE SERVICE IS THE SLOWEST I HAVE EVER SEEN. 

15 minutes for a soup which came cold. Had to ask two times for a sparkling water and when we said "OK" to more bread it never came either without us asking again and the most remarkable is the 50!!! (Yes FIFTY) minute wait for a pizza. 

Honestly I don't see the big fuss about this place. One last time: THE SERVICE IS INCREDIBLY SLOW!
We were given a free tiramisu at the end of the dinner but that definitely didn't make up for such an experience.
author: Yigit B.

description:
I'd give 4 stars for the food, but since the service wasn't so great, this place gets a 3 for my overall rating.

My BF was able to change our reservations time last minute to half an hour later on a Friday night. This place is tiny. If you order pizza, it might take a while. Food is good here. There was a  beets carpaccio special that night, and it was amazing. Mix of golden and red beets. For my entrée I got a Margherita pizza with pepperoni added, which was good. It's super thin though, but very fresh with good sauce. I think the meals for my table took a while because my pizza took a while to bake. 

The service here can be good depending who you get. There is a male and female server the night I was there. The male server was on the point, but our main server was the female. She took a while to come take our order, so the male server took it. Since our meal took a while to come out, we asked her if it would be out soon, but she never checked on it. When we were done with our meal, we asked for the check, but she never came with it. In the end, we had to ask the male server if he could get the check, and he got it within a minute or less.

Overall, the pizza is good here, but the service can be hit or miss depending on who you get. It took us about 2 hours to finish our meal, and we're usually done within an hour at most restaurants. If you're not in a rush to go anywhere afterwards, this place should be fine.
author: Lisa T.

description: Very good pizza - organic tomato and mozzarella. Nice service, uncomplicated and kind. I went at 2pm, so it wasn't crowded.
author: Alex G.

description: Pachino was so good! We had the yummy pizzas, caprese salad, wine and pasta. It's a small place, but the staff are incredibly friendly and efficient. We had a party of 6 and it worked ... great food! I would def go again!
author: Kimberly G.

description: Real deal Italian food - pizza was fantastic and the meatballs are to die for. I would recommend getting a pasta dish and a pizza to share. Get the best of both worlds. Just great little find in San Francisco. Only 9 tables so go a little early and just plan to take your time and enjoy!!!
author: Evan B.

description:
The owner was like a real Italiano and so sweet and nice. Got us a table and took great care of us. I have to say for a really small place he did really well.

The pizza we got was SOOOO TASSTTTY I was like Am I in NY again??  Really good. I left nothing on the plate. I really was like OMG GOOD FOOD HERE!

A really nice place with a great owner / server. 

AWESOME JOB HERE!
author: Scotty W.

description: Great food!  My wife and I had the pasta with 5 meat sauce, delicious, but j just would have liked the portion size to be a bit larger.
author: Edward G.

description:
This place gets 4 stars.

It's small and cosy, but even when it's full, the noise doesn't bother you.
What I love most about this place are the fresh products they use and serve. Whether you are ordering a pizza or a pasta dish, you'll be surprised by the amount of taste on your plate.

The service is also great: quick, friendly and thoughtful.

Honest, simple dishes at fair prices is what you get and I'll definitely come back for more!
author: Thomas D.

description: We went at lunch and ordered the eggplant pasta dish. The dishes appeared quickly and one bite revealed a perfectly season eggplant sauce but totally undercooked pasta. It's way under el dente. My companion found a foreign piece of white plastic in his dish. We pointed this out to the server who promptly apologized and said it's from the takeout boxes. Then the bill came. No comp or offer for coffee or anything as a result. We DO NOT recommend this place to anyone.
author: Rrr X.

description:
It was 9pm & my girlfriends & I were all starving. The only thing we were craving was pizza, & we stumbled upon this place as we were walking. 

As the table was set & glasses were served, my friend noticed a lipstick stain on one of the cups, which was very disgusting. I'm sure the staff felt embarrassed by this but they switched the cup right away & apologized. 

Although the place itself is very small, they were able to seat the 8 of us, which was a little cramped but not bad. We ordered 3 pizzas for the table, which was plenty. Two of the Sicilia, which was topped with eggplant & one Margherita. The sauce spread on the Margherita pizza was amazing!
author: Kruti S.

description: My wife and I have been coming here for several years.  The food has fallen off.  It used to be amazing.  Sauce was bland, very bland.  Sad to say we won't be back soon.
author: Scott G.

description:
This place wants to be a genuine, classy Italian restaurant so badly. The problem is the flaws just make it seem a little pathetic. First off, and most importantly, the food is nothing to write home about, it took much longer than it should have to get the food out, and the heat in the place is oppressive.

There was one employee who I was baffled by. I guess he was a busboy? He was attentive and in clearing plates, scraping crumbs off the table, and, when he overheard me ask for balsamic vinegar, immediately grabbed it. The weird part though was that when I asked him to take our order, he told us that the only waiter would help us soon. Not odd in and of itself, but the we had to wait another 10 minutes because the one waiter was taking the order of a large party, taking the time to joke and explain every dish on the menu. The place is so small too that the busboy literally only stepped back ten feet after he refused us that it just seemed awkward and silly for him to stand there when we'd just asked for help. It's not like it didn't have a good grasp of English either.
author: Stephen C.

description: Great place, good atmosphere good service, Definitely a hidden gem for San Francisco!
author: Anne K.

description: Yum!!!  Stopped by on a whim since it was too early to check into our hotel room. Risotto was delicious!  Great beer selection and excellent service!  Will definitely come again next time I'm in the city!
author: Ivy N.

description:
We came here after seeing the other Yelp reviews, and the restaurant lived up to its four star rating. It wasn't spectacular, but it wasn't bad either - definitely a good Italian place that could be repeated. 

We ordered the Verdure pizza and the spaghetti carbonara. The verdure pizza was good, but it does come with a lot of toppings. The spaghetti carbonara was a little bland, but still good. 

Overall, definitely a four star restaurant.
author: Niharika R.

description:
Most restaurants near Westfield mall were fully reserved so we decided to eat here ; the reviews were decent (how?!!) but then again most good restaurant around the same area have 1K+ reviews and this place only had ~200

The caesar salad was not fresh at all and the lettuce tasted bitter , the margarita pizza tasted and looked like cheese pizza with a burnt crust, and they got one of our pizza orders wrong (even though I repeated it twice) we were too hungry to wait longer so we declined his offer to make us a new pizza - but he didn't even give us a discount or anything for getting our order wrong! I've never had that happen in a restaurant . 

Anyway I would not recommend the Caesar salad or the margarita pizza - or the restaurant as a whole.
author: Zeinab J.

description: One of the best Italian pasta joint in sf! Super authentic food and staff! Will definitely come back
author: Jack T.

description: Great people, home made pasta. Took my family here who was visiting out of town. 10/10 would go back again.
author: Colin L.

description: I found my fav Italian place!! Very authentic Italian Place. This place is amazing. I had angel hair spaghetti. It's got crab meat as protein and spaghetti in lobster bisque. That dish is Amazing. I never had any pasta that is flavorful as this. My favorite pasta ever. I'm so glad I found this place. I'm definitely going to be a regular here!! And let me tell you... Tiramisu.. Was... Mind blowing!!!! AMAZING!!!! Must try place!!!
author: Kelly K.

description:
Got the Pistacchi e Salsiccia pie to-go. Was intrigued by the pistachio pesto which I've never had. Pie was good, but too salty due to the combination of sausage and pecorino. Definitely a good sized pizza that you could split between two people or eat yourself like I did! Most people who were eating at the restaurant were jealous of those who ordered pizza. But the pasta looked great too.

Owner was very nice about letting me sit while I waited and didn't make me feel awkward about getting take-out on a Thursday night. I would recommend making reservations as I saw quite a lot of people coming in and this is a small space.
author: Melissa C.

description: I am blown away by this little Italian restaurant. The food is exquisite and the service is impeccable. The meatballs were to die for! My girlfriends and I had a great meal and the manager is the absolute sweetest. Also don't skip out on the cannoli for dessert.
author: Becka G.

description: Loved it! Such a cute small little restaurant with amazing food. Everything tasted so fresh, we had an order of the spaghetti and meatballs and an order of angel hair. Everything was cooked perfectly and the meatballs were so delicious. Will definitely return! The owner is extremely polite as well.
author: Anna A.

description:
This is a tough review to write because we loved the pasta and could appreciate the care that went into making such a great noodle.   The pizza on the other hand was soggy, lacking flavor and all around disappointing.  

I would go back for the pasta.  Had we stuck with 2 pasta dishes, I would have given this 3 stars.
author: Anand A.

description: Great service, delicious food...really have no complaints whatsoever! The salmon gnocchi was pure amazing and the margharita pizza was delicious as well....don't get me started on the tiramisu, heaven!!! The ambience was intimate and really relaxing. All I all a great dining experience. This was the perfect place to wrap up our trip to San Francisco!
author: Erica R.

description: I'm honestly surprised that this place gets such great reviews because it was really nothing special. We had ordered the Bruschetta and Dei Rei Pizza from Caviar delivery service. The Brushetta was soggy from sitting in the over abundance of olive oil from the pesto but, we still managed to get it down. On the Caviar website it states that it has "toasted almond" which, it did not - it was pine nuts. HUGE DIFFERENCE in both texture and flavor. The pizza? Well, where do I begin? Everything was STONE cold because for some reason it took 30 minutes to make a delivery .3 miles. Now, I'm a person that takes A LOT of taxi cabs all over the city, I know exactly how long it takes to get from them to us. Not sure why these delivery people seem to have such a hard time with this concept but, they are failing miserably and making restaurants look horribly bad. The description of the pizza says 4 cheese, would you expect Blue Cheese to be one of those cheeses? It wouldn't have been so bad if we didn't keep getting mouthfuls (mind you, I LOVE Blue Cheese, just not mouthfuls of it) of it - over powering everything. If you are going to use such a potent cheese, break it up more and distribute it more evenly otherwise, it defeats the purpose of the other ingredients. The description also did not mention ANYTHING about pesto as a sauce, this caught me off guard and had I known, I would not have ordered from here since I had pesto linguine for lunch. The prosciutto was almost transparent and looked like flesh that was being tanned - it was far from looking appealing. This was most likely a result from being one step away from being frozen, I'm sure it would have been more appetizing had it actually been somewhat warm. There was also no hint of "sage" and trust me, I know sage well, it's one of my favorite spices and I use it often. So, for $40.56 we got stone cold, soggy...... ~censored~  They also need to update their menu descriptions and leaving out major ingredients is just bad business.
author: Jamilah A.

description: Wouldn't recommend for delivery. Showed up very cold. More than an hour. Margarita pizza didn't have basil or tomato. Pretty bluh. Can't speak to dine in experience but delivery was a disappointment.
author: John S.

description:
The pizzas are so good. We ordered the traditional like Margherita and peperoni. Not so thin crust but just perfect. The grilled calamari was also delicious. We ordered Argentinian wine, it was so good. They filled our bread basket twice while we're waiting for our pie. 

The service was nice, but when we went there, it was Saturday night and there only two staffs serving and taking orders. So it was a bit slow to get our pies and order. They need more people for the weekend. But overall, very nice place and recommended.
author: Lin S.

description:
Came here for my birthday lunch with the accounting team at work. It was an excellent choice and I am definitely going to return when I want some pasta!

So I have this superstition that its good luck to eat spaghetti on my birthday. I found this place on yelp and couldn't be more satisfied that I chose it over the other pasta places around. 

I got the spaghetti and meatballs and it did my tummy justice. The meatballs were so good and the pasta and sauce were satisfactory. I like that this place makes their pasta in-house and it feels very authentic. I can't wait to come back to try their gnocchi!

One downside is that it did take a while for the food to come. But I didn't mind because it just means that they stick true to making meals to order! It's a tiny, cozy place that would be a good place to go for a date or an intimate lunch/dinner with close friends.

All pasta dishes are around $14-17. Not too bad for what you get.
author: Junel S.

description:
Came here late on a Sunday night for a dinner after a long day of walking around. The place was not packed (3 empty tables) but I still waited close to 20 minutes. It seemed like the poor server might be on her own + 1 host (I think it might have been the owner). I was in my "I'm going to be walking around all day" clothes-- read: flip flops and a sundress, so maybe my attire was not acceptable for what they were looking for (though I saw a bunch of other people in jeans, etc.). 

Brought my mom and she had the special (linguine with prawns and scallops) and I had the cavatelli. The cavatelli had a heavy cream sauce but it was served with italian sausage which was delicious. 

I highly recommend it as everything was delicious and the service (once we were seated) was pretty good!
author: Lai-Nin W.

description: So tasty! Was taken here for a business lunch and was a little weary of the pasta options, but I got the carbonara ("noodles with a hole", white sauce, and pancetta) and WOAH it was so good. The pancetta was perfection and the sauce was so good it even was incredible when I dipped the bread in it. Everyone cleaned their plate of food. Pricey, but a GOOD plate of pasta.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: Great service, busy place. We had pizzas and wine - all reasonably priced. Host was super friendly.
author: Russell C.

description: Craving Italian, My wife and I came here on a Thursday after work for dinner.  We were greeted immediately and given a choice of tables.  We ordered the Bucatini alla Carbonara , Spaghetti Della Nonna and the Dei Re Pizza.  Everything was delicious.  The service was great and attentive.  Definitely would come back and enjoy the food again.
author: larry s.

description: Thanks Pachino for letting me reserve a table for 20 during the busy Nike Women's Half Marathon weekend. We pretty much took over the entire restaurant. The service was excellent considering it was a super busy weekend and they were pretty much packed to the brim with people. They even had to send people away. My friends enjoyed the specials. Me and a friend shared the spaghetti and meatballs which were delicious! Thank you again for your service and delicious food!
author: Melissa M.

description: Googled for Italian restaurant and  found this place with 4 stars. Walked quite a bit from Union Square Arrived at 7:17 Pm. It is a tinny restaurant that sits aprox 30 people.  We were told to wait 15 minutes because we had no reservation. The service was quick and to the point. The  food was served fairly fast. This place feels like an authentic Italian family ran busines. Ah and the food was great.!!!
author: Alex O.

description:
This place is small but good.  We did a walk in and got a table no problem.  My experience was the food was average.  We had the Spaghetti Carbonara which was OK but not spectacular.  We also had the Chicken Saltimbocca which was better.  

The service was fine, everyone was attentive friendly and professional.  For dessert we had a cream puff thing filled with vanilla ice cream and topped with chocolate sauce. It was OK but I found ice crystals in it which makes me think it was previously frozen.

Overall it was a good value and I might go back.
author: Drew M.

description:
I tend to experience horrible withdrawal symptoms when I am forcibly separated from substances that make me happy. 

Of course, since I'm 32 years old and no longer partying in random warehouses in Sacramento, the substances in question usually tend to be carbs and dairy. As it happened, today was just one of those days where I needed my fix, and the first thing on my mind after this weekend's fat kid bender? Spaghetti carbonara of course.

Let's put it this way, I've spent $20 on much more (ahem) substantial things in the past and did not feel as bad afterwards as I did after eating here today. 

Sorry Pachino! I really wanted to like this.
author: Aivy C.

description:
Unlike a few of my fellow Elite yelpers, we had a very nice dining experience last Saturday night.  Reservation for party of eight at 7:30pm.  So they pushed several small tables together as this is a very small and narrow restaurant.  There's a couple of outdoor tables too.  

The owner/server gave us plenty of time to decide.  Three baskets of ciabatta dinner rolls brought to the table.  We started with two pizzas.  Get the pesto one.  Very very good.  Thin crusty pizza. I could have eaten the entire pizza by myself. Cut into eight slices. The Margherita pizza was o.k.  

I got the  house made pappardelle special.  Three meats sauce with black kale.  Good size serving.  Fresh pasta.  Hubby ordered the salmon ravioli special.  Stuffed with smoked salmon with six prawns and served with lobster and prawn sauce.  He liked it.

Each couple paid $60 inc tax and tip.  I'm not sure what the corkage fee was for two bottles of wine. 

We didn't order dessert as we finished the evening at the home of one of our friends.
author: Shirley N.

description: This is the best Italian I've had in a while. We ordered the vegetarian Verdure pizza and the Orecchiette Pachino pasta. The pasta was definitely the best I've had in a really long time. The sauce was really subtle yet creamy and the serving size was just right for a single person. The pizza is standard size and is enough for two. The pizza wasn't extraordinary but very good. The owner/manager of this place gave us a very warm welcome and helped us decide on the dishes. The ambience is cozy and personal. Overall, I loved this place.
author: Shruti R.

description: We ended up getting the cheese ravioli and veggie pizza with wine. Everything was delicious and the host was very friendly! Highly recommend this place.
author: Anurag K.

description:
This is a small Italian restaurant in FiDi. We picked this place for a work get together based on the fantastic reviews. The awesome smell of pizza greeted us when we walked in.  

Our waiter had a great Italian accent but I could not decide if he nice or a little rude. He seemed to alternate between friendly and helpful to being cold. Anyway, I will give him the benefit of doubt. The Peroni beer was a good start to the meal. The prosciutto buratta was my favorite of the appetizers, the bruschetta was good too. The pizza surprisingly was a little underwhelming and was too oily. The cannoli and the chocolate cake were excellent. 

We ended up ordering more pizza than we needed and they forgot to bring out the leftovers when we left. I hope they did not throw it away.
author: Sunil R.

description:
WARNING: THE OWNER OF THIS ESTABLISHMENT MAKES CUSTOMERS SUBSIDIZE THE HEALTHCARE OF HIS EMPLOYEES! It will be added to your bill.
Now about the food:
VERY GOOD: burrata with eggplants, short rib ravioli and spinach-mushroom caneloni
OK, not great: bucatoni alla carbonara - It had some missing ingredients: finely chopped prosciutto (it only had coarsely cut bacon), chopped hard-boiled egg, fresh-grated cheese, and more cream -  I added table parmesan, and it was better.  The owner forgot to bring a large spoon to help eat the long pasta, which was perfectly cooked al dente.
GREAT: the tiramisù was well-made, a 9 out of 10.
NASTY: the Sicilian canolli was very stale (like an old tortilla chip) and not cold enough.
PRICES: Like most SF Italian restaurants, it is priced about 20% above an equitable price/quality ratio.
OK to go back if you like to help subsidized the restauranteur's employees.  IT IS TIME FOR A LIVING WAGE FOR ALL. VOTE BERNIE SANDERS IN 2016!
author: ColomboArgentino C.

description:
Best casual, relatively cheap Italian restaurant in the Financial District / Union Square area. The pappardelle with the veal and beef sauce is great and perfectly cooked. The prosciutto pizza with burrata, cherry tomatoes, and arugula is also very well done.

The place is relatively quiet and really good for tables of  1 or 2 persons. It's not really a date place or a business place but more for someone where you just want to get good Italian food and you find yourself in the Financial District.
author: Victor W.

description:
Excellent pizzeria in Union Square. Despite the touristy location, the place feels authentic and you never have to wait more than 20 mn to be sitted.

Every pizza I've ever tried here was amazing. I particularly recommand the sausage & pesto one - quite uncommon flavors, and I loooved it. Pizzas are around $16 - as in all other SF pizza places - and are really big.

My only disappointment is their desserts. I only tried them one (you're so full after the 12" pizza!) and their profteroles are not great: they were obviously frozen and there was only few chocolate sauce on it.
author: Marine B.

description:
This is probably some of the finest Italian cuisine I've ever had in San Francisco, a city that usually can barely come up with even barely decent Italian food.  We've gone back 4 times in 3 days, and everything we've ordered was outstanding.  The Spaghetti Carbonara, a dish that I have NEVER had even a passable version of outside of Rome, was probably the best I've ever eaten.  Usually Americans make Carbonara like a mop of soggy white mush, but this was perfectly cooked, the pancetta was slightly crispy, and the sauce was put on with a light touch.  It was perfection.

The Pappardelle with homemade bolognese was also absolutely excellent, as is the calamari with fagioli.  All the pasta is handmade in the restaurant, I'm told.  Even my Italian mother, who has never found a restaurant pasta she didn't disdain, admitted the pasta was not only good, but excellent.

It is a tiny restaurant, and it's true, the service speed is not the fastest.  But for the quality of the food you get, it is worth waiting a little extra, particularly with the olive oil and bread they give you in the meanwhile, and the excellent wine selection.

Probably the only real Italian dining I've had outside my home since moving to San Francisco 11 years ago.  Absolutely fantastic.
author: Roberto R.

description:
Not sure how this place got such great reviews. But, it could very well be that we didn't order the right stuff.

We got the mussels and the genoa pizza. The mussels were cooked in a white wine, shallot, asparagus broth. The asparagus gave it a little bit of an interesting bitter taste, and the mussels themselves were not that sweet, so I didn't enjoy this dish as much as I normally enjoy mussels. 

The pizza crust here is amazing. Don't expect a lot of toppings on the pizzas though, they're really just a smattering of them. However, the flavor is still quite good. 

Next time, I will stick to the pizzas and pastas, as the table next to ours seemed to be enjoying theirs immensely.

And the main reason they just aren't up to par as a four or five star restaurant is that my friend and I ordered hot water with lemon and both of our cups were dirty. Literally, it was oil mixed with some old pizza flour stuck all over my cup, and noticeably so. tsk tsk. That should never happen.
author: Annie S.

description:
Tried pizza for lunch today.
The pizza was not 100% thin crust but it was not very doughy as well. 
I got the vegetarian Pizza and added meatballs to it. The taste was great and the server also gave me some oregano to put on the pizza.

I would come back if the prices could be a little low...20$ for a working day lunch pizza is a little too much.
author: Parminder Nayyar C.

description: Great pie, crazy fresh ingredients. What else does one really need?
author: Jeff K.

description: Beautiful, delicious food in a cozy spot made this gem well worth while. My only complaint was too much cologne smell in the dining area, though this could have been a patron and I'm sensitive to scents. Overall, a very sweet and warm restaurant.
author: Susan S.

description: The service was friendly but pizza quality was disappointing. We ordered a pizza to go. It was burnt, the wrong cheese was used, and it was missing seasoning.
author: Michael A.

description: Excellent meal! Ravioli and margarita pizza were out of this world. Will come back next time I'm in SF without a doubt.
author: Lindsay E.

description: I was in town visiting from Los Angeles and thought I'd take a chance eating here on a Saturday night. Place was very tiny and every table was taken. We decided to wait it out for a table and wow I'm glad we did. The service was slowish but we didn't mind too much as the only person working tables (owner?) was hustling as best as anyone I have ever seen without sweating a drop. The appetizer bruschetta were bites of heavenly balance. Fresh, light and sweet. I had spaghetti and meatballs and my boyfriend had the cheese ravioli. Each were so gooooood! Pasta was hand made and cooked at the right amount, sauces flavorful yet not over powering, meatballs tasted so homemade in the best of ways. I'm coming back here every time I'm visiting the bay.
author: Michelle G.

description:
The only reason I am giving this place a 3-star rating was because of the service.  Our food was great.  Personal favorites:

- Gorgonzola gnocchi
- Prosciutto shaved truffle pizza

We went here for a friend's birthday celebration and the owner was very warm and accommodating.  However, the server we had was pretty rude:  She kept clearing plates off of our table to the point that there were still items left such as bruschetta that she'd try to take away if we didn't stop her.  She interrupted conversations by taking our personal plates with food still left on them just so we'd "have a clean plate".  At the end when our dinner party was winding down, she again interrupted everyone's conversation and comfort by scraping food scraps off a paper covered tablecloth.  There were three slices of pizza left on the table, and she just grabbed them off and left without asking us what we wanted to do with them.

Our experience would have been superb had there not been this server continuously rude and in the way the whole night.
author: Joy W.

description: Just ate here with my wife. It did not disappoint. We shared the beet salad and a pepperoni pizza. I don't like beets as a rule but the salad was delicious. The pizza was great also. Very friendly staff. Service was excellent. Would eat here again.
author: John A.

description:
I walked into this place and wanted to love it. Pachino's got nice atmosphere and the service was very good. But the food was just uninteresting. 

I liked that Pachino places full bottles of olive oil on the table for dipping in the nice, warm bread our server brought shortly after he took our order. But the oil was bland. There are lots of reviews here that rave about the olive oil; I don't get it, unless people are so tickled with the fact that there's a whole bottle at the table (which is cool). The oil was so mild that dipping bread into it was like dipping into canola oil.

My friends and I ordered four dishes - a salad with bitter greens and a balsamic dressing, a pizza with vegetables, the pasta special (with a sausage ragout and fava beans, and a pasta with bolognese sauce). The salad was beautiful and tasty. The pastas - not so much - again, bland. The sausage ragout was particularly disappointing as it had sounded so good, but was bland and a bit watery. The number of favas in the dish was underwhelming, I had hoped for more. The Bolognese was similarly bland. 

The pizza was kind of a mixed bag. The crust was beautifully done - crispy and yeasty. But the toppings were - bland. 

I think Pachino could be quite wonderful with a little more attention to the dishes, and with better oil. But I'm going to give it two stars now. I'd definitely come back for salad and pizza because the place itself is so enjoyable, in the hope that perhaps the kitchen had a bad day when we came.
author: David G.

description: We found this quaint little restaurant while looking for some Italian food around our hotel. It was nothing short of outstanding in food and service. Some of the best pizza I've ever had and the meatballs were delicious. Little details, such as the crisp and refreshing olive oil, was not lost on is during this lunch. So glad we stumbled on this gem in San Francisco! Definitely a return spot for our next trip!
author: Grace H.

description: I don't know what happened to this place, but it has gone WAY down hill. Dry, tasteless meatballs, bland marinara sauce, and salsaccia pizza where the sausage is not even cooked all the way...it looks like it was microwaved. I decided, after our last pizza was STALE, to give them one more chance because they gave us a discount coupon. Still sorely disappointed and won't be going back for more.
author: Nora L.

description: My favorite Italian restaurant when I am in town from LA love this place! Great service, exquisite food, and the best pizza!!! If you are in town, be sure To check this place out!
author: Rocky R.

description: This is a cozy little place. Good and very friendly service. Maybe I just don't know Italian food or something but I was underwhelmed by the food quality. I had the bucatini a la carbonara (which you'd think would be a no brainer) and frankly I think I could do better at home. Anyway they get 4 stars for ambiance service.
author: Jerome O.

description: Awful. Ordered delivery. It has been 2 hours! And I am still waiting for food. Restaurant said food would be out of the oven 30 min ago and on its way, but that is not the case. Never order from here ever.
author: Han Z.

description:
Great place for an authentic Italian experience!
Had mussels & pizza. Also ordered a kale soup which was nicely done.
author: The Sagacious S.

description: Stellar, authentic little place we were so happy to find! The food was phenomenal, Monica, our server, was wonderful and engaging and the owner came out and chatted with us, we really just felt like part of the family. Would highly recommend!
author: deanna h.

description: Service was awful - we asked for mushrooms on half the pizza and they couldn't do that. Pasta had no flavor whatsoever. This is a tourist trap - do not go here, so many good Italian places in nob hill and north beach. Half their menu was unavailable too:
author: Dan S.

description:
I came here with a bunch of friends as prom dinner. The moment I walked in, our table was already nicely set up. The waiters were definitely the best, filling up our water from time to time and politely answered the questions I had about some of the food. 

We only ordered two pizzas - Margherita and Pistacchi e Salsicca. They were cooked pretty well but I was not a big fan of the taste. It was just a tad bit too salty for me. However, one thing I appreciated about the pizzas were the stringy cheese and the thin crunchy crust. 

Don't recommend the bread they had in the beginning cause it was just too hard to even bite/rip. 

The atmosphere of the restaurant was absolutely amazing. Definitely recommend for a nice little dinner with friends. Bit smaller than the usual but a lot cozier.
author: Lisa L.

description: Really worse service EVER!! I wish I could give 0 star to this restaurant. The owner was super rude and the food was really mediocre. I really don't know how they got 4 star!! The waiter even did not explain the especial to us and when we asked he said you dont know what is Pizza or Pasta!!! Terrible!
author: Samira K.

description:
As a tourist from L.A.....

Pros: Authentic mouthwatering Italian food, served by people who speak Italian.

Cons:  Small area for seating..kitchen is visible especially if you sit in the back area. 

Price: What you would expect for SF, kind of pricey, but I am always willing to pay for great tasting food. Time for this place to expand!
author: Honest A.

description:
This rating is more for the service than the food. The food was ok for the most part. I ordered the meatballs and beet salad. The meatballs were great - came with ricotta, extra sauce in the bowl, and some bread for soaking up the sauce. The beet salad wasn't that great - the beets looked very "jelly" and left a slime on my plate. They tasted that way too. Some spinach was thrown on top with some avocado and pistachios. The beets just had a weird texture to them that I've never had while eating beets before. A gentleman came to the table to clear our dishes (I think maybe he's the owner?) and asked me if the salad was ok. I politely said not really, the beets were a little jelly and not great. He walked away and visibly rolled his eyes at me, scoffed, and shook his head. He asked - I gave him an honest answer. I felt it was inappropriate to roll his eyes at me just because I didn't like his beet salad.

Added to that the service was incredibly slow. The place was damn near empty when we got there at 11:45 but for some reason we had to wait to get seated for a good 15-20 min. After clearing our plates we sat there for 20 min before we actually had to flag the waiter down to get the check. Once we got said check it took them another 15 min or so to come back with the credit card. It looked like they only had 1 waiter for the entire restaurant. 

All in all I wouldn't come back here. There are too many amazing places to eat in San Francisco to waste my hard earned money on a sub par place with slow service and owners with bad attitudes.
author: Nina M.

description: Went in with a group of 10, knew the owners keep this in mind. Had amazing short rib lasagna, handmade pasta for carbonara, tasty meatballs, mushroom pizza and great desserts like tiramisu, gelato and cannoli.
author: Phillip T.

description: Terrible. Ordered a vegetarian meal off the specials menu. We waited close to an hour (only 3 other parties). My supposedly vegetarian meal arrived full of pancetta. I flagged down the waitress, who said "oh, that's not what you ordered." The head waiter (?) came out to ask why I wanted something else, though the waitress had confirmed the miscommunication had been in the kitchen. I wound up asking for the replacement meal to go, because our party had been in the restaurant for 90 minutes at that point. No apology, no understanding when I asked for more bread because my whole party was eating without me. Food was subpar all around. Will not go back.
author: Lexi H.

description: The pizza is amazing!  Real Italian food at a good price.  The Cesar salad was remarkable and even had eggs on it.  I would forgo the gelato--for $6 it isn't worth it.  The service was great.
author: Camisha C.

description:
The host was absolutely WITHOUT a shadow of a doubt accomidating and so loving,I have dietary issues and he made sure everything was to accomidate me and my family, he even gave my daughter a wonderful dessert! I wanted to hug him, I will make this an annual thing for sure!
I love this place :)
author: Kelleigh S.

description:
very good italian restaurant low price. I advice pasta.
Frendly place and good service.
author: William C.

description: Easily the best meal we experienced in San Francisco! Charming, authentic Italian food and atmosphere. Owner and staff attentive and generous. Pizza melts in your mouth and homemade pasta cooked to al dente perfection!
author: Kim V.

description:
There's a reason I've been regular at Pachino for over a year. The intimate setting and personalized service makes it feel that I've been personally invited to eat some home-made, darn-good, come-back-for-more specially prepared dinner. 

There are very few places that I feel comfortable and confident enough where I can take my son, important clients, family, visitors, and tourists alike. 

My continued thanks for great service, great food, and great friendship through food.
author: Laurance A.

description: I got the crab tortalini and LOVED it. The owner is so adorable and extremely friendly. I would absolutely recommend this place. Not to be missed!
author: Savvy P.

description:
Today, we ordered their Pizze with gorgonzola, pear, pancetta and arugula.$15.99
and each of us ordered the Insalate miste, $5.00

They start you out with some excellent home made bread roll's and fine olive oil.

The Pizze was very good; both tangy salty sweet blue cheesy and bit's of sauteed pancetta, topped with fresh baby arugula for a clean finish. This thin crust pizze was good to the last bite.

The insalate miste is good sized and fresh fresh fresh. Consisting of fresh spinach, halved cherry tomatoes, thinly sliced pieces of red onion add some zip, and arugula in a very light dressing; a bargain at $5.00

$32.00 with tax n' tip and is reasonable. Two minute walk to 555 CAL.

Their tap water tastes very good and satisfies.

Customer service: fine.

Parking: nada, unless you park underground.
author: Bert K.

description:
Good food, little portions (especially pasta, pizza and tiramisu ok) but...

We were a party of 2 and they charged us 20% without previous warning.

I noticed it once we already have paid as my friend didn't check and was the one to get the bill.

We are not locals but we live in the city, I felt that the owner charged us like that thinkinh we were tourist. Scaming the clients this way is not the best practice to earn a good reputation.

There are better italian restaurants in the city (pane e vino in union st and caffe baonecci in green st) that will treat you better and fairly!
author: Juan G.

description: Great food - home made Spaghetti was amazing and great service - Tony made us feel like regulars even though it was our first visit. I just wish we lived closer...
author: Sean C.

description:
We called five minutes beforehand and got seated immediately at the last table. We sat down and noticed it was very small, yet warm and cozy inside. We were welcomed and it had great service even though it was quite busy. The bread they served was amazing and the caprese and Caesar salads we got to start was great too. 

For the main meal, I had the margherita pizza which was so good. I can honestly say it was the best pizza I've ever had and as good as something you find in Italy. We also had spaghetti carbonara, the spaghetti with pesto and salmon, and spaghetti with meatballs. All was excellent. 

The restaurant was busy and walk-ins got seated almost immediately with no problem. We will recommend this place to everyone and will definitely will be coming back!
author: G R.

description:
I would give this place 10 stars if I could, it's that good. Came here for lunch with an old friend from the Bay Area. According to my friend, parking was not easy to find. She parked in a nearby parking garage for $4 an hour. We went a little over an hour and they were kind enough to charge her $6 total. On the other hand, I walked here from Union Square. It can be easy to miss if you are not paying attention, since the entrance is not loud or showy.

The inside is classy and romantic, half-dark with lamps at each table. We sat at a two-person table right by the door and it was fine. Not a lot of people are coming in and out, so draft from the door was not an issue at all. The owner is a charming Italian man named Francesco who took our order as soon as we were ready. He brought the food out for us himself and described what he was putting in front of us. The pizzas were gorgeous. I got the Pistacchi e Salsiccia (pistachio pesto, sausage, mozzarella, basil) and my friend got the Diavolo (spicy sausage, arugula, tomato, and pepper). Both were delicious and artfully presented. Both were huge, too. I could only eat about three slices and had to take the rest of my pizza home. My grandpa straight from China loved the Pistacchi e Salsiccia, and he is very selective about what he finds delicious. I think he would like to come here with me next time he visits SF.

The volume of the restaurant is pretty quiet. When I was waiting for my friend to find parking, I could hear the entire conversation of the double date going on behind me. The group consisted of two Asian American girls and two Asian American guys, girls on one side and guys on the other, so maybe it wasn't a double date, but maybe an acci-date. They left a little bit after my friend arrived, and the only other customer in the place was a middle-aged, well-dressed gentleman dining by himself. My friend and I were able to catch up on about six months' worth of life events (I live in Seattle, she stayed in the Bay). I liked that the setting was quiet and intimate, however I'm surprised more people don't come here for lunch. Maybe the place is hopping around dinner time!

We truly left feeling like we've dined on the streets of Naples.
author: Di W.

description: Horrible horrible place.  Stood outside for 10 minutes and no one even looked at us. Had to walk in a tab the person on the shoulder and got ask to wait for 5 more minutes just so they can tell us we have to wait for 40 minutes while there are empty tables outside. Walked by 20 minutes later table still empty. Pathetic service.
author: Hubert W.

description: We came here for a family dinner (with all of the family being adults) and we had an amazing time! This place is so small and cozy, the staff is friendly, the service fast, and the food tasty. We ordered three different pasta dishes and a pizza. They were all wonderful. All of the pastas were fresh, evenly cooked, and just plain tasty! The pizza was great, and that's saying something as I'm from New York! We also had dessert, cannoli and profiterole. They were both fantastic! With how close this is to downtown and how great the food was, we will definitely be back!
author: Hannah W.

description:
TERRIBLE SERVICE MATCHED BY TERRIBLE FOOD. We waited forever for the waiter. Then after taking drink orders we didn't see him again for EVER. I'll never return. We sat  at the table closest to the kitchen -- beware-- there is a door in the back behind the kitchen so it was freezing at our table. Do not sit at that table.   The food was mediocre at best. The bruschetta is on a giant cracker--not crusty Italian bread as in Italy. Pizza was OK.  No tastable spices whatsoever. We had the 1/2 cooked salmon--total disappointment. 

Never again.
author: Marcy L.

description: I've been here twice and still enjoy it. We had three of their pizzas last night, and each was crisp, flavorful, and delicious. You also have to try their beet salad, with the beets sliced thinly (carpaccio style). It's a must every time for me. Will definitely be back again.
author: Catherine T.

description:
What's better for business?  Taking ten seconds to turn around and acknowledge someone has entered your restaurant and you will be right with them, or risking that that very person will take 90 seconds to right a negative review about your restaurant.  

Piss poor customer service.  can't speak for the food, because we were never even greeted.
author: Mike S.

description: We stopped in after having happy hour at a couple places on Belden place.  We got the inferno special pizza to go ( not too spicey for us).  We walked about 15 mins back to our room up a steep hill and ate the pizza and it was delicious!  Crispy crust and just the right amount of  meat, cheese and peppers. I think we will probably go again before the long weekend is over.
author: Kelli H.

description:
The service is what makes this place. You will always feel welcomed especially if Antonio is there.  Great food with fresh ingredients. 

My favs prosciutto e burrata, 3 color salad, margherita, and pistacchi and salsiccia....yum! Wash it down with a Peroni or Blie moon and its all good!!

I've also had the parpadelle with pork ragu....obviously I'm a carnivore, washed down with a recommended glass of primitivo, excellent!  

If you dont like the noise sit inside, otherwise eat outside and enjoy the hussle n bussel of Kearny street. All in all you won't be disappointed!
author: Nins D.

description:
It's a small, hole-in-the-wall restaurant, and that's exactly what makes it so perfect.  The ambience was nice, our waiter was gracious and friendly, and the food was scrumptious.  

Tip #1: POSSIBLY THE BEST COMPLIMENTARY BREAD I'VE EVER HAD BEFORE. I'm not even kidding. I could have sat there and ate the bread all night.

Tip #2: Pretty small restaurant, has a date-night feel.

Overall: Although it's a little expensive, I think the food and service make it worth it.
author: Sarah W.

description:
Yes, it's small. It's quaint. The main waiter is Italian. But what really counts is the food, and I was no impressed.

The spaghetti and meatballs that everyone raves about was so pedestrian. My first bite into the meatball had some gristle (we're talking huge here. ick), and the overall texture of the meatball was not good. The spaghetti was whatever, the sauce forgettable, but the price? It's a crime to charge that much for that pasta. 

The wine the waiter recommended didn't sit well with me after the meal. I can't place it... it hadn't gone bad, no hint of mold, cork felt fine, but it just... tasted cheap. I mean, I wasn't expecting much from any of the wines. The priciest bottle they had was $44 (and I think ours was $38?), but I don't get sick from wine, not like this. It wasn't a "I-drank-so-much-oh-I-feel-sick" kind of feeling, but rather "what-kind-of-$2-wine-did-I-put-into-my-body??" feeling of just ickiness (apologies to all the amazing French wines I had for under 5 Euros and to Two-buck Chuck). 

The only saving grace was the pizza (pistachio and sausage). That was pretty much the highlight of our meal.

Service... eh. The waiter asked us to wait for a table to clear (diners were a few moments away from paying), but even after the waitstaff cleared the table, the waiter left us waiting outside for about ten minutes. (Mind you, this place is small, and it was half-empty when we arrived). Even during the meal, the waiter pretty much ignored us with the wine pours. A younger waitress kept coming by and asking if we were done with our meal when there was still a good amount of food left (are we not allowed to pause for conversation?), which made me feel a bit rushed, so overall, not the best dining experience.

Yelp, I just don't understand the 4.5 star review for this place.
author: mina y.

description: Had a yummy pizza here last night, even though it wasn't the pizza we ordered.  But we loved it, and the crust was thin and had a good chew factor to it.  We also had a bottle of Chianti.  The value was extremely good, and the service efficient and friendly. The owner came by several times to make sure all was well and treated us to a complimentary warm apple tort for dessert.  It was served with whipped cream and was delicious.  It felt like we were in Italy with the ambiance and generosity.  Can't wait to come back!
author: Linda H.

description: The staff were wonderful.  Its small, but that is a bonus in my opinion. The food is awesome and I would recommend this place.
author: Sheila S.

description:
VERY slow service. Despite telling them not to bring everything at once it took them 55 minutes to bring out 2 pizzas and.... 2 salads!!!!

The (I presume) manager, spent those 55 minutes telling the mexican kid preparing the pizzas how slow he was. Not for a second he thought it may be a good idea to help him.

Also, by the time they decided to bring more water to the table we already had finished our food. And not happy with all of the above, they did underline the "suggested gratuity" when they brought the check. I mean, seriously?

They simply have a larger space than their kitchen capacity can possibly cater.  Either they are not capable of doing the very basic maths or they just dont care.

Unless you have a lot of time to waste I'd rather look for other options. Ah, pizzas were good, rest of the food fairly average.
author: John M.

description:
Wow! The food! 

We wandered in one evening. Luckily we made reservations on the way because they prefer that you do, even if they are not very busy.

It looked fairly ordinary from the outside but when we stepped in trailing two small kids we realized it was more date night than family night. Very small and quiet, golden lighting, great ambiance. 

The kids shared the pasta bolognese, I had the best ravioli of my life (stuffed with cheese and in a pesto sauce dotted with cubes of melting mozzarells) and even the simple pepperoni pizza was bursting with fresh flavors.

I had some stress making sure the kids did not exceed the ambient sound level but the food kept everyone happy.

I didn't notice anything bad about the service. They might be less effusive than other places but that doesn't bother me.

I will go back for sure.
author: Mily G.

description: Wow, great service, excellent food and Francesco the owner is a great guy. I was traveling on business so eating alone and he went out if his way to make me welcome. The pappardelle Bolognese was fantastic and the hand made pasta made the meal. They have wine by the glass and the house Chianti is pretty darn good especially at $8 a glass. Overall it's one of the better meals I've had in SF. It's a shirt walk from the Omni. Hotel
author: Shawn R.

description:
Just a little walk from Market Street on Kearny.  But worth every step!  I had a house salad and the cheese ravioli.  I asked for the bolognese sauce.  And it was wonderful.  Nice crusty Italian bread and olive oil served with my meal.  Finished it all off with a truly excellent cup of nice Italian coffee.  Great ambiance weather you sit inside or out.  A perfect place to sit and watch the world go by while enjoying a relaxing lunch or dinner.

The service was exceptional as well.  Very professional and knowledgable staff.  I believe the fellow who served me was named Antonio.  I hope that I got that right.  He made sure that my food arrived with perfect timing, and that I was happy with what I ordered.  I will be taking my wife next time we are in town.  This is a great place for a quiet dinner for two.  A wonderful little place off the beaten path.  Take an extra few steps to enjoy a good meal at a place most tourists never get to!
author: Cliff R.

description: The taste is very good for Chinese. I like the spaghetti with three meat balls and the soup. Service is very good.
author: J W.

description:
I'm always really happy when YELP does you a solid and this place speaks to that. I was in SF visiting from LA and I was in the mood for Italian. So of course I YELPed where to go and this place seemed to get good reviews + raved of authenticity so I decided to partake....choice well made!
