I love a place where I feel like I'm walking back into Italy (deep breath, eyes closed, take a moment to soak it all in).  Yeah, this place is legit!! From the staff who mingled with me in Italian to the amazing wine selection & decadent main dishes to choose from this place had me from hello to goodbye.  I really enjoyed the pesto pizza (my #1 recommended dish) but the pasta (capellini  - angel hair pasta with white wine, shrimp, tomatoe,  arugola and garlic) was really good as well.  My only regret: that I didn't stay for dessert.  I foolishly went to some gelato place that I'm sure didn't deliver the same authenticity that this place could have provided in that arena.

So in hopes of passing along the Yelp baton do yourself a favor and stop into this lovely little piece of Italian heaven.  You won't regret it!
author: Chrystal F.

description: I've eaten here several times.  Because I'm 100% Italian, it's difficult for to to find an Italian restaurant that I will go back too, but I found it here! The owner, Tony, is a hands on owner, serving tables, friendly with the customers and the food is outstanding!  Reasonable priced and feel free to ask Tony to make you something special!  You won't be sorry you tried this place out.
author: Martha R.

description: This place was amazing - honestly the best pizza we've had.  We were visiting from Houston and decided to have an early dinner here - AWESOME pizza, good wine,  great friendly service, and nice and quiet and cozy.  My husband loved the Caesar salad (a confirmed Caesar salad snob).  Would 100% come back!
author: Caitlin J.

description:
excellent value for the food. we had

-- burrata and cherry tomatos on pizza bread appetizer (amazing burrata)
-- sardines with orange and fennel: very fresh fish, but if you are afraid of small bones (think haddock), this is not the one for you
-- pork cheek on soft polenta: tender cheek and buttery polenta (not overly creamy)
-- two glasses of nero d'avola from sicily: good balance of acidity, tannin, and structure

for $55 total (excluding tip). amazing deal.

it was pleasant to sit at the outside patio during a warm day, but since Kearny is a busy street, it could get a bit noisy. Wish that the sidewalks were as wide as the ones in Paris.

the server was super friendly and very helpful. I would give it 4.5 stars to be fair.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Went here with my buddies after the wait for Ramen Underground was getting too long.

They have some great pizzas here, I definitely recommend the pistachio pesto pizza.

The wait staff of the restaurant are personable and friendly.
author: Michael W.

description: Just finishing meal here. Was very nice and tasty meal with good and not annoying service. Nice lunch experience.
author: Ilia G.

description: I would like to think that being a California, I would have tasted every pizza you can think of. But when I tell you that this place provided me the best pizza I have ever had.....there was no words for how amazing the food was here. Everything was good. Like, even down to the water. This place will be a place I come to everything I come to San Fran! Fantastic!
author: Jonathan H.

description:
Excellent place for pizza. Kinda hidden but once you are in then you feel like family. Service was impeccable! Even brought out the crumb scraper!!

We had 2 different pizzas and both were perfect. Thin crust and crispy. Good beer selection but no draft but a few good craft styles. 

Good Cesar salad too with a yummy sardine on top!!
author: Vincent F.

description:
I can sum up my experience at Pachino in two words: lovely, delicious. We came here on a Saturday night and the place was packed. There was a huge ~20 person party and the restaurant was super hot and crowded. Although no one was seated outside, we asked if we could sit out there and the owner (?) said, of course! I immediately felt bad realizing we'd have to make wait staff come outside just for us but the owner insisted it was fine. He was extremely warm, funny, and welcoming. We shared the grilled seared caesar salad, the funghi and taleggio pizza, and the tiramisu. The pizza was amazing! The mozzarella and mushrooms were incredibly fresh and the crust was thin and perfectly crispy. The tiramisu was the BEST I've ever had and I'm glad I saved room for it! Tiramisu can be overwhelmingly sweet and heavy but Pachino's was perfect - just sweet enough and sooo creamy.

Service was also wonderful and the wait staff/owner never seemed annoyed serving us outside. This is the kind of place that has loyal customers b/c of their quality of food and service. I can't wait to go back!
author: Allison F.

description: Amaaaaazing food! We had somewhat of a pistachio themed dinner, with the roasted beet salad, pea soup, and an absolutely phenomenal pizza, the pistacchi e salsiccia! Great balance between sweet and salty and nutty. Overall really pleased with the service, food, and ambience. Well done!
author: Jazzy E.

description:
Fantastic little place in the Financial District.  I've been working in this area forever, and didn't know that there was such a little place in the middle of everything.

My friend and I ordered pizza here: a margarita and one with just Italian sausage.  They were perfect.  The crust was chewy, doughy, yet not too thick.  The sauce was also slightly tarty and sweet, with just the right amount of savory.  And the mozzarella was perfectly cheesy, chewy, and fragrant.  It was really a fantastic pizza for the West Coast.  Reminded me of pies almost as good as those I find in New York.

The service here was also friendly and attentive.  Solid place for a pie.
author: Mark M.

description: Spaghetti carbonara was top notch. And a classy place in the hustle and bustle of the Financial District -- but not pretentious. A hard combo to achieve, but this place gets it right.
author: Mel G.

description:
Bellissimo! The food, the service, the ambience...wonderful!
Francesco and staff bring fresh pasta with simple and light Southern Italian flavors in reasonable portions. We shared the special orecchiette with fresh sausage ragu and the ravioli - both delivered. 
We ended our meal with a special salad instead of dessert - golden and red beets with shaved ricotta salada, fresh spinach and avocado, and a sprinkle of pistachios and a light dressing.

The service is at a good pace, momentum is continuous, and the back waitress and Francesco never had downtime.

There also appeared to be a good selection of appetizers and pizzas(8 or so of each) as well as wine and beer. 

Call ahead if you can or get there early- it's a small and intimate establishment. If it's nice out, there are a couple of tables outside the front door. 

Check the specials board.

This place is a gem in the Financial district!
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Mamma Mia! what was that? A congenial European food, a legit Italian host Antonio (a endearing Capo) in a cozy restaurant right in the heart of San Fran? The whole city was hiding this place from me? Why, why why?!!!! I loved that food so much I felt like it was my birthday or some other special day. I didn't try the pizza but everybody around us looked very pleased eating pizza there, and of course I will be back to revel in. If you enjoy sharing good food with loved ones, this is one of those places that you forget about world outside, oh! don't forget to try some good Italian wine.

We had a phenomenal Burrata, tortelline filled with brazed pork,  astonishing Spaghetti Pachino  and Italian house wine.

I really felt like I was in Rome, the same vibe and same good food and I am sure you will connect with the same energy as well. Enjoy your time there and say hello to Antonio tell him I miss his passion for that place. I really recommend Pachino Trattoria & Pizzeria. This is a family business and they know what they are doing there :). Enjoy.
author: Cintia C.

description: My partner and I had dinner here last Saturday and were less than impressed with what we were served.  We ordered their appetizer of tuna "meatball", a barely warm plate of canned balls of tuna, to share.  For our entrée, I ordered the gnocchi Bolognese, again served barely warm and the gnocchi looked like they have been reheated in a microwave with dried tomato sauce in patches.  My partner's vegetarian lasagna looked the freshest, with the thin layers of pasta tasting freshly cooked.  However, both sauces for the pasta dishes have unpleasantly sour notes, not appetizing at all.  I'm giving this place two stars only because of the warm, friendly service we received from the woman who appeared to be the manager and was also the main server that evening.  She deserves to be working with much better quality dishes than what we received.
author: Yvette F.

description: Small, quaint, pleasant service if not busy... but the food to me has always just been 'A-OK'.  Never anything amazing... never anything bad... just right down the middle.
author: Shawn M.

description:
I loved this little place.  I wandered in after a long day of travel that ended up with United Airlines losing my luggage (Can I review them here? I give United zero stars.) That experience, combined with a raging migraine must have shown on my face. The maître d (a polite professional Italian. Is he the owner?) went out of his way to make me feel welcome. Even though they were full, he told me to wait a few minutes and he'd get me in. Typically, a busy restaurant doesn't want a single taking up a table, but this guy turned other people away for me. 

The food was as good as the service. Top tier, brick oven pizza and real home made pasta (when you've had it, you can taste the difference.)  The Maître d came over later to ask if I was feeling better - and I definitely was. Good food, a relaxing atmosphere and first rate service  - not to mention a few glasses of wine - have a way of washing away your troubles.
author: David B.

description: This place is simply amazing, they went out their way to accommodate our requests and the food was perfection. Great casual yet sheik atmosphere! Way Better than any of those Italian joints around the corner !
author: D C.

description: This is a wonderfully authentic experience. Not pretentious... Simple, delicious and romantic....
author: Erik W.

description:
My wife and I are visiting San Francisco for the weekend.  We called this restaurant because it is a short walk from our hotel.  I asked if they could make a vegetarian pizza without cheese.  They could.
We arrived, were seated and confirmed our order in less than 15 minutes.  The place was busy.  Our pizza arrived in a few minutes.  You might think that a vegetarian pizza would be a little flavorless.  This one didn't even have tomato sauce.  It was delicious!  The olive oil tasted like butter. The veggies were beautifully roasted so that they were right at the edge of their flavor, and the crust may be the best I've ever had on a pizza.
This is a place worth marking on my map.  I hope you go and enjoy it.
author: Rick S.

description:
2 stars warrant "Meh, I've experienced better." 3 stars warrant "A-OK." I'm torn, because it was A-OK, but I've definitely experienced better. To give a warm, heart-felt example to my other elites (and now, being a gold elite, I feel like I have a greater duty to use my gold seal with accountability), I'll be generous and move towards the 3. But to be honest, it would be a 2.5.

First of all, I am completely flabbergasted that this place got 4.5 stars. My friend, visiting from NY, gathered all of her Bay Area friends to a dinner here last night. We had a party of 9, and though 9 is a pretty large party, we were one of two tables populating the (small) restaurant. We met at 8:00, but due to the rain and usual fashionably late social stigmas, we didn't put in our order until about 8:30. Everyone ordered a typical item... pasta here, pizza there. The hubs and I decided to share their salad du jour (local sardines and orange slices) and to share their Spaghetti Carbonara. The only spaghetti I've experienced (both at home and out) was with tomato sauce, so I was feeling adventurous, coupled with the comfort from my husband reinstating that carbonara is delicious.

I know we had 9 people (again), but we waited 45 minutes for our food to arrive. at 8:30 pm on a Wednesday night. Sure, it could've been because there were so many orders, but there was only ONE other table in the restaurant (with TWO PEOPLE! They even got their meal AND dessert before we got our entries!). They took so long that they even refilled our bread baskets. Side note, bread not impressive. First one I ate was stale. Second was kinda fluffy, but very thin with lots of bubbles on the inside.

We finally got our salad, which was pretty tasty. 2 large sardines roasted, great seasoning. There was a small bunch of seasoned arugula, peeled oranges and thin slices of what seemed to be radish, tossed in a viniagrette. Standard enough. The carbonara was a huge disappointment. Since we ate the salad first (mind you, we only took a few minutes), the carbonara ended up being a sticky ball of soggy pasta, white sauce thickened and acting as a glue holding all of the noodles together. When I finally forked my way through the pasta to create individual strands, I could only make out a few pieces of thinly-sliced meat in the mess. Noodles cooked too long and sauce was mediocre. I was so hungry that I inhaled it, but it was inhaled sadly.

They added their own 18% tip at the end, which I know is standard with large parties, but I think is a generous tip for mediocre food that took 45 minutes to produce. My husband said he would never come back. I think I have to agree.
author: Becky K.

description:
Dinner on Friday should NOT have gone well. I called to make a reservation on Thursday for a party of 10 at 730p, stopped by on Friday to increase my party to 13 and then called Friday afternoon to increase it to 14. The manager could not have been friendlier throughout the process, and was happy to oblige, despite to fact that we would be taking up half of his restaurant on a Friday night. That was easy. Getting there on time would be the bigger challenge.

After happy hour boots at Schroeders, we (no surprises) showed up almost 40 minutes late for our reservation, calling the restaurant twice from happy hour to push it back. The manager was STILL cool as a cucumber, what a pro.

As far as the actual restaurant experience, food was a strong value. I've had better pasta (Trattoria Contadina) and better wood-fired pizza (Ragazza), but  Pachino delivers some very tasty grub for the price. Next group outing, I will not hesitate to return to Pachino...if they will have me.
author: chris n.

description:
After reading reviews for all of the Italian places in the Union Square are and Financial District, I decided this was the place to try.  That research paid off.  The place is truly amazing.

My father and I were able to walk right in around 9pm on a Tuesday and share the place with only two other parties.  The restaurant only has a handful of tables inside and a couple outside, so we were happy to get right in.  We had just come from the Rickhouse bar one block down, which is a great place to get drinks before you settle down with some really great Italian food.

Our server may have been the same person that other reviews refer to - the owner/chef that is incredibly friendly and takes great pride the food they prepare.  He was very attentive, polite and deeply appreciated the complements we provided at a few points during our meal.

I had the bean soup with prosciutto, which was a special that I hope they continue to offer.  It is probably the best soup I have ever tasted.

Their wine list is brief.  There are about a dozen bottles to choose from.  If you just want to order a glass you simply pick by varietal and receive the house selection.  I went with the montepulciano, which stood up well to the pizza I ordered that had spicy sausage and spicier peppers.

The thin crust pizza was fantastic.  I know people like to play the who has the best pizza in town game, if you were to say that this pizza is the best, I would not blame you for it at all.

My friend's family owns an Italian restaurant that offers some of the best tiramisu you can find.  I've made it a personal challenge to try to find other establishments that offer a worthy competitor to it, and Pachino has officially made it onto my list.  I'm sure their other deserts are fantastic as well, but when I return the only way I'll get to try the others is if we have at least one tiramisu on the table as well.
author: Kenny J.

description:
Came here for dinner with a friend -- great little hole in the wall Italian place in the FiDi area. Owner / manager was very accommodating and let us substitute items that were not on the menu (but we had read rave reviews about on Yelp). He offered wonderful wine pairings.

Food and wine and dessert were all delicious.
author: Nicha K.

description:
I was worried about the service after reading some of the reviews, but it was very good: very warm, and fairly prompt.

If you are wondering, this is a nicely decorated sit-down restaurant, not a pizza-by-the-slice joint.

The food was delicious: Margherita Extra pizza, with yummy burrata, roasted beet salad and garlic bread. We shared the tiramisu at the end and it was first rate. Bill was $56 for 3 people, which I thought was pretty good for what we got.
author: Rodrigo B.

description:
This place is amazing.
Great service ,very very delicious pizzas and food .
Francesco thanks for your warm  welcome and for wonderful service.
author: Angela N.

description: Really nice experience to be here. Cosy, nice and social waitress and good food. I'm italian and definitely recommend this place.
author: Daniele P.

description: The pizza here is amazing! Order the eggplant one. You will not be disappointed. Service is excellent too. It's a small place that's easy to miss but such a hidden gem. I will be back here for sure the next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Jasmin A.

description: Came here last night with a few friends.  The restaurant had accidentally given our reservation away to someone with a similar name, but the proprietor was very apologetic and accommodating, first seating us at an empty smaller table and eventually moving us to a larger one.  And he comped us a round of drinks.  For appetizers we had meatballs and bruschetta.  Both were good, but not memorable.  For my entree I got the Cavatelli (with sausage and truffle cream sauce).  It was absolutely delicious.  The pasta itself was great, and the sauce and sausage made for a great flavor combination.  I will definitely be coming back here to try their other pastas.
author: Simon L.

description:
I have to say, I missed this kind of pizza - I had the Prosciutto, Arugula and fresh mozzarella - YUM YUM YUM. Seriously this thing is the bomb, especially with the perfectly made crust. Crispy and chewy at the same time, OMG I'm drooling again :)
I also tried one of their pasta, and wow, another yummy dish. We also ordered a Carpaccio appetizer that was excellent. The place is very cozy and the service was excellent. The guy was really professional and welcoming - such a great service that it didn't feel like a pizzeria. Overall, this place is cozy, affordable and good service
author: Tongue-Me e.

description:
Growing up across the street from an Italian family that made everything from scratch, I've always had high standards for Italian. This place had exceeded my expectations. I ordered the roasted octopus, Ceci bean, (garbanzo beans), and potato (warm) salad and my significant other ordered the pesto pizza. To my surprise they served the small octopus whole and the overall presentation was gorgeous. The octopus was succulent and tender; the best octopus I've ever had (and that's saying a lot because I have had it a lot and in Asian). The garbanzo beans were also super tender and extremely flavorful.

The place is small (seats maybe less than 30 inside?), but cozy. You walk in and it's warm and it has a great ambiance. Jazz playing in the background and the owner (I'm guessing is the owner) was extremely nice and came back to check up on us every so often (I hate being ignored at restaurants). You could tell that everything was crafted with care. Most definitely a place to take your significant other out on a date. Would come back again when I'm in town!
author: Sam V.

description:
Eh, this place was fine. I found it after searching for a nearby italian restaurant with good reviews. The place is TINY (less than 10 tables) so definitely make a res even for a Monday night. When we arrived, two waitresses were running the FOH and neither acknowledged our presence for over 5 minutes (which is really hard to do since the place is so very small). After feeling invisible for awhile, we literally had to walk right up to one of the waitresses to get seated. Once seated, the waitress was very nice. 

We ordered two glasses of cab, both were fine but seemed overpriced for the quality.Very average bread was delivered to the table with nothing to dip it in except for a very unflavorful olive oil concoction that we made ourselves. We wanted to start with the caprese salad and the appetizer meatballs, but they were out of meatballs so we went with the caprese and the grilled calamari with white beans. Both were pretty bland and lacked flavor. The pesto that garnished the salad had literally no flavor, the tomatoes were very distinctively strange tasting and the mozzarella had a tough texture. The grilled calamari was completely unseasoned, the actual calamari in the dish was very little, it was mostly filled with white beans. 

The only kinda redeeming quality was the main couse we shared - saltimbocca, prosciutto and sage, white wine sauce, served with spaghetti. It was creamy and delicious but the portion was very small, and you could tell the dish had been drowned in heavy cream to make it so delicious but lacked any other seasoning or creativity by the chef. Still, we enjoyed it after topping with lots of red pepper, parmesan, and pepper. 

We probably won't go back but if we do, will get the pizza.
author: Piyali F.

description: Very warm and friendly!! The seating was cozy and comfortable. Food was excellent! Best pizza ever!!! Will definitely come back next time we visit :)
author: Mina A.

description:
The financial district doesn't have a whole lot of great food options, especially for dinner. You can easily identify this place by its neon sign, which is clearly visible at night when all their neighbors are closed. The interior is tiny and dimly-lit; there are only a handful of tables inside, and a few outside. The tables are white-clothed and the seats are comfortable, although sandwiched alongside each other in an uncomfortable fashion. 

I didn't look at the prices or menu when I went in, because I wanted to try it out nonetheless, but it was more expensive than I had presumed. I paid $28 without tip for spaghetti and meatballs ($16) and a glass of red wine ($10). As I was one person, I was clearly not a priority for the restaurant employees(owner?) who served me. They were not mean, but I suppose uninterested in my patronage. One waiter for all those tables seems to be a stretch... I received my glass of wine after waiting ten minutes... I received my packaged meal 5 minutes later...

As I was trying to finish my wine before I left, I was asked to move tables, so a larger party could be accommodated. Okay, no big deal, but you could've served my drink immediately and I would have already been gone. Even when there are a lot of people breathing down your neck, you don't want to shortchange anyone on the 'experience' at a restaurant; even if they are only getting take-out. In my opinion, this isn't easy to do, but it's important with establishments of this size. I see they have a lot of business whenever I walk by, so maybe they don't care about service, but it's important to me.

When I got back to my studies and started eating, I understood why anyone would like this place. The food is great. The people who work at this restaurant are actually Italian, and it shows. I would recommend coming here with a party of two or four: that should give you the best possible impression of the place. Also, come here to sit down and eat, don't get take-out. This restaurant is too expensive for take-out.

Tip: This seems to be a tourist haven as well, due to its close proximity to Chinatown and Union Square.
author: Alex F.

description: Came for a quick dinner here and it was a good overall experience. Intimate setting and great service. Had a good carbonara. Didn't give five stars because it was not overly special but no complaints either.
author: Tee K.

description:
Food was great. Perfect size portion and fresh ingredients. Would  recommend. 

Very nice atmosphere and service was excellent.
author: Jay F.

description: The service was great, the food was average it's nothing special, location depends on whether you sit inside or outside I think you're better off sitting inside because the outside isn't super nice and it's a really busy area so it's pretty loud. I probably won't be returning but they aren't a bad spot to check out!
author: Star B.

description:
Forget all the other reviews. Hands down, you have just found the best Italian place in San Francisco. 

The pasta, made in the large kitchen below, is spot on exquisite. Don't bring a large party of people, here. It's small and European. The attention to your food is a relief. I had to ask for a dish without cheese (allergies), and they revamped the dish by adding scrumptious sauteed produce.  

Saw the outside and are thinking, "She can't be talking about *this* place"? 
Inside is a warm atmosphere. The owner has such poise, elegance, and a refinement that can't be bought. 

I am a picky foodie that never visits a place twice. My coworkers, peers, and friends take my recommendations over others, and find their favorite places through my introductions to new foods. Pachino Trattoria is where I send all Italian food and/or cuisine lovers.
author: Sam E.

description: Amazing!  Looking for pasta and they delivered!  Homemade daily with sauces that were out of this world!!  Friendly service and so polite!!  Can't wait to come back!
author: Kevin B.

description:
Couldn't have asked for a more perfect meal to wrap up our visit to SF. We saved the best for last.

This charming, little gem of a restaurant will stand out as our best meal in town. We found it on yelp, chose it because of its ratings, menu and location. We got lucky!

The menu offered something delicious for each of us. We started off with the 4-meat meatballs. Wow! Never had anything quite like that flavor! I wish I had more room to enjoy the last bites of my ravioli. It was a beautiful as it was sumptuous. My son savored each bite of his pizza. I was hoping for a taste, but I was too slow.

Our server was so warm and welcoming. He had an innate sense when to check on us, and when to let us visit. We recently buried two people we love and the conversation became emotional. Like magic, a little extra wine appeared in my glass. So kind! He shook my hand and thanked me by name as we left. I wanted to hug him!

Thank you for such an enjoyable meal and a warm welcome. Wish we lived closer.
author: Susan O.

description:
The Dish: I went to this place for a friend's birthday dinner so we ordered 2 pizzas and 2 pasta dishes. The pesto pizza surprised me - it was awesome! I'm not a big fan of pesto, but this place is solid. It's incredibly flavorful. The other pizza wasn't as memorable. I only tried one of the pastas (might have been the capellini) - it was delicious. I almost ate it all for myself :)

Ambiance: It's a small place - and you might pass by it without noticing it, but if you get a chance, give this place a try. The waitresses are extremely helpful and kind. I'm pretty sure all their dishes are great so try anything and you'll be pleased!
author: Gina T.

description:
-Orecchiette + glass of recommended red
-Pork Fillet
-calamari - small plate but good

all was delish. owner/waiter was super italian and nice. really small, quaint and homey place. would definitely come back1
author: Janet Y.

description:
DELICIOUS! 
Their specials are special. 
The service is speedy and superb.
The atmosphere is quaint and cozy.
Try it once and you will return for more.
I am!
author: Rose H.

description: We called at 7:30 on a Wednesday night for an 8:00 reservation. Very nice phone reception and our table was waiting for us. This restaurant just works. Seasonal specials with fresh ingredients. We had the bucatini and carbonara. Really loved it. Warm, comfortable environment. I am coming back.
author: Jon S.

description:
Dined at this lovely little hole-in-the-wall last night for Valentine's Day. I knew it was a teeny place, so I called to make a reservation last week for the bf and I. When we arrive half an hour early last night (happened to be in there area), the server (who I assume is the owner) was able to seat us at a large table, but then proceeded to ignore us for a good half an hour. When we finally flagged him down, it became clear that he thought our reservation was FOR eight, not AT eight. Oops. After that was cleared up, it was smooth sailing. 

Price: Moderate, we spent about $90 for a bottle of house red, a pizza, ravioli, two espressos and a tiramisu. (Hey it was v-day, we went all out)

Ambiance: Dim, romantic, a little crowded so if you don't like people listening, and possibly partaking, in on your conversation, this probably isn't the joint for you.

Service: pretty good

Food: Delish! One of the best wood fired pizzas I've had in SF. I had the Genova, which was mozzarella, asiago, rosemary and sausage. Bf had ravioli which were also delicious, although not mind-blowing. Same with the tiramisu. 

Overall, a cozy and tasty evening. Also props for being only a few blocks from the Montgomery Bart station.
author: Melissa C.

description: Mediocre food, terrible and extremely slow service (had to ask for our food and check several times), and made my pregnant friend use the men's room, with a man in it, because they couldn't figure out the keycode on the women's room. VERY unimpressed.
author: Penny B.

description: The meatballs and the pizza were amazing. Straight legit Italian that I randomly went into. So glad I did.
author: George Y.

description:
Bonjourno! 
I've had pizza in Rome, Milan & Torino, and searched for it in SF ever since.  Nobody in this city makes a quatrro formaggi like Pachino, spot on!  I sat outside in the lil outdoor seating area grubbing my slices, and for a few minutes of deliciousness i was back on the streets of italy.  graci Pachino!
author: Nadeem D.

description: Nice neighborhood italian restaurant.  Be there early, the place gets packed real quick.  True italian family and true italian food.
author: Joko T.

description:
Not sure how come this place have such high rating.  We ordered a simple spaghetti with meatballs and a white pizza.   The sauce was too watery. By much taste.   Also the meatballs were cold inside, as if it was microwaved.  Also the pizza was too salty.   

The water was really nice, but the food was horrible.
author: Mohsen G.

description: Since we were in the neighborhood and because of the nice 4-star rating on Yelp, we decided to give it a try.  It's a small spot and service wasn't too slow...just average speed.  We were hoping for a great experience, but left with our taste buds unsatisfied.  We started with the Roasted Beets Salad.  It was delicious since I love beets so much.  The plate presentation was very colorful.  For entrees, we ordered the Fish Brodetto and Pappardelli Alla Bolognese.  I wanted to try the homemade magic.  Honestly, we found both a bit bland in taste and small on the portion.  It just didn't hit home with us.  We looked over at other tables and saw mostly pizza.  Those looked good and if I ever come back, I would skip the pasta.  First experiences tend to be a hit or miss...and I regret my choices this time around. I would give it 2.5 stars between "Meh. I've experienced better" and "A-OK".  Not sure if I'd return anytime soon.
author: Alvin J.

description: Great food and great service. Everything was fresh and flavorful. Our waitress was very friendly. I loved that she spoke italian. Well, it's the next day and unfortunately I have to edit my review. Even though everything was good last night, this morning I see in our leftover box that some one helped themselves to half of my leftovers. Now that I know that this is done, do yourself a favor and Just ask for the box, instead of the staff boxing it for you... Such a bummer..
author: T M.

description: Terrific lunch stop!  I walked in with zero expectations and walked away WOW!   Dynamite house made ravioli.   Friendly and prompt service.  Small and intimate space that is comfortable.  Hoping I can return for dinner again on this SF trip.  Great Italian food.
author: Patricia M.

description:
Small restaurant with delicious food and wine and a friendly waitress, this place feels genuinely Italian. 

We enjoyed a bruschetta and two pizzas amongst the two of us, you could've rolled us out afterwards there was so much good food. We proceeded to slip into a 12 hour food coma!
author: David C.

description: Literally tasted like chef boyardee. Small portions. Ordered fettuccini, got spaghetti.
author: Dan B.

description:
we stumbled upon this place after an attempt to go to a sushi place nearby which was so packed we couldnt get in.

I'm glad we found this place because the pizza was so good!
We ordered a bit too much because we didnt know that the
portions are pretty big here(which is always a plus.)

We had;

Bruschetta 
grilled octopus 

pesto pasta with shrimp
pizza (forgot the name)

lots of beer
and wine

Unfortunately the pasta didnt really have much taste, but shrimp was good and the pizza was a total killer, the service was awesome and we were totally blown away by their fresh ingredients and the dough that they used for both bruschetta and pizza.

The interior is a bit old and it could use some help, but I recommend this place on a easy carefree night.
author: Shine W.

description:
Went to this place after we couldn't get in at a nearby sushi restaurant. I'm so glad we found it on yelp. Delicious! The food was house-made and phenomenal. Too good to share.
After a long day of shopping, our server's warm welcome put us in the holiday spirit. 
Can't wait to go back!
author: Suzanne G.

description:
We were afraid of the waitress. We walked into the restaurant around 830pm or so. A couple next to us got up after just sitting down, complaining how noone had stopped by the table. We got a quick, 'hi' from the waitress, who never returned to ask us if we would like to eat/sit down, etc.    After a few awkward minutes, a man asked how many in our party, and directed us to a table. 
The waitress eventually came by with bread and water and was then fairly attentive, but I never saw her smile, not once. 
The food was good, but we felt pretty uncomfortable around her. Weird experience. 
The food certainly deserves more stars, but the waitress dragged my rating down.
author: Alison A.

description: The server was so personable. Love the intimate and cozy feel. Wonderful anniversary dinner!
author: Heather R.

description: Wow I tried the Regina margherita, the pizza with fennel sausage arugula and Serrano pepper and it was one of the best pizzas I have ever had. Fresh and good ingredients in a wood fired oven like it should be done. The ambience is great and the service was amazing. Would definitely come back.
author: Pj E.

description:
Absolutely my favorite Italian place in SF. Not touristy. Totally Authentic ingredients and results. I highly recommend any of the pizzas - they are Napoli thin-crust style. You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Occassionally as a salad special they will offer the Chianti-poached pear stuffed with Marscapone over an Arugula salad - go for it!

An Italian-accented gentleman named Dario is often the sole waiter in the small place (maybe 8 tables total), and he will treat you like family.
author: Chris D.

description: The bruschetta was simply divine - the best I've ever had an authentic Italian trattoria, hands down! The margherita tradizionali was fresh, true Neapolitan style pizza. The best of Italy in San Fran!!
author: Chris J.

description: Awesome.  Just awesome. True Italian pizza with very fresh quality ingredients. Warm environment, not over crowded, a real treat.
author: Nicole K.

description:
Well, for some reason this placed popped up on my radar a lot in the last week. Had never heard of it and I love pizza! 

The grilled caesar was delicious!

The Regina margherita was pretty fantastic. Not perfect, but pretty damn close. A great balanced flavor (only reason it was not perfect is my two slices did not have any cheese whatsoever on them and it was a tad overcooked).

But damn it was still delicious. In fact, I tend to enjoy my pizza cooked, not too mushy or limp. This was neither, crispy all the way to the crust.

The charming owner Francesco was very busy and made up for any shortcomings by being super charming, and a bit more vino which never hurts. I didn't even complain, he was just on top of it.

What a gem!
author: Mel L.

description: Great pizza, excellent service, and authentic atmosphere. I will be back as it was enjoyable. Highly recommend the Pizza.
author: NW S.

description:
I wanted to find something wrong with this place, but I couldn't! 

Touristy Union Square/FiDi location? Check. 
Slow on a Wednesday night? Check. 
Nondescript interior with a weird layout? Check. 

Therefore, I was completely prepared to have a less-than-stellar meal. But it was late and I was starving...so I decided to give it a try. Surprisingly, the caesar salad was crisp and light with a flavorful dressing. The spaghetti pachino was perfectly al dente with its fresh noodles and light tomato sauce. On top of all that, the service was warm, friendly and prompt. 

Definitely more of a neighborhood joint than a marquee dining destination, but solid nonetheless.
author: Eeeeestar T.

description:
This place is amazing! Five friends and I went for an early dinner on Saturday.  We were all looking for a pre-race meal for a run on Sunday, so obviously, attacked the pasta part of the menu.  Pasta is a rough thing for me to order at restaurants.  I am not a big fan of pure marinara/red sauce, and sometimes, just feel like -- I can make pasta at home, right?

We each got something different and all the dishes were fantastic!  The pasta is hand-made (mmmmmmm), and although the ingredients were simple, the outcome was fantastic.  Warm Ciabatta bread was heartily consumed and all of our plates were COMPLETELY cleaned.

The service was good as well.  They don't rush you or breathe down your neck, and even though the restaurant is small and we were taking up a large table in the back, we never felt the need to cash out and run (even though 2 of our party only had drinks).

The pizza looked and smelled amazing.  I need to get back there pronto for some brick-oven goodness!
author: Sara W.

description: So yummy! Loved the atmosphere and the staff! The tiramisu is amazing. Spaghetti with meatballs was also great.
author: Megan B.

description: Fantastic pizza, just the right amount of char & chewy-ness without too much gluten development. The fresh pasta was well done, but its meat sauce a bit flat. Service was friendly but scattered and a little slow.
author: Ben G.

description:
Really enjoyed our meal here. My partner and I were wandering around Kearny trying to find some dinner after a grueling workshop. This place looked inviting and quiet, just what we needed after an intense day.

A tall chap named Dario and a lovely hostess/waitress both took care of us. They were super attentive and service was fast and friendly. They were both happy to chat about the food, the city, the workshop we'd just taken. We came in as customers and left feeling like we'd made a couple of friends. Service: five stars

We ordered:
Roasted beet and goat cheese salad: four stars. Perfect mix of flavors and texture
Chicken saltimbocca: three stars. My partner adored it. The flavor was fantastic, the meat was just a tad overcooked and dry. The accompanying pasta was glorious, though. Fresh spinach on the side, perfectly cooked. 
Hangar steak in chianti sauce: three and a half stars. Gorgeous cut of meat. The sauce did not overpower the meat and it really let the greens served with the meal shine. 
Creme caramel - three stars. Nice.

Lovely wine recommendations with our meal, their wines by the glass are good quality and nicely priced.

Was it expensive? Yes. Worth the money for the dining experience, imo. We felt truly welcomed in the space, well taken care of, and the food was nice. Portions were on the smallish side if you're used to contemporary American dining out style portions and this might contribute to a feeling of things being overpriced. However, we were not underfed when we left - we felt comfortably full but not stuffed.

We will definitely go back next time we are in the city.
author: R H.

description: A friend and I went here in March, and I feel bad it took me so long to write a review because it was FANTASTIC! We loved it so much that we came back the next day for dinner, too. When we were there they had a salmon pasta on their specials menu, and it was incredible! So delicious that I'm drooling just thinking about it. Their pizza is also great. Francesco was our waiter and he was absolutely delightful. I would recommend this place to anyone in SF!
author: Lenore M.

description: I only had a salad, and did not appreciate being made to feel stupid when asking if the "prosciutto, burata, and arugula (misspelled)" was a salad. Other salads were designated as such, and it could have been bruschetta or something else. Although the arugula was the typical bitter green, the salad really was quite good.  Small restaurant very close quarters.
author: KD S.

description: This place is the bomb digity. Monica was a great server! Great recommendations. The food is amazing, the service is first class, and the atmosphere is the bees knees. I would highly recommend a date night or a great homemade family dinner. Monica is the best!
author: Bryan B.

description: A very tight space with one waitress?  I didn't get it.  Completely disorganized and their pizza was just ok.  Not enough toppings.  Hardly any little morsels of basil on a margherita pizza?  Hardly any cheese?  Wow, they made some pure profit off my dough with sauce order.  So completely disappointed.
author: Linda H.

description: My husband and I came for a late dinner Saturday evening around 9pm and were seated promptly at a table by the window. The restaurant is cozy and good for a couples and small groups. My husband ordered the linguini with clams and mussels and he really enjoyed it. I had the pizza diavola and thought the crust was delicious. the center of the pizza was a bit soggy but I chalked it up to the use of fresh tomatoes. I'd give it 4 stars but I subtract one for somewhat impersonal, abrupt service and they forgot to give us our leftover pizza after we asked for it to be wrapped up to go.
author: Caroline K.

description: I had the funghi pizza and the Nero D'Avola wine. The service was very friendly and even though I dined by myself they were friendly (which is not always my experience when dining on my own). I thought the pizza was very good. I'm not a huge fan of thin crust but I still really enjoyed it. I also saw all kinds of other dishes I wanted to try - bruschetta, pasta, great-looking desserts etc. I ordered a cappuccino after dinner and it was very good too. I live out of town and was just here for business but if I'm back in San Francisco again I wouldn't hesitate to come back.
author: Kathryn K.

description: This was the best meal during our stay in San Francisco. Charming service. Incredible food.
author: Ryan N.

description:
Excellent pizza restaurant getaway among the hustle and bustle of Kearny Street. You walk in, greeted by an amicable and upbeat owner and staff - and they pour you a nice glass of champagne so you can get some of that liquid lunch. 

Fresh pizza and pasta fill the menu with tasty meats, sauces and vegetables. I had the sausage pesto pizza (there is a fancy italian name for it, pistacchi). For a made to order pizza, it arrived within 15 minutes, which was impressive given the lunchtime crowd.

The bread was ok and music a little too loud at times, but overall a nice place.
author: Michael B.

description: We stumbled upon this little trattoria after a day of shopping in downtown. It is a total gem. The food was amazing and authentic, the host was attentive and kind, and the overall atmosphere was very intimate without feeling crowded. We will definitely be back!
author: Nadya T.

description: Great service and very good pies. It's always a pleasure when I actually get to look forward to the crust instead of dreading it or leaving it on the plate. We didn't get any other dishes but I can say for certain this place makes good pizza.
author: Graham H.

description:
It's a small place, but doesn't feel cramped at all thanks to the very high ceiling. The entrees we tried were excellent. Had the pesto pizza and pasta bolognese. You can tell that they make all their food from scratch here; the pasta was delicious, the pizza was thin, with a fluffy crust and great toppings. Delicious authentic Italian food, and the entrees were only ~$16 each, a great deal.

My only complaint is that the Caesar salad we had was pretty unappetizing. Soaked in dressing, huge pieces of toasted bread with it... and definitely not worth the $8 price tag. Can't speak for the other appetizers, but avoid the Caesar salad! We also had quite a wait for our food to arrive. The whole dinner took over two hours, most of which was spent waiting for food. We sampled some desserts as well, which were good but not amazing.
author: Laurent L.

description:
I recently came here with a large group of coworkers - about 11 of us - at the last minute. They accommodated us despite the relative size of our group and their restaurant, gave us great service, and the food was incredible. I had the ravioli which I cannot recommend highly enough, but everyone was pleased with all of the different dishes that we ordered. We had a wonderful time enjoying particularly great food. One coworker even asked for a separate bowl of the pesto sauce because it tasted so good she just had to have more.

If you're in the area, this place is well worth your time!
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
Yum, had an excellent lunch here with office mates today. Between the 7 of us we shared 2 salads, an antipasti, 2 pizzas and 3 pastas. (Yea, we're piggies.)

The grilled calamari antipasti was very tender and I sopped up the juices with the bread. The 4 cheese white pizza with truffle oil and prosciutto was defin my favorite. All their pasta dishes are hand-made. My fave was the pappardelle Bolognese with its rich, meaty sauce.

Bill came out to be ~$20/person, which is totally reasonable for the excellent wait service and amount of food we had.
author: Susan H.

description:
I've found my favorite pizza in the city! I've searched long and hard to find that certain tasting sauce that I only had from an authentic Italian pizzeria I visited as a child. The sauce they use on the pizza here just has the right taste of tangy sweet (best way I can describe it).

It gets very crowded and claustrophobic here during lunch so plan ahead or order carry out.
author: Terry C.

description: Very good Italian eatery tucked away in a small space. My wife and I shared the Cypress Salad and a simple pepperoni pizza. Bread fresh out of the oven accompanied the meal. Waitress was very attentive, though since she was the only one, service was a bit slower than you'd like. Food was fresh, pizza was cooked perfectly. Very reasonably priced.
author: Chris M.

description: Had the pepperoni pizza. It was great.  Crushed pepper was on the table and can add it w/ small spoon.  The bread before the meal was great.  Nice olive oil on the table.  Big water bottle on the table, so I can pour my own refills.  Great restaurant.
author: dylan d.

description: Cute little and romantic spot.  The owner is really sweet and keeps the place nice.  The pizza was on point! My boyfriend and I cleaned the plate.  The Cesar salad on the other hand was a big disappointment.  We ordered our dinner to-go so we were very confused when we opened the box to find a wedge of lettuce with a huge anchovy laid on the top and a dribble of dressing.  We threw the salad away and just stuck with the pizza!  I definitely recommend the pizza!
author: Samantha K.

description:
We happened upon this gem of a restaurant after a ten hour day of wine tasting in Sonoma!  It is a small cozy restaurant and lucky for us, there was an open table!  We were still a bit tipsy and eager for dinner!  Everything about this place is wonderful and there is great attention to detail.  We were taken care of by a wonderful Italian gentlemen who started us off with fresh homemade rolls we dipped in olive oil and Parmesan cheese.  I ordered the homemade meatballs and spaghetti.  The flavors were incredible...the meat a mix of veal, wild boar and beef and the noodles and sauce homemade.  My friends had the caprese salad - a feast for the eyes and taste buds and followed that up with a homemade fettuccine with sausage.  Needless to say, we all cleaned our plate.  After dinner, he brought us complimentary  lemoncello.  We ended the evening with the chocolate
torte, which tasted like perfection.  If you appreciate chocolate - this is a don't miss!!
author: Kelly K.

description: Worth the wait. Great atmosphere, authentic food.  Caprese salad, meatballs and the Diavala pizza were incredible. We'll be back.
author: Julia P.

description: Very authentically Italian. Loved the cozy interior. Delicious food, and a really surprisingly good selection of craft & microbrew beers.
author: Jessica G.

description: Excellent f ood- every time I am in SF I make a trip to Pachino for the prosciutto appitizer - amazing!!
author: Aaron G.

description:
I think the reviews here so far sum it up.  It's a great place for the food.  The Pizza is excellent and the other dishes are fresh and tasty.  I like that I can sit out on Kearny street and soak up the sun (if there is sun to soak) and have a nice lunch.  
The problem is that  the service is subpar.  There is no way around it, even though the people who work there are all friendly.  Wine takes too long to arrive, food all comes out at the same time (I'm talking first and second courses), etc.  It isn't terrible service, it just isnt as good as it should be for the price.  
I'm hoping the place irons out the kinks in service, because if they did this place would be a standard for me.  Like I said, everyone is nice and the food is great, just expect to be a little frustrated with service.  Clean up the service and this is a solid 4 star option in the fidi.
author: Blake W.

description:
Beware vegetarians: veggie lasagna had STALE veggies on it ! 
Never thought anyone could screwup a caprese salad but they did !! DON'T ORDER THE CAPRESE SALAD its terrible !

The garlic bread was the best thing on the menu
author: Kshama T.

description:
Everytime I come here I have the same server tall kind of skinny guy. He is awesome and makes great recommendations... but a liiiittle slow. 

The lunch is a little pricey but it's seriously good. I get the same thing every time - house made flat noodles with crab, extra virgin olive oil, spinach and jalapeño's soooooooo good. 

They give you a generous portion of wine!
author: Kortni S.

description: Very poor experience for our party of four. Other diners were frustrated with the wait for their food while we were seated. Then, we too experienced glacial service. One member of our party ordered a vegetarian pasta dish, it arrived with ham mixed throughout it. They did bring a replacement meal to go in a matter of minutes, for which they get the second star; but the service was unapologetic. Our ravioli with meat sauce was without meat. The spaghetti carbonara was a semi-solid mound of creamy pasta with a few pieces of bacon mixed in. All in all, it was not an experience we would wish upon others. Sorry to disappoint.
author: Chris S.

description: We had a fabulous meal.  I ordered the pesto chicken pizza with sun-dried tomatoes and husband had the spinach lasagna, was so delicious! Definitely going back again!!!
author: Leroy W.

description: A warm neighborhood restaurant, very authentic and flavorful food. The seafood risotto is incredible and the desserts are wonderful.
author: Mark H.

description:
Food is good, but  service and  atmosphere don't command  the prices. I agree what everyone says about the service, it's very mediocre.  We had to ask for bread, then butter.  We didn't  want to bother to ask for olive oil.  $13 salad came, nice but seemed too pricey.  It would be nice if they had some pasta on the plate with the entree. In fact they only have three pasta dishes all three with lots of cheese. 

 Presentation is very bland-- no basil leaves, nothing but the entree.   

So, the atmosphere-  nothing on the tables-- no table cloth, no place mats. Paper napkins.   TV  above (I always think of a sports bar when there's a TV).  This place did not feel like an Italian restaurant to me.

 The prices are the same as Belden Alley, but they don't deserve to be.
author: Dennis N.

description: Good for lunch! Great bread and dipping oil to kick off your meal.
author: Vicki L.

description: I had reservations on a Friday night (and was able to change last minute to a half hour later, so that was tight) so got seated right away. I definitely recommend booking in advance too--this place was packed due to being small, and a lot of people faced uphill wait times sans reservations when walking in. Also, when you find parking directly in front of wherever you're going, you have to assume it'll be a good night. And overall, it was. The pizza takes forever but it's really good. The Margherita pizza with pepperoni my girlfriend had was solid, but takes forever to make. My pappardelle was tasty, but the pizza was better. My only complaint is the wait times and overall service. While the owner (I assume it was the owner) is also the waiter, and has to accomodate both the inside and outside tables and does his best, we still were in there for a long time. The pizza has to cook awhile, but after around 20 minutes when I asked one of the other servers when we'd be served, she said she'd get right back to me and never did. Often enough, I saw the one cook they have in the back just waiting around for orders to fill, but maybe she had things in the oven and was waiting for them to bake. I'll give them the benefit of the doubt. But when we were finished and waiting for the check, I again (foolishly) asked the other server for the bill and after another "I'll get it to you right away", she never came back and I was forced to ask the owner for it again. I'm not sure if she just ignored me or would get it to me the next day, but being at a restaurant for over 2 hours is pretty crazy. I don't know if I'd be back simply for the wait times. The food is good, however.
author: Dan M.

description:
First, let me just say that the pizza here is really good. Wood oven pizza with high quality ingredients. The crust had the right crispness and char, and the sauce and cheese were correctly proportioned. I have yet to find a pizza in the Bay that meets all of those criteria, so well done, guys.

Having said that, there are some issues here. Thing 1: this place changed its name from Quattro Stagioni to Pachino Pizzeria last week. I called last week to place an order (based on QS's menu) and was told they were doing some renovations and would reopen this week. No mention that the menu/prices/ownership had totally changed. Luckily the pizza was still good, but I would have wanted them to be more up front.

Thing 2: When I did place my order this week, because I didn't know that it had changed hands, I was expecting QS's prices. Boy was I wrong! The individual-sized margherita with prosciutto and arugula which was $12 on the QS menu cost me $17, bringing it into overpriced land really quickly.

Thing 3: When I called this week to place my order, I was placed on hold for 25 minutes before I finally gave up. I called back 10 minutes later and was helped. Did they forget? Were they not prioritizing answering the phone? Either way, it was kind of irritating.

Bottom line: if you will pay any amount of money for good pizza, this is your place! But, I can't in good faith rate this above a 3 when you could get the same thing in NY for 2/3 the price. My quest to find good pizza in the Bay may slow down a bit after this one, though.
author: Rachel G.

description:
Our host was great, we ordered three of his recommendations and they were all very tasty:

- Prosuitto and Burrata Pizza
- Papperdelle and Crab pasta
- Rabbit with Risotto (one of the daily specials)
author: My N.

description: The meat sauce was very good. But the pasta may be cooked too much to my liking. Service is attentive and menu consist of pizzas, pasta - somewhat regular Italian feast. I would try their pizza next time.
author: Xela H.

description:
We had lunch here back in April of 2014 and were so glad we did.  We got there at the start of lunch and met the owner, a very nice man, who really went above and beyond with the service he provided.

We both ordered pasta, I got the Spaghetti Carbonara, which was wonderful (I don't remember which pasta my husband ordered, but he really liked it).  The food was fresh, warm, and very tasty.  The only reason for the four stars versus five was because the starter salad needed a little more pizazz.

The dessert however, was tiramisu, and it was incredible.  Some of the best I have ever had.  Between the good food and amazing service (which I still remember after 8 months), I would definitely recommend a stop in at this place.  Next time we get a chance to visit the area, I would like to try the pizza, it looked and smelled great.
author: Kevinandsara R.

description: Loved it!!! Shared the fungi pizza and beat salad. Simple, clean, light, delicious. Will definitely be back:)
author: Michelle D.

description: Wow, what a huge surprise!!! We decided to order pizza for the office lunch today and thought why not try Pachino's since it's close by and the Yelp reviews look decent. We ordered a Margherita and a Diavola. The pizza here is delicious. Crust was near perfection. Chewy and thin with a crunch toward the end at the outer crust. The cheese on the margarita was delicious. It certainly does rival Tony Neopolitana's and Delfina's and was fast, easy right on Kearny with no line at 1:30pm on a weekday. Two of their 12" pizzas easily served 4 adults and the manager was sweet enough to add a slice of Tiramisu to our order at no charge. This is going to be our office go-to pizza place.
author: Bunny C.

description: excellent pasta dishes, light and flavorful.  great pizza bread, especially when paired with the dishes where they bake a stew inside the dough.  I have had better pizza, though their dough is indeed excellent.  Fantastic tiramisu, sized to share.
author: Di Yin L.

description: Pizza rivals Tony's, Delfina, Zero Zero - perfect little place on Kearny Street - very casual Trattoria with high ceilings and attractive decor, intimate hole-in-the-wall with all the flavor.   I had the pizza with prosciutto and arugula, nice and light.  Dough had perfect consistency, not too heavy.  Crusts are amazing.  My left over pie tasted just as good the next day after heating up in toaster oven.  10 points for coziness.
author: blaine s.

description:
The funghi pizza was AMAZING.  Like, 'I'm full and may throw up but it's too wasteful to not eat this last piece' sort of amazing.  Oh. Mah. Gahd. [my Michigan roots come through when I eat good stuff].

The bolognese pasta was equally delicious.  I wishwishwish I wasn't so full when it arrived [I had eaten a bit before being brought here, which I regretted once we sat down!] so I could have enjoyed it more...we just happened to stumble upon this restaurant, but I was extremely impressed by the quality of the food they provided [at a reasonable price for that quality to boot!].

Our waiter was both personable and attentive, and brought beer a few feet over to my friends who were smoking away from our outdoor table...true customer service!!  

I will not forget the pizza here anytime soon, though.  It's kind of like a holiday fling...I just want to go back to SF, stare it in the eyes [cheese, I guess], and completely ravage it!
author: Katie M.

description: Well the joint was empty when we got there yet we were place at a table that was inside the kitchen. The table was slanted at 30 degrees and I was trapped next to the fridge. My wife and I were looking for a romantic evening but instead were sitting picnic table style. The pizza oven was 5' from me so I broke a sweat. Not to mention the wait staff was constantly walking in front of our table to get to the expo window. The food wasn't even worth it and had no flavor. Do yourself a favor and go to green st for Italian.
author: Drew F.

description: We had a lovely team dinner at Pachino. The pizza was wonderful and Francesco made us very welcome. At some point in the evening we left all the food and wine decisions to him and were never disappointed. If you like cozy and personal, this is a perfect spot.
author: David B T.

description:
Seriously great pizza! You know it the moment you walk in, it's going to be super authentic and made with care.   Great toppings and such a treat!  A

Beware of reviewers with 1 review!  Try this place, it's perfect.  A bit pricey, but when you get over it, you realize you do get what you pay for.
author: Jon S.

description: Came here for lunch with a coworker and it was a great experience. Server was very friendly food was delicious. We split a pizza and some ravioli. It's a small place so if possible come early to beat the lunch rush. Will definitely be back
author: Tina K.

description: Ok this is my fourth time here and it just gets better everytime   definitly worth the drive from Sacramento.  If it's available get the seafood lasagna. Homemade pasta salmon scallops and lobster. The white sauce tied it all together and was without a doubt one of the best Italian meals I've ever had.  Even with the sauce we had a delicious sangiovese which was delicious   finally to complete the amazing dinner. We tried the tiramisu. I am not a dessert person nor a sweets lover. But the gal wanted to have some and we both agreed it was amazing as well. Perfect dinner wine dessert host and place. Esp with the light rain.   Keep this place alive.  Best in the city
author: Erik B.

description: The dough and sauce was very close to what I have had in Naples.  Excellent. They also had some Chouff Belgian ales. For just the pizza alone I highly recommend this place.  Strong work!
author: Don S.

description:
Excellent restaurant! One of the best italian places I've eaten at in the US. All the pasta is made fresh daily and is amazing, the pizza is authentic Italian pizza and the diavola is to die for. The owner of the restaurant is the waiter, which I thought was pretty cool. Also a cool thing about the restaurant is that they actually make the pasta, pizza dough, bread for the nearby Italian restaurants and sell it to them. 
My trip to San Fran wouldn't be complete without my trip to Pachinos. Highly recommended! I actually made this yelp account just so I could leave a review, it was that good!
author: Will J.

description: Stopped here for dinner taking the advice of the local Yelp reviews.  Thanks!  Took the owners suggestion of the prosciutto and burrata pizza and man was it good.  Paired it with a nice glass of whine and it made for a great evening.
author: Jason O.

description: Friendly staff, delicious pizza. Limited hours though. I came in at around 2:30 once and was turned down.
author: Viv I.

description: I wanted to like this place. I really did. We were meeting a friends coming in from Antioch who wanted"a great Italian meal, " and based on the reviews,  we thought this might be the place. And it was right down the street from our hotel,  a bonus. An awful night. While everyone was very friendly, the service was incredibly slow. We had to get the attention of the waitress every time we needed something, and twice I had to get up and track her down. The wine list was small,  but looked interesting. But the first chianti we ordered was vinegar, the replacement bottle was just ok. And the food. Ugh!  I ordered the lambchop special, medium rare. I should have eaten my shoes,  they would have been more tender. The wife's risotto was so salty it was inedible. The carbonara was a gloppy mess. B ut the pizza was good. However, when 3 out of 4 diners are disappointed, it's not a good night.
author: Fred K.

description:
Table of 4 dinner description:

1. Superb
2.  Wonderful
3.  Welcoming
4.  Quaint

If you haven't gone, go see the owner Francesco....you will be happy.  Had a pizza, the salmon risotto....desserts...cannoli was on par with Boston's north end, flour less cake good....and dessert wine even better.....
author: Bob K.

description:
One of the best pizzas I have ever had in San Francisco....

Now, before you completely write me off for suggesting this, I am born and raised in the city and have eaten at many of the top spots (Tonys, Delfina, Pazzia, Tomassos, etc). I randomly ended up at Pachino, because the wait at La Fusion was 40 minutes and my hunger pangs could not wait that long. I was skeptical to say the least, since great pizza is hard to come by. 

We decided to order both a pasta and pizza to split (partially since I was scared the pizza would be mediocre and I've never met a gnocchi I didnt like) and a couple glasses of wine. The pasta came out first and it was solid, home made gnocchi with a nice Gorgonzola cream sauce like my Dad used to make at home. Good and we demolished. 

As we are finishing the owner, a very friendly and nice host, brings out our pie featuring wild boar sausage, mushroom and olive. I was shocked to say the least and the pie looked exactly like the pizza I had eaten in Napoli 10 years back. 

The crust was charred just a bit and had risen well above the center of the pizza, which was still nice and thin, with just the right amount of toppings. A true pizza should be like a pie, the crust should be one of the best parts and not a Atkins disposal remedy. The crust on the pie was perfect, light and fluffy, but with a crispy outer layer that had a great crunch to it. The mozzarella seemed like a high quality product and the sauce was definitely not overly seasoned and tasted really fresh. 

Sure, maybe some of it was the shock factor of walking into a restaurant that I didn't know existed and receiving an amazing meal, but I still think this Pizza is top notch. Obviously I will have to go back and I can't speak to consistency since I have only been once, but I would highly recommend based on my one experience.
author: Nick B.

description: This place was the best. The owner and waiter and chef were the nicest people. They made us feel very comfortable. And the food was so good. The gnocchi was our favorite. I would Definatly go back and recommend. Thank you.
author: Glen N Denie V.

description: It's a cute little Italian place. I had the spaghetti carbonara. It was good, but not amazing. The pizza my sister had was really good. The dishes weren't washed very well and the service was slow, but the owner was very nice. We had to get their attention after waiting to order and to get our tab. I would go back and try a different dish.
author: Adrianna A.

description: It gets better and better each time. Service is amazing and Monica is an incredible server. Most of the menu is comprised of her own personal recipes from Italy. The atmosphere makes you feel like you're in the Italian countryside, in the heart of San Francisco.
author: Emily S.

description: A great place for an authentic Italian dinner!!  Great service and food!! Loved the ambiance, very cozy and comfortable! I will return on my next trip to SFO!
author: Lia P.

description: The service is outstanding. Great wine selection. The bread us yummy. Stay away from bolognese sauce, but the gnocchi was excellent. The roasted beet salad was out of this world. Tiramisu is a must!
author: karen s.

description: Such a great little place with fantastic food and attentive service. Everyone loved their dishes and lots of sharing going on, the one common comment was the need to add just a little salt to each dish in the cooking but that is small/ I can't wait to come back here next time I am in town!!
author: Christian K.

description: This place is wonderful. Stop contemplating and go already! Small, intimate setting. A great date night spot. We had a mussel appetizer, the Siciliana pizza, and profiteroles for dessert. All were absolutely delicious. Our server, Francesco, was attentive and charming. I can't imagine how anybody wouldn't love this great restaurant.
author: Marlyn D.

description: The most amazing service!!!! The owner was so sweet to get my hub, daughter and I in at 7:30 with no reservation..... Tiny place so bigger crowds may want to reserve a spot. My 10 yr old had the raviolis, hub had the carbonara and I had the pappardelle with Bolognese..... All 3 delish!!!!!!!!
author: Stacy I.

description: This place rates four stars for food, and zero for service. We sat down for dinner and spent 15 minutes trying to get anyone to pay attention to us so we could place our order. The main guy just ignored me when I told him we were ready to order, and I think the only reason why the woman took our order was because we were loudly discussing leaving. Also, we were seated right next to the kitchen, so we were treated to the sights and sounds of the main guy breaking dishware as he threw it into the tubs in a fit of pique. Sorry it was such an inconvenience that so many people came into your restaurant tonight; trust me, it won't happen again. It's a shame really, because the pizzas and gnocchi were really good.
author: Rob W.

description: Very bad, big no no. You can fly to Italy and back and still don't get your food.
author: Oshri K.

description: Fantastic food. Service a little slow but well worth it. Very cute little restaurant with very friendly hosts/staff.  Had special gnocchi and vegetarian ravioli.
author: Sandy N.

description:
Soooooooo yummy!!!!! The BF and I overstuffed ourselves but whatever! My FAV new place in SF for Italian. The only prob was that the bf's pasta came out at the end of our meal...so he was sitting there watching me devour my pasta. Poor baby :(

What we liked:
- divola (?) pizza 
- burrata
- carbonara
author: Kay P.

description: Got takeout from this place, as it was close to the Omni Hotel. Spaghetti Della Nona had perfectly seasoned meatballs made from beef, pork and veal (I believe). Delicious.
author: Ken S.

description: I like the laid back feel of this place, and its proximity to so many things (the rent must be very expensive for such a nice location).  In terms of food, it was solid, not outstanding.  I had a burrata app and the boar sausage pizza, and liked them both.  I would return if I found myself hungry and in the neighborhood.
author: Josh Q.

description: Small space but fantastic food. Stopped by for lunch and had what could have been the best pizza of my life!!!  Great place!
author: Brian F.

description:
Very small place, good energy, intimate. Everything about this place is very family style, both in decor and food: not pretentious whatsoever, just the basics.

Food was good. I had the pappardelle alla bolognese, my fiancee had the spaghetti della nonna. Both were very good.

I'd say the service lacked though. Despite the size of the place, the waiter was overwhelmed. We had been sitting for 10 minutes, and were still waiting for the waiter to come see us, when we saw a group of four sitting down two tables away and the waiter is right there taking drink orders. What made it even more aggravating is that after leaving that group, he comes over (finally) only to tell me that he's gonna be here in a minute.

I'm no waiter but seriously??
author: Bernard L.

description: We have done take out a few times here and we were impressed each time.  The pastas are delicious: the carbonara is excellent, as is the bolognese and spaghetti della nonna.  Service is wonderful and friendly.  It's a very small, charming restaurant, and we hope to eat in here one day soon.
author: Michelle C.

description: The website was down so I called asked the person who answered what he would recommend. Decided on a pizza for pickup. Got a diablo pizza which was a margherita pizza with spicy sausage and arugula. Loved the crust and they were fast with excellent service! Would love to try a sit-down when I have more time!
author: Yi-Fang T.

description: No complaints about this little gem! Very warm & comfy environment. Delicious menu, top to bottom. All fresh ingredients! Highly recommended for a cute little date or for any time you're craving a good bite of Italian! Will definitely be back.
author: Nick C.

description: This is a magical place.  My husband and my 5 year old daughter came here for dinner a few weekends ago.  We were seated at the cutest little table closest to the little kitchen and stone pizza oven.  We felt like family the moment we arrived to the moment we left.  I love the intimate setting and the attentive, honest, and wonderful staff.  I believe his name is Dario.  I have to say, what a special guy!  We left our very expensive camera there and called the next day trying to find it.  They kindly kept it safe for us and returned to us in perfect condition.  In today's times, it is rare when people have integrity and honesty.  This man and this restaurant has just that.  I can't thank them enough for their genuine kindness.  We will forever consider this restaurant when we are visiting the city.  Thank you Pachino!
author: Katelyn G.

description: great place for Pizza. I didnt try anything else. I was craving pizza. I was told that the ingredients are made fresh. I dont know if I was hungry but wow great pizza!
author: Ray R.

description:
I like the atmosphere. It's a small and quiet place. However service is terrible and food took forever to come! We were seated outside as there was no more room inside, which is fine. Until it started raining over our table and I asked to be moved inside. The waitress answered in an aggressive tone "What can I do? Can't you see it's full?........ It might take 30 or 40 minutes.". How about a "Sure, we'll let you in as soon as a table clears up"?. After a while she did let us in.
The food quality was uneven. The Prosciutto e Burrata is excellent. The Ricotta Gnocchi was kind of bland and the pizza wasn't great.
What is surprising is how long it took them to make our dishes and how fast for them to clear them out. We ordered our food around 7:45pm and only got our entres around 8:45pm. Then as we were finishing our dishes one by one, the waitresses took their plates. She took mine out while I was still holding my fork and chewing my last piece of gnocchi! Why rush us out when they clearly take their time when it comes to serving us?
author: Andy N.

description: Awesome small spot atmosphere. The host (Francesco) was extremely nice and made it feel like an authentic ristorante. My wife and I had pizza, meatballs and chicken arugula salad - all of it was fresh and delicious. Wrapped up the visit with cappuccino and expresso - definitely recommend.
author: Bryan J.

description: Had dinner twice at this charming San Francisco jewel tugged away on Kearny St. The owner Pino is wonderful, warm and attentive without being intrusive. The food is as good as we had in Italy and I highly recommend if you are in San Francisco to dine here. We had their pasta dishes which are all homemade and the pork Sugo was prepared to perfection and melted in your mouth. The spaghetti Della Nona again with homemade pasta and tasty meatballs could very well have come out of Grand's kitchen. We will certainly return on our next visit to Sam Francisco.
author: Russell B.

description: Wonderful food at a reasonable price. This restaurant is near Union Square hotels. We entered from Kearny Street but discovered the restaurant has an entrance from Belden Lane. The restaurant owner is the host/waiter and will make recommendations if you are unsure of what to order. We ordered the insalada tricolore,pappardelle ala bolougnese, gnocchi, and verdure pizza. All dishes were excellent and generous in portion. The salad was small and should be ordered as a side dish, not a main dish. We tried a nearby Italian restaurant the next evening but preferred this restaurant in quality and price. We'd go back again the next time we're in town.
author: Liz T.

description: I stopped in here for lunch today and am so happy that I did! Great food and great service from Francesco!!! I had the caprese salad and spaghetti carbonara!! Delicious!! I will be back!!!
author: Joann C.

description: Small place so come early or be patient.  We went at 1pm for lunch and were seated right away.  Service was quick and efficient.  Food was perfectly prepared and tasty.  I felt the sausage pizza could have had more flavor.
author: Vivek V.

description: My husband and I walked to this little Italian restaurant from our hotel on Union Square. What a delightful find. We shared a special grilled peach salad with fresh mozzarella, arugula, and addiction. Then I had the most unusual Filipino linguine ever. Fresh linguine and a mix of seafood was served inside a fresh baked topper of baked bread (kind of like pot pie crust, but made with fresh pizza-like dough). It sounds odd, but once you opened up the top, you could sop up the broth with the delicious bread. My husband's classic pepperoni pizza was also quite good-probably a good idea to share one with two people as it was quite ample.
author: Jonelle D.

description:
We were looking for an authentic Italian place by Union Square since we kept falling for tourist trap places. Pachino is a walkable distance from the Square and although the space is small, the food was amazing. The prices were more than fair considering the quality we received. 

We also ended up chatting with the owner. His father had a restaurant in the North End in Boston (Boston's Little Italy, essentially). He also gave us inside tips on how to spend our time in the city, which we followed up with and enjoyed!

Definitely a place to check out if you're a resident or visitor to the city!
author: Ila C.

description:
This restaurant is a little slice of Italy in the middle of downtown San Francisco.  The food, the ambiance, the owner who did the majority of serving - all made me feel like I was back in Rome.  

First tip, it's a tiny little place so get there early or make reservations!
