Luckily we got there just before 6 pm and got a table, but as the evening wore on the owner turned away many would-be patrons since they just didn't have space.  And the fresh baked bread you get to munch on while you wait for your food was delicious, very light and airy.  

Second tip, pay attention to the specials on the board, because there are tons of them and I would have tried every single one if I could have.  The special I ended up ordering was the cioppino linguine, which is basically a mix of seafood served with pasta, but it ended up being so much more.  It consisted of sea bass, salmon, lobster, shrimp, mussels and clams served in a delicious light tomato broth on top of a generous portion of fresh made linguine.  But what set it apart was that the entire bowl was completely wrapped in pizza dough and then the whole thing was baked, so the seafood steamed inside a cocoon of dough and became nice and crispy.  You have to cut through the top of the dough to get to the seafood but then you can dip the crust in the broth as you enjoy your meal and it was just perfect, SO good!!  

Third tip, you must try the pizza.  My husband ordered the reliable pizza margarita, but it was fantastic.  The crust was super thin with just the right mix of crispiness in the middle and chewiness on the outer crust.  The sauce was fresh and flavorful with the perfect portion of fresh mozzarella.  Totally reminiscent of pizza we'd had in Italy.

Fourth tip, if you can somehow find the room after enjoying a delicious meal, try the tiramisu.  It was light and not too sweet and the best I've ever had, period.  

The only reason why I gave 4 stars was because the service was a bit slow.  The owner took in-house orders, served, took phone orders, and seated customers - with only one other person busing tables and running food.  He needs to have at least other person helping out on the floor or at least answering the phone and it would run much smoother.  But he was perfectly charming and very nice so if his only fault was trying to do too much himself then he's forgiven as far as I'm concerned!  The next time we're in San Francisco we'll definitely be back.  You MUST try Pachino's!
author: Melissa H.

description: Overall not a very great experience... Im just going to be honest, this isn't out of anger or anything like most of the bad reviews on Yelp are. We made a reservation an hour before we came and when we did end up coming we got in right away no problem... Me and my parents ordered pizza margarita and spaghetti and meatballs. Pretty simple.. Turns out they didn't have any bread left so I couldn't try there olive oil that they have broadly placed on the table. The walk-in table that came in after us had gotten their food a few minutes before us. The pizza was alright but it didn't have that great of flavor. Also the meatballs didn't have any flavor at all, weird considering that those are probably the most popular two things that I would assume would be made well at an Italian restuarant. The staff were all very friendly and nice till we were looking for dessert. Waited for about 10-15 minutes for them to notice us looking at them. The restuarant is not very large and they had to walk by us many times to get to the other tables. For dessert I ordered one cannoli. I think they realized how they had treated us and gave us three cannoli's. I started writing this before i had ordered and received dessert so i have changed my review from a two to a three because they had realized their mistake. Great service.
author: Shane L.

description: My husband & I went here last night & after a long day of tourist activities, this was such a lovely, relaxing and tasty end to an already wonderful day!  It's a small place with very warm attributes that really make it feel personable and friendly. We ordered one of their pizzas but only because it's what we were in the 'mood' for. The owner/manager/chef (?) offered two other dishes as suggestions which sounded lovely, just not what we were thinking at the moment. We did however ask his opinion on the dessert options, and went with his suggestion of the tiramisu. An EXCELLENT suggestion, btw!  Very flavorful and light and was simply perfect to our tastes. I highly recommend this place!
author: Alissa G.

description: I have gone twice now and loved both meals.  Their bolognese is delicious.  The staff is attentive and the space is professional but also semi romantic.
author: D. K.

description: Visited Pachino's after reading other Yelp reviews and it was fabulous!   An interesting and delicious broiled Caesar salad was a great start, followed by an excellent buffalo cannelloni special.  I will have added it to my contact list for our next trip to San Francisco as we will definitely be going back.
author: Randy R.

description: Went here on Friday night for a bachelorette party with 10 girls, the bride to be LOVES Italian food so we did our research and chose this place. It was amazing!!! Our server (and manager?) was so helpful and accommodating for our group. We did all family style pizzas and pastas and we were soooo full! The parmesan gnocci was to die for, and so was the pizza with arugala. I wish there was a Pachino in souther California so I could eat it more often. They even gave us a little champagne on the house to celebrate and we all left with full bellys and very happy!!
author: Maribel A.

description: The pizza here is amazing and that's about it.  Ordered calamari and it was super chard.  Order shrimp pasta and shrimped were cooked the same way, charred with very strong burnt taste.  Ordered vegetarian pizza and it was delicious! One of the best pizzas I have tasted.  Ordered cannollis and those were garbage.  Service here sucked but pizza made up for everything else. If you want to go somewhere for good pizza and that's about it, then this is the place.
author: Susan And Luis R.

description: Margherita and diavola pizzas  were fantastic...the owner, Pino, was so accommodating...he even poured me an extra glass of wine to go with the  dessert we ordered! can't wait to come back next time we come to sf!
author: cindy i.

description: This is the first time that Yelp has let me down.  We walked 1/2 mile, past quite a few other restaurants, to find this one.  The pizza I ordered ($21) was simply mediocre, with nothing extraordinary about it, neither in texture nor taste.  There were two items on the dessert menu that interested me, and both were not available for some reason (although it was early in the evening).  There was really nothing about the restaurant that would motivate me to return.
author: David S.

description:
well, i am not sure how i should have reacted...

on day 1, i stopped by on the way home after work for tiramisu because of what i had read online.  it was very good indeed.

on day 2, taken in with the decor and intimate atmosphere, i decided to grab dinner to take home.  i ordered a salad, garlic bread, pasta, and tiramisu with no chocolate sauce.  we made sure about the chocolate sauce, since there is a practical concern for allergies.  

when i got home, the pasta entree had not been packed, and the tiramisu was in a pool of chocolate sauce.  

i did not bother calling because it was too late to go back, so i used the energy to barely squeeze out my own pasta entree with what little i had at home.  

well, in the end, rather than complain to the mgr or owner, it is much simpler to just call it a day and never go back...
author: eshwar k.

description: Went here for a birthday lunch! The food was fantastic. I will definitely be back to try some of the other menu items. I had the crispy Wild Salmon with risotto and was very pleased.
author: Nick R.

description: We didn't know about this place before going, we just happened to be walking around the city and found it. We were very happy with our choice. It's a charming little spot with great food and the service was wonderful. We were seated right away and brought drinks immediately followed by our appetizer and our meal.  The owner visited our table a few times to chat with us and make recommendations. We were really happy with the whole experience.  We had gone to Tomasso's the night before because of the great reviews and we were totally disappointed in their flavorless food and impersonal service. Skip Tomasso's and eat at Pachino's instead, you won't be disappointed!
author: Paula S.

description: Absolutely blown away by this place. Bruschetta is the best I have ever had. Pizza was unreal, freshest mozzarella and sauce that was so uniquely fresh and good. The owner made it a special visit by taking the time to talk with us and share the family history of the recipes. I am in SF for only two nights and have cancelled dinner plans tomorrow night so I can return to Pachinos. There are thousands of Italian restaurants in SF, do not miss out on this one!!! Truly special experience.
author: Michael B.

description: I had the margherita pizza. Are you kidding me?!??!? It was amazing and there was hardly anything on it. It must be amazing quality ingredients. Superb pizza!
author: Ro P.

description: Trapped at work?  Need a meal?  This is the perfect place for take out or delivery.  The pizza's got character and the pasta tastes great.
author: Armen Z.

description:
Went there last night with my SO. Great place! Good food! Very good service. The waiter seemed like the owner. Very legit Italian accent. He even taught us how to say gnocchi correctly.

Our meal started with some bread rolls. Might I add that they were free? Definitely high quality bread rolls. Toasty on the top, but soft center. Delicious. Dip that in some olive oil, and you got a good stomach warm up.

We didn't order any of the wines, but there was a decent selection.

I got the Pappardelle with 3 meat sauce and my girlfriend got the gnocchi with spinach and white cream sauce. It was very delicious and filling. I'd say these two choices were good to share with each other.

For dessert we shared a profiteroles with gelato and chocolate sauce. It was a great way to end the meal.

The restaurant is a bit small, but very cozy. We're not complaining about the size, it was actually nice that it was small. Despite the size, we didn't have to wait to get seated on a Friday night. The staff was very attentive and friendly.

The price was just right. Not more or less than we expected. For the ambiance, good service, and excellent food, I'd definitely come back for a second evening here.

Make sure to catch the bay bridge lights after. It's not a far walk away.
author: Kiley L.

description: Phenomenal pizza.  Found Pachino on my last night of a long week in SF. Great last meal to help sleep on the long plane ride back east.  It is small and a bit on the pricey side, but I remember every bite of the meal, and the service was outstanding.  In a city of outstanding restaurants, Pachino truly stands out.
author: Patrick M.

description:
Its a small little place with a true Trattoria feel. The gnocchi was delicious and the service was very very friendly

I would definitely go back to this place.
author: B K.

description: Great food. When my mother-in-law asked questions regarding her dietary needs they immediately (and without being asked) offered to make her a special meal off menu for her.
author: Ron W.

description: LOVE this place. The only non-touristy place near work where i can get delicious and authentic pizza and pasta. Pappardelle with Pancetta, Arugula salad with Prosciutto, and White Pizza with Truffle Oil on thin crust are some of the selections. We have gone here for a few bdays as well and they are always very accommodating. Great food will go here often
author: Lilia D.

description:
Second visit with Michael C (see his review below).  Front of house manager very stressed as he explained the bus boy did not show up for work today.  

Pizza was phenomenal again today. Authentic Italian pizza from a wood-fired oven just like the pizza I enjoyed in Umbria and Toscana.  The chef was very solicitous and sent out one and a half free pizzas to "try" in addition to our order.  The first was a fresh mozzerella with proscuitto that was loaded with ingredients over the crispy crust.  The second "try" pizza blew my palate away...fresh squash blossoms, fresh zucchini, onions and a little truffle oil.  Mamma Mia!  

The individual size pizzas are sizeable.  Five of the six slices is pushing the limits of my stomach and I usually take one or two home or donate to my worthy companions.

This pizzeria deserves to survive.  The staff really does want to do well and I think they will with a bit more experience.
author: Pinot B.

description:
I love Pachino and I regret that the other reviewers did not have the same brilliant experience that I had while visiting San Francisco this last week. As a Chef, I am very selective about Italian so it was not so typical for me to choose a place on a whim just around the corner from my hotel. I was sold in a heartbeat to dine there when their Prosciutto-Arugula-Burrata pizza was listed first on their blackboard, I didn't even need to look at the menu. The pizza was as good or better than I've had in Italy, the recommended Pinot Noir wine was perfect with it, and they even offered me the chocolate-amaretto mousse they'd made for New Year's. It was all exquisite, to say the least. 

Even though on this Tuesday night the place was not terribly busy, I was still treated like a VIP (as were the other customers around me) and I have absolutely nothing but kind compliments to offer about the service. I met a few of the employees and the owner, all of whom were wonderful. I felt like I'd landed in a small, warm, friendly neighborhood haunt, which can be very unusual for the Financial District of a big city. 

I returned to dine there again for late dinner and also for lunch during my stay in the city, because I felt so at home.

I would gently encourage others to take the early reviews here with a grain of salt. Pachino is relatively new and perhaps has yet to place itself on all the big maps, but it certainly deserves another chance if diners ate there some months ago. The owner and new manager care deeply about the quality of their food and service, and given the chance, surely they will demonstrate that over and again.

By the way, the poached pear salad is outstanding, as is the grilled flank steak with Chianti wine sauce. And don't miss the amazing tiramisu (also something I am extremely snobby about) if it's available. Buon appetito!
author: Diane S.

description: Great food and excellent service! I had a hard time choosing something from their menu since itall looked so good, so the waiter suggested a pizza and it did not disappoint. My wife also choose a pizza and out was delicious. The atmosphere was quiet and romantic, and we felt like the wait staff had a personal interest in ensuring our dining experience was excellent. I would highly recommend this place.
author: David S.

description: Delicious pasta and chicken!! And the bread was yummy too. The restaurant is a very cool atmosphere and the service was excellent.  My husband and I went for dinner at about nine thirty on a Saturday night and got seated right away and got our food very quickly. Maybe we had a better experience than these other reviewers because it's busier at lunch? I can't vouch for that but I can say that the food and service at dinner were excellent. Definitely recommend
author: Emily D.

description:
I just had dinner here tonight for the 2nd time. My wife and I were entertaining her aunt and uncle. We ordered 2 beet salads and 2 pizzas - Tuscan and Diavola. 

Atmosphere - Very nice, it's an off-the street small dining room with an intimate feeling. Only one server, and she did it just right, not too much hovering, but made sure we were taken care of and enjoying our meal. Bread and olive oil to enjoy while our food was being prepared.

Food - I previously had the margherita pizza, which was excellent. Tonight the Tuscan and Diavola were good, great ingredients, very fresh, and interesting combinations. I also don't really care for beets, but our guests shared some of their salad with us and it was really quite good. The best beets I've tasted.

Good for - This place is a solid 4 stars if you're looking for a nice out of the way dinner while entertaining out-of-town visitors looking for that quaint "city" dining experience, or a quick to-go dinner while working late in the Financial District.
author: Brandon H.

description:
Ok, we had a fantastic experience here last night and wanted to share. 
Service:  5 ++
Ambiance:  4
Food:  4

We give 5 overall because of the service and warm welcome.

 First, I made a reservation for 8:30 but our schedule landed us there at 7, and they gladly made room for us.  Then we ordered two glasses of wine, she let me taste the Chilean red to make sure I liked it, then poured a Very generous glass.  The entrees were delicious, Andy the caprese appetizer was good but lacked sufficient basil..   Then the fun started.  My girlfriend accidentally spilled my glass of wine all over our table and the adjacent one.  The restaurants response was stellar.. They quickly cleaned up, replaced with a new table linens, and promptly poured me a brand new glass of wine.  They did all this with a smile, as if it was completely routine.  This made her feel so much better as she was very embarrassed.   The chocolate creme caramel finished a wonderful evening at Pachino Trattoria..  Bravo!
author: Todd D.

description:
Absolutely first class restaurant - wont kill budget either. We went back three times during our SF stay. Everything on the menu is excellent - the pizzas are to die for. 
It's a bit cramped and has a limited wine list but has great atmosphere. Dario, the owner (I think) is great to chat to - he clearly loves good food.
Highly recommended!!!
author: David M.

description:
Wow, walked in and it was just my wife and I.  Although they didn't have a table - very small restaurant they asked if we wanted to sit at a bar right in front of the cooking section.  We did and glad of it.  Had a pizza and it was fantastic!  Very nice folks and gave us great service!

Go there!
author: Dan V.

description:
We met a friend in the city the other night and decided to try this place.
I have to say, I know some of the other reviews say the service was bad, but we had a fantastic experience.  The owner was kind, accommodating and not at all pushy.
We had wine, a well priced, delicious chianti (and my husband had a beer to start - Peroni on tap!  He was happy). 
We shared the prosciutto to start.  It was a wonderful balance of flavors, served with an arugula garnish and buffalo mozzarella.  I don't think we've had such a delicious prosciutto appetizer since we were in Milan this past summer.  My mouth is watering just writing about it.
For dinner, I had the mushroom and asparagus risotto (perfectly cooked, delicious flavors, good serving size), my husband had the spaghetti and meat balls (authentic, home made and "awesome"), and our friend had a steak dish, which he absolutely loved.
For dessert, we shared the prosecco poached apples with homemade vanilla bean gelato, and a chocolate torte.  Amazing.
We had a great experience, and would definitely recommend this place!
author: Karey S.

description: We love this place and make sure we get there once a month for date night. We say, "Let's go see Francesco.", which is how we feel about it. Awesome food, great service, cozy place in the middle of mad hatter Financial district. I wish we had a place this good in Pacifica. Order anything on the Specials board. Last time we had paparradelle with Buffalo meatballs. The Grilled Sardines is one of my favorite things because I ate so many in Portugal. t's one of our fav go to places. Very reasonable and just love the atmosphere. Francesco makes it special for everyone who shows up. If you've been to Italy you will know the warm relaxed hospitality and Pachino delivers that warmth after a long work day. GO! You are always welcome there!
author: Kit M.

description: lovely out of the way Italian place.  I had a daily special, homemade fettucini with house made sausage and marinara;  my wife had homemade pasta with crab and a light flavorful sauce...  We both LOVED our dinners.  After asking us a few questions about the type of wine we regularly enjoy, our waiter suggested a wine for us; it was wonderful.  We split a "chocolate trio" that was delicious, not too sweet and satisfying.   The staff (owners?) were very helpful, easy and friendly.  Although populated, it was not packed and loud.  We will definitely be back for more!  Great "off the beaten path" Italian restaurant.
author: Jim L.

description: Great pesto pizza.  Owner is engaging.  Food is created, not slapped together.  Blend of flavors, real effort and care given.  Atmosphere is intimate.  The place (e.g., restrooms) could use some freshening up. Overall would  recommend
author: B R.

description: needed dinner the other night and looked thru yelp and found this place. it turned out to be a REALLY good find! (you can actually get to it via kearny st or belden place) However, just be forewarned: it's a tiny little place that seems to only have one waiter- the owner.  Besides that, the food is exquisite!!!  Had the cannelloni special with buffalo mozzarella and cherry tomato sauce. My buddy had sea shell pasta stuffed with sausage. Both dishes were absolutely insanely TASTY.  I'm definitely putting this place on my 'date nite' list of places to go with the wifey!!!
author: Steven D.

description: In the top five meals ever (including those in Italy)!  The pasta was fresh and light, the Caesar dressing exquisite, and the three dessert sampler extraordinary!  The gentleman waiting table was the creator of this terrific experience!  Loved it and will be back!
author: Raynee D.

description: What a gem of a restaurant.  Amazing pizza, excellent service, and a cozy dining space.  Would recommend this place to anyone.
author: Allison G.

description: What a great little surprise for my husband and I. We were looking for somewhere casual but with great food and a nice ambiance. We stumbled upon this place and could not have been more pleased. The food was excellent (try the pizza!), the atmosphere cozy, and the prices were very reasonable. Service was excellent and the owner was so friendly and accommodating. We would recommend this to anyone, particularly couples, looking for a great meal in a great spot. Enjoy!
author: Julie B.

description: We went here last night with a party of 12 including 4 children and it was great. Francesca set us up with a nice table arrangement and was gracious enough to reorganize it to better fit our needs. Service was a tiny bit slow, but our food was wonderful and again Francesca came through with special service for one of our picky eaters. The food was tasty, people were pleasant, and the atmosphere was quiet enough that our group could talk without shouting. We would definitely go back.
author: F C.

description:
We too stumbled across this restaurant on a rainy Tuesday night.  Small with great atmosphere and we were welcomed and served by the owner who was delightful.

We shared the beet salad and the chopped salad - both were delicious but the beet salad was the more refreshing of the two.  Carbonara linguine, chicken pesto pizza and mushroom gnocchi.  The pizza had the BEST crust, the linguine was surprisingly light (and my fussy son ate all of it) and the gnocchi was tender and flavorful.  Wish we had room for desert!
author: Carole L.

description: Excellent service by the host. Good recommendations for food. Dish of day of grilled octopus was cooked to near perfection. Tender and succulent.
author: Jo Y.

description: Wow! What a find. I've been finding myself traveling to SF often, lately, for work.  My office and hotel are located in the Financial District and after a long day of work recovering from jetlag, the last thing I want to do is run over to the Mission or Marina for delicious food.  I, therefore, find myself running around Union Square trying to find a yummy, non-chain that won't cost an arm and a leg. And then, I found Pachino.  Ambiance = Great. We waited for a friend to arrive so got to the restaurant quite late (9PM) on a Monday so there wasn't much of a crowd but the few tables that were there seemed to have a great rapport with the waiter - which we soon found was due to his willingness to bring you the best meal.  Between four of us we split a better of red house wine, 2 pasta bolognaise and two pizzas.  Food = Delicious. I found myself stuffing myself past fullness just to eat another bite of the delicious meatsauce - homemade and packed with meaty goodness.  Service = Great. Our server helped us select the dishes we would all be pleased with and popped in and out to chat with us about our meal. Will definitely be returning here on my next visit.
author: Katy G.

description: So romantic! We were served by the owner, a passionate guy with an Italian accent, and couldn't have been happier! The food is great but what really sold the place was the atmosphere and superb customer service :)
author: Jimmy W.

description: Best italian food I have eaten in the financial district. I've yet to actually step foot in this place, but my office orders dinner from this Pachino frequently. Nearly everything I have ordered from here has been scrumptious. The pasta, pizza, and salads are all melt in your mouth good. I took one-star away because they took my favorite dish off the menu, the salmon over risotto, which I've never stopped dreaming about. I suppose they wanted to replace it with a healthier salmon option, because now it's just salmon over "corn salsa" with some kind of mediocre sauce. The new variation of salmon is "meh" at best, but on the bright side this change has forced me to become more creative about ordering different things. I don't know if I would eat from here as often without my office footing the bill since it's a bit expensive, but the quality is indicative of the price in this case so don't be deterred.
author: S H.

description: Went here for a late lunch (about 2pm) with a work collegue and were seated right away as there were only a couple of other parties there. At peak times I'd imagine many get turned away as the place is tiny.  But thankfully it wasn't an issue for us, and we both completely enjoyed the meal, the service, and the feel of the place.  The atmostphere is quant, small, intimate, and authentic.  We felt as though we found a small gem.  As others have said, the menu and wine list is not large, but everything we had was delicious.  We both will be coming back.
author: Kim H.

description: Wow!  It totally reminded me of Italy. Just being inside the restaurant made it felt like I was in another country. The food was excellent.
author: Mary L.

description: So, the food was actually pretty good - but the service was terrible. The staff seemed like they couldn't care less if we were there or not. Paid cash and left. If the service improved, I'd give this little place 3 or 4 stars. Sad.
author: Greg R.

description: What a wonderful restaurant. While staying in SanFran with my family members, we decided to try pachino based on the good reviews it's received thus far. Words I'd use to  describe Pachino are: warm, clean, and cozy. The owner, a native of Italy, adds a true personal touch and sees to everyone's satisfaction. This place is the polar opposite of a chain restaurant, its a high quality establishment with true italian cuisine. My dad, sister, and I enjoyed brick oven pizza,( which was delicious), while mom enjoyed gnocchi which she raved about. I'd like to return with my husband and hopefully have the lovely dining experience I enjoyed so much with my family at Pachino.
author: Talia R.

description:
This place make traditional Italian pizza in a brick oven. So don't expect American style pizza. That being said, this is the best pizza I've ever tasted in the U.S. and Brazil (I have not been to Italy).
The crust is unbelievably amazing! It's a combination of just the right amount of crunchy and chewy. The ingredients are super fresh and very high quality. I love that they have Peroni on tap.
Last time I went, I had tiramisu and espresso for dessert and it was also excellent.
author: Andre C.

description:
I live in the Financial area and walked to Belden Lane for dinner..an entrance on Belden and also on Kearny. Ate at Pachino last evening...Pizza was the best!
Fresh homemade sauce, high quality cheese and real mushrooms. Crust was thin and perfect.
 Menu also has homemade pasta , salads and chicken. And draft beer. This will be my go to at least 3 nights a week.
Priced just right.
Outdoor seating for sunny days or mild evenings...love it!!
author: z z.

description: Poor poor service at the start, but improved along the way. They served bread and olive oil to start off. Not the best bread I have had, but pretty decent. Ordered a vegetarian pizza which was good. Something in it was a slightly too salty for our tastes. Other than that, a solid pizza.
author: Soujanya K.

description: Excellent food, service, and atmosphere (quaint).  Had the spaghetti and meatballs- all home made.  We're from out of town and I noted that there were a lot of locals there- always a good sign.  My daughter (Jr. in college) chose it as a value for her hard-earned dollars, as a treat for my birthday.  It was excellent for the cost. The pizza looked wonderful.  Sorry we didn't have room for dessert- so many wonderful choices.  Highly recommend!
author: Janet B.

description: Fantastic small place. Because it's so small, it feels different than most other places. The owner pays attention to every table personally and makes sure everything is as good add it can be. He always introduces the specials for the day but is at the same time very upfront and honest about what from the menu he cannot make for the day because he is missing an ingredient that day. The food is fantastic and many recipes are from his family from Italy. Will keep coming back.
author: Ratko J.

description: Great food. Place is small but atmosphere was nice. Tiramisu is to die for.
author: Eloisa R.

description: Would give food 5 stars... We had no problem clearing the plates, BUT we ordered wine and it never came AND we asked for the heater to be turned on and it took 20 minutes for it to happen. Never the less, the servers were kind and the food was amazing.
author: Inn G.

description: Great place. Ate here while visiting San Francisco and did not regret it. Cozy and welcoming owner. Delicious food. We are early (6pm) so I don't know how busy it gets, there were 3 or 4 tables of people while we were there. They have covered seating on the sidewalk but it was too rainy and cold for us.
author: Weston S.

description: We visited here for lunch and had the grilled caesar salad and a the margherita extra pizza. Both were very good. The pizza was classic thin crust roma style, with excellent mozzarella. The crust was very well done and tasty. Service had some old world charm but wasn't anything to write home about.
author: Francis H.

description: It's really hard to not like this place.  I can't say the food was the best I've ever eaten, but there's a lot of charm here that I haven't experienced anywhere else.  Maybe it's because our server seems to know (and hug) everyone that walks in.  Maybe because, when I asked him for recommendations, he says things like "I make the pizza dough in house with a two-day rise," "I make the tiramisu with a genoise," "I make most of our breads for wholesale, but I put some aside for us," and my favorite, "I made the peach panna cotta this morning, but I think I sold it all."  It's kind of like having your grandma reincarnated as a humble Italian man.  Pizza diavolo was delish--if you make your own pizza, you know that an overnight rise at a minimum is a must--and surprisingly filling; the ricotta tortellini with short rib ragu tasted like something my Grandma would make, in a good way.  Mozzarella is also made in-house, and the caprese salad was better for it.   We finished the meal with his tiramisu; I personally prefer my tiramisu to have the texture of an Italian tres leches cake, so if you like yours on the drier side, this is your place.   Also, the tiramisu was actually a bit frozen in the center...but again, I can't help but like the place regardless. All of this was washed down with a glass of white wine, two words beginning with a B at the end of the BTG menu, that was fabulous--round and peachy like a Sancerre but with a crisp Pinot Grigio/Sauv Blanc finish.
author: Ashley B.

description: Great food, service, decor, pizza, homemade pasta, and wines.  We went on a Saturday night at 9:00 pm with our two children and had a great experience.  We will be back.
author: Tom O.

description: OK, so I wrote my original review of Pachino while it was still working out some kinks.  The great food kept me going back, and I am very glad I did.  They have worked out the service issues that had concerned me before and now it is just the restaurant with the best pizza in the city.  The staff is incredibly friendly.  The restaurant itself is small (cozy) but well decorated.  It's like a little piece of Italy in the Financial District.  The pizza is ahhhhhmazing.  I highly recommend the prosciutto and burrata and the diavolo.  I have yet to try the pasta and other entrees only because I can not be steered away from the pizza.  The rolls they serve are incredibly delicious as well.  I can't recommend this place enough.  I am glad to see it getting so popular and would encourage anyone to try it.
author: Michael C.

description: A warm, friendly host and excellent food make this intimate neighborhood restaurant special. The house-made gnocchi was nothing short of stellar -- better than any we had in Rome. While we didn't get a chance to try the pizza, it smelled great and the diners eating it seemed pleased.
author: C D.

description: The ambiance and service were spot on.    I do not believe I have tasted food like this since I last visited Italy.  A memorable meal and a great Italian wine pairing.
author: Mary S.

description: Update: New owners of new location as of 7/26/2011. http://www.tablehopper.com/chatterbox/pachino-opens-in-the-pizzeria-quattro-stagioni-space-in-the-fidi/
author: Stacey H.

description: We went to Pachino Trattoria last night for dinner, loved the ambiance, and had a wonderful meal! When we walked in, we felt like we were in a small neighborhood cafe in Italy, not right in the middle of the financial district. We started with one of the daily specials - the Potato Gnocchi in Meat Sauce. The pasta was perfectly cooked and tender, covered by a marinara sauce with a delicious blend of meats. We followed the Gnocchi with a specialty white pizza featuring carmelized onions, roasted almonds, green olives, and huge dollops of mozzarella cheese - exquisite flavors, honestly the most delicious pizza we've ever had! The two dishes were so filling that we even took some of our pizza back to the hotel. We will definitely be back on our next visit to San Francisco!
author: Ellen B.

description: I am so happy to find good pizza in my neighborhood!  The crust is PERFECT.  Staff are efficient and very friendly.  This is going to be my new hang-out!  The Caesar salad is outstanding, too.....and next time I hope to have room for the tiramisu, which looked yummy.
author: Ann T.

description: Very good true Italian pizza.  My only complaint is that their knives are too dull.
author: D C.

description: I ate here on my last night of a week long business trip to San Francisco. I really have nothing bad to say about this place--I had an excellent meal. The decor was simple--dark with exposed brick interior; the place was small and smelled great; and peeking at other diners' plates elicited serious salivation. Everything looked delicious, and my friend and I settled on the grilled calimari appetizer, which was great--tender and flavorful! Although many menu options looked wonderful, I opted for a favorite dish (but seldom-ordered)--spaghetti carbonara. The half order was great (I could have eaten the whole order but restrained myself, and was proud of it!) and not expensive. The chocolate mousse for dessert was also lovely. Our waiter, I believe, was the owner, and he was extremely professional and courteous without being aloof, inattentive, or, on the other hand, overbearing. Though the immediate surroundings leave something to be desired, if you find yourself in the area I recommend this place, and I would absolutely return for a meal during my next trip to San Francisco. The pizza did look amazing!
author: Corinna L.
